One , named [Michel Gaillon]510-michel gaillon , was hung for theft ; [[John]466-st. john of [Nantes]271-nantes]5334-john of nantes was put in irons and imprisoned for [his]5334-john of nantes fault ; and [others]985-others were likewise put in irons ; and many were whipped , both [men]1028-men and [women]1302-women ; by which means [they]2309-his three ships lived in peace and tranquillity . ”[2309-his three ships] In an account of a voyage up [this river]1085-this river , printed in [the Jesuit Relations]2311-the jesuit relations in the year 1664 , it is said : “ It was an interesting navigation for [us]5338-us in ascending [the river]905-the river from [Cap Tourment]272-cap tourment to [Quebec]16-quebec , to see on this side and on that , for the space of eight leagues , [the farms]1451-the farms and [the houses of [the company]5342-the company]5341-the houses of the company , built by [our]2314-we French , all along [these shores]5343-these shores . On the right , the seigniories of [Beauport]115-beauport , of [Notre Dames des Anges]273-notre dames des anges ; and on the left , [this beautiful Isle of [Orleans]141-orleans]5344-this beautiful isle of orleans . ”[2309-his three ships] The same traveller names among the fruits of [the country]750-the country observed at the [Isles of Richelieu]274-isles of richelieu , at [the head of [Lake St. Peter]275-lake st. peter]2313-the head of lake st. peter , “ kinds ( _ des espèces _ ) of little apples or haws ( _ semelles _ ) , and of pears , which only ripen with the frost . ”[2309-his three ships]

Night came on before [we]2314-we had passed [the high banks]2315-the high banks . [We]2314-we had come from [Montreal]15-montreal to [Quebec]16-quebec in one night . The return voyage , against [the stream]1637-the stream , takes but an hour longer . [Jacques Cartier]410-cartier , [the first white man who is known to have ascended [this river]1085-this river]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river , thus speaks of [his]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river voyage from what is now [Quebec]16-quebec to [the foot of [Lake St. Peter]275-lake st. peter]2319-the foot of lake st. peter , or about half - way to [Montreal]15-montreal : “ From the said day , the 19th , even to the 28th of the said month , [ September , 1535 ] [we]2314-we had been navigating up [the said river]5345-the said river without losing hour or day , during which time [we]2314-we had seen and found as [much country and lands]5346-much country and lands as level as [we]2314-we could desire , full of the most beautiful trees in [the world]741-the world , ”[2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river] which [he]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river goes on to describe . But [we]2314-we merely slept and woke again to find that [we]2314-we had passed through [all that country which [he]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river was eight days in sailing through]2320-all that country which he was eight days in sailing through . [He]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river must have had a troubled sleep . [We]2314-we were not long enough on [the river]905-the river to realize that it had length ; [we]2314-we got only the impression of its breadth , as if [we]2314-we had passed over [a lake]780-a lake a mile or two in breadth and several miles long , though [we]2314-we might thus have slept through [a European kingdom]2323-a european kingdom . Being at [the head of [Lake St. Peter]275-lake st. peter]2313-the head of lake st. peter , on [the above - mentioned 28th of September]2325-the above - mentioned 28th of september , dealing with [the natives]2326-the natives , [Carrier]511-carrier says : “ [We]2314-we inquired of [them]2326-the natives by signs if this was the route to [Hochelaga]227-hochelaga [ [Montreal]15-montreal ] ; and [they]2326-the natives answered that it was , and that there were yet three days ’ journeys to go there . ”[511-carrier] [He]2317-the first white man who is known to have ascended this river finally arrived at [Hochelaga]227-hochelaga on [the 2d of October]2327-the 2d of october .

When [I]0-i went on deck at dawn [we]2314-we had already passed through [Lake St. Peter]275-lake st. peter , and saw islands ahead of [us]2314-we . [[Our]2314-we boat]2328-our boat advancing with a strong and steady pulse over the calm surface , [we]2314-we felt as if [we]2314-we were permitted to be awake in the scenery of a dream . Many vivacious Lombardy poplars along [the distant shores]2329-the distant shores gave [them]2329-the distant shores a novel and lively , though artificial , look , and contrasted strangely with the slender and graceful elms on both shores and [islands]2330-islands . [The church of [Varennes]276-varennes]2331-the church of varennes , fifteen miles from [Montreal]15-montreal , was conspicuous at a great distance before [us]2314-we , appearing to belong to , and rise out of , [the river]905-the river ; and now , and before , [Mount Royal]57-mount royal indicated where [the city]903-the city was . [We]2314-we arrived about seven o’clock , and set forth immediately to ascend [the mountain]1615-the mountain , two miles distant , going across [lots]2335-lots in spite of numerous signs threatening the severest penalties to [trespassers]2336-trespassers , past [an old building known as the Mac Tavish property,—Simon [Mac Tavish]512-mac tavish , [I]0-i suppose , whom [Silliman]482-silliman refers to as “ in a sense [the founder of [the Northwestern Company]5350-the northwestern company]5349-the founder of the northwestern company]5348-an old building known as the mac tavish property,—simon mac tavish , i suppose , whom silliman refers to as “ in a sense the founder of the northwestern company . ”[482-silliman] [[His]482-silliman tomb]2337-his tomb was behind in [the woods]1463-the woods , with a remarkably high wall and higher monument . [The family]1579-the family returned to [Europe]135-europe . [He]482-silliman could not have imagined how dead [he]482-silliman would be in a few years , and all the more dead and forgotten for being buried under such a mass of gloomy stone , where not even memory could get at [him]482-silliman without a crowbar . [Ah]513-ah ! [poor man]2340-poor man , with that last end of [his]2340-poor man ! However , [he]2340-poor man may have been the worthiest of [mortals]2341-mortals for aught that [I]0-i know . From [the mountain - top]2342-the mountain - top [we]2343-we got a view of [the whole city]2344-the whole city ; [the flat , fertile , extensive island]2345-the flat , fertile , extensive island ; [the noble sea of [the St. Lawrence]48-the st. lawrence]2346-the noble sea of the st. lawrence swelling into [lakes]832-lakes ; [the mountains about [St. Hyacinth]277-st. hyacinth]2348-the mountains about st. hyacinth , and in [Vermont]46-vermont and [New York]45-new york ; and the mouth of the [Ottawa]260-ottawa in the west , overlooking that [St. Ann]278-st. ann ’s where the voyageur sings [his]2340-poor man “ parting hymn , ”[2340-poor man] and bids adieu to civilization,—a name , thanks to [Moore]514-moore ’s verses , the most suggestive of poetic associations of any in [Canada]1-canada . [We]2343-we , too , climbed [the hill which [Cartier]410-cartier , first of [white men]2350-white men]2349-the hill which cartier , first of white men , ascended , and named [Mont - real]515-mont - real , ( the 3d of October , O. S. , 1535 , ) and , like [him]515-mont - real , “ [we]2343-we saw [the said river]5345-the said river as far as [we]2343-we could see , _ grand _ , _ large _ , _ et spacieux _ , going to [the southwest , ”]5352-the southwest , ”[515-mont - real] toward [that land whither Donnacona]2351-that land whither donnacona had told [the discoverer]2352-the discoverer that [he]2340-poor man had been a month ’s journey from [Canada]1-canada , where there grew “ _ force Canelle et Girofle _ , ”[2340-poor man] much cinnamon and cloves , and where also , as [the natives]2326-the natives told [him]2340-poor man , were three [great lakes]2354-great lakes and afterward _ une mer douce_,—a sweet sea,—_de laquelle n’est mention avoir vu le bout _ , of which there is no mention to have seen the end . But instead of [an Indian town]2355-an indian town far in the interior of [a new world]2356-a new world , with guides to show [us]2343-we where [the river]905-the river came from , [we]2343-we found [a splendid and bustling stone - built city of [white men]2350-white men]2358-a splendid and bustling stone - built city of white men , and only [a few squalid Indians]2360-a few squalid indians offered to sell [us]2343-we baskets at [the Lachine Railroad Depot]279-the lachine railroad depot , and [Hochelaga]227-hochelaga is , perchance , but the fancy name of an engine company or [an eating - house]2361-an eating - house .

[We]2343-we left [Montreal Wednesday]280-montreal wednesday , the 2d of October , late in the afternoon . In [the La Prairie cars [the Yankees]888-the yankees]2362-the la prairie cars the yankees made [themselves]888-the yankees merry , imitating the cries of [the charette - drivers]2364-the charette - drivers to perfection , greatly to the amusement of [some French - Canadian travellers]2365-some french - canadian travellers , and [they]888-the yankees kept it up all the way to [Boston]8-boston . [I]0-i saw [one person on board [the boat]942-the boat at [St. John ’s]54-st. john ’s]2366-one person on board the boat at st. john ’s , and one or two more elsewhere in [Canada]1-canada , wearing homespun gray great - coats , or capotes , with conical and comical hoods , which fell back between [their]2368-they shoulders like small bags , ready to be turned up over the head when occasion required , though a hat usurped [that place]2369-that place now . [They]2368-they looked as if [they]2368-they would be convenient and proper enough as long as the coats were new and tidy , but would soon come to have a beggarly and unsightly look , akin to rags and dust - holes . [We]2343-we reached [Burlington]43-burlington early in the morning , where [the Yankees]888-the yankees tried to pass off [their]888-the yankees [Canada]1-canada coppers , but [the news - boys]2371-the news - boys knew better . Returning through [the Green Mountains]281-the green mountains , [I]0-i was reminded that [I]0-i had not seen in [Canada]1-canada such brilliant autumnal tints as [I]0-i had previously seen in [Vermont]46-vermont . Perhaps there was not yet so great and sudden a contrast with the summer heats in [the former country]2372-the former country as in [these mountain valleys]2373-these mountain valleys . As [we]2343-we were passing through [Ashburnham]26-ashburnham , by [a new white house which stood at some distance in a field]2374-a new white house which stood at some distance in a field , [one passenger]2375-one passenger exclaimed , so that all in [the car]2376-the car could hear [him]2375-one passenger , “ There , there ’s not so good [a house as that in all [Canada]1-canada]5353-a house as that in all canada ! ”[2375-one passenger] [I]0-i did not much wonder at [his]2375-one passenger remark , for there is a neatness , as well as evident prosperity , a certain elastic easiness of circumstances , so to speak , when not rich , about [a New England house]2377-a new england house , as if [the proprietor]2378-the proprietor could at least afford to make repairs in the spring , which [the Canadian houses]2379-the canadian houses do not suggest . Though of stone , they are no better constructed than [a stone barn]2380-a stone barn would be with [us]2381-us ; [the only building , except [the chateau , on which money and taste]2383-the chateau , on which money and taste are expended , being [the church]980-the church]2382-the only building , except the chateau , on which money and taste are expended , being the church . In [Canada]1-canada [an ordinary New England house]2385-an ordinary new england house would be mistaken for [the chateau]2386-the chateau , and while [every village here]2387-every village here contains [at least several gentlemen]2388-at least several gentlemen or “ [squires]5354-squires , ”[2388-at least several gentlemen] _ there _ there is but one to a seigniory .

[I]0-i got [home]867-home this Thursday evening , having spent just one week in [Canada]1-canada and travelled eleven hundred miles . The whole expense of this journey , including two guide - books and a map , which cost one dollar twelve and a half cents , was twelve dollars seventy - five cents . [I]0-i do not suppose that [I]0-i have seen [all British America]2390-all british america ; that could not be done by a cheap excursion , unless it were a cheap excursion to [the Icy Sea]282-the icy sea , as seen by [Hearne]517-hearne or [McKenzie]518-mckenzie , and then , no doubt , some interesting features would be omitted . [I]0-i wished to go a little way behind that word _ Canadense _ , of which [naturalists]2391-naturalists make such frequent use ; and [I]0-i should like still right well to make a longer excursion on foot through [the wilder parts of [Canada]1-canada]2392-the wilder parts of canada , which perhaps might be called [_ Iter Canadense _]283-_ iter canadense _ .

------------------------------------------------------------------------

ANTI - SLAVERY AND REFORM PAPERS .

------------------------------------------------------------------------

SLAVERY IN [MASSACHUSETTS.[3]284-massachusetts.[3 ]

Footnote 3 :

An Address , delivered at the Anti - Slavery Celebration at [Framingham]285-framingham , July 4th , 1854 .

[I]0-i lately attended a meeting of [the citizens of [Concord]24-concord]2393-the citizens of concord , expecting , as one among many , to speak on the subject of slavery in [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts ; but [I]0-i was surprised and disappointed to find that what had called [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen together was the destiny of [Nebraska]286-nebraska , and not of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts , and that what [I]0-i had to say would be entirely out of order . [I]0-i had thought that [the house]1349-the house was on fire , and not [the prairie]2396-the prairie ; but though [several of [the citizens of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2398-the citizens of massachusetts]2397-several of the citizens of massachusetts are now in [prison]2399-prison for attempting to rescue [a slave from [her]2400-a slave from her own clutches own clutches]2400-a slave from her own clutches , not [one of [the speakers at that meeting]2402-the speakers at that meeting]2401-one of the speakers at that meeting expressed regret for it , not one even referred to it . It was only the disposition of [some wild lands a thousand miles off]2403-some wild lands a thousand miles off , which appeared to concern [them]2398-the citizens of massachusetts . [The inhabitants of [Concord]24-concord]2404-the inhabitants of concord are not prepared to stand by one of [[their]2404-the inhabitants of concord own bridges]2405-their own bridges , but talk only of taking up a position on [the highlands]2406-the highlands beyond [the Yellowstone River]287-the yellowstone river . [[Our]2407-our Buttricks]2408-our buttricks and [Davises]519-davises and [Hosmers]520-hosmers are retreating thither , and [I]0-i fear that [they]2404-the inhabitants of concord will leave no [Lexington Common]288-lexington common between [them]2404-the inhabitants of concord and [the enemy]2040-the enemy . There is not [one slave in [Nebraska]286-nebraska]2410-one slave in nebraska ; there are perhaps [a million slaves in [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2411-a million slaves in massachusetts .

[They]2404-the inhabitants of concord who have been bred in [the school of politics]2412-the school of politics fail now and always to face the facts . [Their]2404-the inhabitants of concord measures are half measures and make - shifts merely . [They]2404-the inhabitants of concord put off the day of settlement indefinitely , and meanwhile the debt accumulates . Though [the Fugitive Slave Law]2413-the fugitive slave law had not been the subject of discussion on that occasion , it was at length faintly resolved by [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen , at an adjourned meeting , as [I]0-i learn , that the compromise compact of 1820 having been repudiated by [one of [the parties]2033-the parties]2415-one of the parties , “ Therefore , ... the Fugitive Slave Law of 1850 must be repealed . ”[0-i] But this is not the reason why an iniquitous law should be repealed . The fact which [the politician]2417-the politician faces is merely , that there is less honor among [thieves]2418-thieves than was supposed , and not the fact that [they]2418-thieves are [thieves]2418-thieves .

As [I]0-i had no opportunity to express [my]0-i thoughts at that meeting , will [you]2420-you allow [me]0-i to do so here ?

Again it happens that the [Boston Court - House]289-boston court - house is full of [armed men]2421-armed men , holding [prisoner]2422-prisoner and trying [a MAN]1027-a man , to find out if [he]1027-a man is not really [a SLAVE]2424-a slave . Does [any one]2425-any one think that justice or [God]521-god awaits [Mr. Loring]522-mr. loring ’s decision ? For [him]522-mr. loring to sit there deciding still , when this question is already decided from eternity to eternity , and [the unlettered slave]2426-the unlettered slave [himself]522-mr. loring , and [the multitude around]2427-the multitude around have long since heard and assented to the decision , is simply to make [himself]522-mr. loring ridiculous . [We]2428-we may be tempted to ask from whom [he]522-mr. loring received [his]522-mr. loring commission , and who [he]522-mr. loring is that received it ; what novel statutes [he]522-mr. loring obeys , and what precedents are to [him]522-mr. loring of authority . Such an arbiter ’s very existence is an impertinence . [We]2428-we do not ask [him]522-mr. loring to make up [his]522-mr. loring mind , but to make up [his]522-mr. loring pack .

[I]0-i listen to hear the voice of [a Governor]2429-a governor , [Commander - in - Chief of [the forces of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2431-the forces of massachusetts]2430-commander - in - chief of the forces of massachusetts . [I]0-i hear only the creaking of crickets and the hum of insects which now fill the summer air . [The Governor]2432-the governor ’s exploit is to review [the troops on muster days]2433-the troops on muster days . [I]0-i have seen [him]522-mr. loring on horseback , with [his]522-mr. loring hat off , listening to [a chaplain]2434-a chaplain ’s prayer . It chances that that is all [I]0-i have ever seen of [a Governor]2429-a governor . [I]0-i think that [I]0-i could manage to get along without one . If _ [he]522-mr. loring _ is not of the least use to prevent [my]0-i being kidnapped , pray of what important use is [he]522-mr. loring likely to be to [me]0-i ? When freedom is most endangered , [he]522-mr. loring dwells in the deepest obscurity . [A distinguished clergyman]2436-a distinguished clergyman told [me]0-i that [he]2436-a distinguished clergyman chose the profession of [a clergyman]2437-a clergyman , because it afforded the most leisure for literary pursuits . [I]0-i would recommend to [him]522-mr. loring the profession of [a governor]2429-a governor .

Three years ago , also , when the Simms tragedy was acted , [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , there is such [an officer]2439-an officer , if not such [a man]1027-a man , as [the Governor of [Massachusetts,—what]290-massachusetts,—what]2441-the governor of massachusetts,—what has [he]1027-a man been about the last fortnight ? Has [he]1027-a man had as much as [he]1027-a man could do to keep on the fence during this moral earthquake ? It seemed to [me]0-i that no keener satire could have been aimed at , no more cutting insult have been offered to [that man]2442-that man , than just what happened,—the absence of all inquiry after [him]2442-that man in that crisis . The worst and the most [I]0-i chance to know of [him]2442-that man is , that [he]2442-that man did not improve that opportunity to make [himself]2442-that man known , and worthily known . [He]2442-that man could at least have _ resigned _ [himself]2442-that man into fame . It appeared to be forgotten that there was such [a man]1027-a man or such [an office]2444-an office . Yet no doubt [he]2442-that man was endeavoring to fill the gubernatorial chair all the while . [He]2442-that man was [no Governor of mine]2445-no governor of mine . [He]2442-that man did not govern [me]0-i .

But at last , in the present case , [the Governor]2432-the governor was heard from . After [he]2442-that man and [the United States government]2132-the united states government had perfectly succeeded in robbing [a poor innocent black man of [his]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life liberty for life]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life , and , as far as [they]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life could , of [[his]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life Creator]2449-his creator ’s likeness in [his]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life breast , [he]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life made a speech to [his]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life accomplices , at a congratulatory supper !

[I]0-i have read a recent law of [this State]2450-this state , making it penal for [any officer of [the “ Commonwealth ”]5356-the “ commonwealth ”]5355-any officer of the “ commonwealth ”[5355-any officer of the “ commonwealth ”] to “ detain or aid in the ... detention , ”[5355-any officer of the “ commonwealth ”] anywhere within its limits , “ of [any person]5357-any person , for the reason that [he]2432-the governor is claimed as [a fugitive slave]5358-a fugitive slave . ”[5355-any officer of the “ commonwealth ”] Also , it was a matter of notoriety that a writ of replevin to take [the fugitive]2451-the fugitive out of the custody of [the United States]2-the united states Marshal could not be served , for want of sufficient force to aid [the officer]2452-the officer .

[I]0-i had thought that [the Governor]2432-the governor was , in some sense , [the executive officer of [the State]816-the state]2454-the executive officer of the state ; that it was [his]2454-the executive officer of the state business , as [a Governor]2429-a governor , to see that the laws of [the State]816-the state were executed ; while , as [a man]1027-a man , [he]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life took care that [he]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life did not , by so doing , break the laws of humanity ; but when there is any special important use for [him]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life , [he]2448-a poor innocent black man of his liberty for life is useless , or worse than useless , and permits the laws of [the State]816-the state to go unexecuted . Perhaps [I]0-i do not know what are the duties of [a Governor]2429-a governor ; but if to be [a Governor]2429-a governor requires to subject [one]936-one ’s self to so much ignominy without remedy , if it is to put a restraint upon [[my]0-i manhood]2463-my manhood , [I]0-i shall take care never to be [Governor of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2464-governor of massachusetts . [I]0-i have not read far in the statutes of [this Commonwealth]2465-this commonwealth . It is not profitable reading . [They]2466-they do not always say what is true ; and [they]2466-they do not always mean what [they]2466-they say . What [I]0-i am concerned to know is , that that [man]2119-man ’s influence and authority were on the side of [the slaveholder]2468-the slaveholder , and not of [the slave,—of the guilty]2469-the slave,—of the guilty , and not of the innocent,—of injustice , and not of justice . [I]0-i never saw [him]2119-man of whom [I]0-i speak ; indeed , [I]0-i did not know that [he]2119-man was [Governor]473-the governor general denouville until this event occurred [I]0-i heard of [him]2119-man and [Anthony Burns]523-burns at the same time , and thus , undoubtedly , most will hear of [him]2119-man . So far am [I]0-i from being governed by [him]2119-man . [I]0-i do not mean that it was anything to [his]2119-man discredit that [I]0-i had not heard of [him]2119-man , only that [I]0-i heard what [I]0-i did . The worst [I]0-i shall say of [him]2119-man is , that [he]2119-man proved no better than [the majority of [[his]2119-man constituents]2471-his constituents]2470-the majority of his constituents would be likely to prove . In [my]0-i opinion , [he]2119-man was not equal to the occasion .

[The whole military force of [the State]816-the state]2472-the whole military force of the state is at the service of [a Mr. Suttle]524-a mr. suttle , [a slaveholder from [Virginia]195-virginia]2474-a slaveholder from virginia , to enable [him]2474-a slaveholder from virginia to catch [a man whom [he]2474-a slaveholder from virginia calls [his]2474-a slaveholder from virginia property]2475-a man whom he calls his property ; but not [a soldier]1943-a soldier is offered to save [a citizen of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2477-a citizen of massachusetts from being kidnapped ! Is this what all [these soldiers]2478-these soldiers , all this _ training _ , has been for these seventy - nine years past ? Have [they]2478-these soldiers been trained merely to rob [Mexico]291-mexico and carry back [fugitive slaves]2479-fugitive slaves to [[their]2479-fugitive slaves masters]2480-their masters ?

These very nights , [I]0-i heard the sound of a drum in [[our]2481-our streets]2482-our streets . There were [men]1028-men _ training _ still ; and for what ? [I]0-i could with an effort pardon the cockerels of [Concord]24-concord for crowing still , for [they]1028-men , perchance , had not been beaten that morning ; but [I]0-i could not excuse this rub - a - dub of the “ trainers . ”[2484-the slave] [The slave]2484-the slave was carried back by exactly such as these ; [i.]2485-i. e. by [the soldier]1002-the soldier , of whom the best [you]2487-you can say in this connection is , that [he]1002-the soldier is [a fool]2488-a fool made conspicuous by a painted coat .

Three years ago , also , just a week after [the authorities of [Boston]8-boston]2489-the authorities of boston assembled to carry back [a perfectly innocent man]2490-a perfectly innocent man , and one whom [they]2489-the authorities of boston knew to be innocent , into slavery , [the inhabitants of [Concord]24-concord]2404-the inhabitants of concord caused the bells to be rung and the cannons to be fired , to celebrate [their]2404-the inhabitants of concord liberty,—and the courage and love of liberty of [[their]2404-the inhabitants of concord ancestors who fought at [the bridge]1652-the bridge]2492-their ancestors who fought at the bridge . As if _ those _ three millions had fought for the right to be free [themselves]2404-the inhabitants of concord , but to hold in slavery three millions others . Now - a - days , [men]1028-men wear [a fool’s - cap]2495-a fool’s - cap , and call [it]2495-a fool’s - cap a liberty - cap . [I]0-i do not know but there are some , who , if [they]1028-men were tied to a whipping - post , and could but get one hand free , would use it to ring the bells and fire the cannons to celebrate _ [their]1028-men _ liberty . So [some of [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen]2496-some of my townsmen took the liberty to ring and fire . That was the extent of [their]2496-some of my townsmen freedom ; and when the sound of the bells died away , [their]2496-some of my townsmen liberty died away also ; when the powder was all expended , [their]2496-some of my townsmen liberty went off with the smoke .

The joke could be no broader , if [the inmates of [the prisons]2499-the prisons]2498-the inmates of the prisons were to subscribe for all the powder to be used in such salutes , and hire [the jailers]2500-the jailers to do the firing and ringing for [them]2500-the jailers , while [they]2500-the jailers enjoyed it through the grating .

This is what [I]0-i thought about [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors .

[Every humane and intelligent inhabitant of [Concord]24-concord]2502-every humane and intelligent inhabitant of concord , when [he]2502-every humane and intelligent inhabitant of concord or [she]2503-she heard those bells and those cannons , thought not with pride of the events of the 19th of April , 1775 , but with shame of the events of the 12th of April , 1851 . But now [we]2504-we have half buried that old shame under a new one .

[Massachusetts]12-massachusetts sat waiting [Mr. Loring]522-mr. loring ’s decision , as if it could in any way affect [her]2503-she own criminality . [Her]2503-she crime , the most conspicuous and fatal crime of all , was permitting [him]522-mr. loring to be [the umpire]2505-the umpire in such a case . It was really the trial of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts . Every moment that [she]2503-she hesitated to set [this man]1573-this man free , every moment that [she]2503-she now hesitates to atone for [her]2503-she crime , [she]2503-she is convicted . [The Commissioner]2507-the commissioner on [her]2503-she case is [God]521-god ; not [Edward G. God]521-god , but simple [God]521-god .

[I]0-i wish [[my]0-i countrymen]2508-my countrymen to consider , that whatever the human law may be , neither [an individual]1366-an individual nor [a nation]2510-a nation can ever commit the least act of injustice against [the obscurest individual]2511-the obscurest individual , without having to pay the penalty for it . A government which deliberately enacts injustice , and persists in it , will at length even become the laughing - stock of [the world]741-the world .

Much has been said about American slavery , but [I]0-i think that [we]2513-we do not even yet realize what slavery is . If [I]0-i were seriously to propose to [Congress]526-congress to make mankind into sausages , [I]0-i have no doubt that [most of [the members]2515-the members]2514-most of the members would smile at [my]0-i proposition , and if any believed [me]0-i to be in earnest , [they]2514-most of the members would think that [I]0-i proposed something much worse than [Congress]526-congress had ever done . But if [any of [them]2514-most of the members]2516-any of them will tell [me]0-i that to make [a man]1027-a man into a sausage would be much worse,—would be any worse,—than to make [him]1027-a man into [[a slave,—than]292-a slave,—than]2518-a slave,—than it was to enact [the Fugitive Slave Law,—I]527-the fugitive slave law,—i will accuse [him]1027-a man of foolishness , of intellectual incapacity , of making a distinction without a difference . [The one]2519-the one is just as sensible a proposition as the other .

[I]0-i hear a good deal said about trampling this law under foot . Why , [one]936-one need not go out of [his]936-one way to do that . This law rises not to the level of the head or the reason ; its natural habitat is in the dirt . It was born and bred , and has its life , only in the dust and mire , on a level with the feet ; and [he]1027-a man who walks with freedom , and does not with [Hindoo]528-the hindoo mercy avoid treading on every venomous reptile , will inevitably tread on it , and so trample it under foot,—and [Webster]529-webster , its maker , with it , like the dirt - bug and its ball .

Recent events will be valuable as a criticism on the administration of justice in [our]2521-our midst , or , rather , as showing what are the true resources of justice in any community . It has come to this , that [the friends of liberty]2522-the friends of liberty , [the friends of [the slave]2484-the slave]2523-the friends of the slave , have shuddered when [they]2523-the friends of the slave have understood that [his]1027-a man fate was left to [the legal tribunals of [the country]750-the country]2525-the legal tribunals of the country to be decided . [Free men]2527-free men have no faith that justice will be awarded in such a case . [The judge]2528-the judge may decide this way or that ; it is a kind of accident , at best . It is evident that [he]2519-the one is not a competent authority in so important a case . It is no time , then , to be judging according to [his]2519-the one precedents , but to establish a precedent for the future . [I]0-i would much rather trust to the sentiment of [the people]1562-the people . In [their]1562-the people vote , [you]2530-you would get something of some value , at least , however small ; but in the other case , only the trammelled judgment of [an individual]1366-an individual , of no significance , be it which way it might .

It is , to some extent , fatal to [the courts]2532-the courts , when [the people]1562-the people are compelled to go behind [them]1562-the people . [I]0-i do not wish to believe that [the courts]2532-the courts were made for fair weather , and for very civil cases merely ; but think of leaving [it]2532-the courts to any court in [the land]834-the land to decide whether more than [three millions of people]2536-three millions of people , in this case , [a sixth part of [a nation]2510-a nation]2537-a sixth part of a nation , have a right to be [freemen]2539-freemen or not ? But it has been left to the courts of _ justice _ , so called,—to [the Supreme Court of the land,—and]2540-the supreme court of the land,—and , as [you]2541-you all know , recognizing no authority but the Constitution , it has decided that [the three millions]2542-the three millions are , and shall continue to be [slaves]2543-slaves . [Such judges]2544-such judges as these are merely [the inspectors of a pick - lock and murderer]2545-the inspectors of a pick - lock and murderer ’s tools , to tell [him]2544-such judges whether [they]2544-such judges are in working order or not , and there [they]2544-such judges think that [their]2544-such judges responsibility ends . There was a prior case on the docket , which [they]2544-such judges , as [judges]2546-judges appointed by [God]521-god , had no right to skip ; which having been justly settled , [they]2544-such judges would have been saved from this humiliation . It was the case of [the murderer]2547-the murderer [himself]2547-the murderer .

The law will never make [men]1028-men free ; it is [men who have got to make the law free]2549-men who have got to make the law free . [They]2549-men who have got to make the law free are [the lovers of law and order , who observe the law]2550-the lovers of law and order , who observe the law when [the government]1992-the government breaks it .

Among [human beings]2552-human beings , [the judge whose words seal the fate of [a man]1027-a man furthest into eternity]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity is not [he]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity who merely pronounces the verdict of the law , but [he]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity , whoever [he]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity may be , who , from a love of truth , and unprejudiced by any custom or enactment of [men]1028-men , utters a true opinion or _ sentence _ concerning [him]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity . [He]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity it is that _ sentences _ [him]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity . [Whoever]530-whoever can discern truth has received [his]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity commission from a higher source than [the chiefest justice in [the world]741-the world]2556-the chiefest justice in the world , who can discern only law . [He]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity finds [himself]2553-the judge whose words seal the fate of a man furthest into eternity [constituted judge of [the judge]2528-the judge]2558-constituted judge of the judge . Strange that it should be necessary to state such simple truths !

[I]0-i am more and more convinced that , with reference to any public question , it is more important to know what [the country]750-the country thinks of it , than what [the city]903-the city thinks . [The city]903-the city does not _ think _ much . On any moral question , [I]0-i would rather have the opinion of [Boxboro]531-boxboro than of [Boston]8-boston and [New York]45-new york put together . When [the former]906-the former speaks , [I]0-i feel as if [somebody _]2564-somebody _ had _ spoken , as if _ humanity _ was yet , and a reasonable being had asserted [its]903-the city rights,—as if [some unprejudiced men among [[the country]750-the country ’s hills]2567-the country ’s hills]2565-some unprejudiced men among the country ’s hills had at length turned [their]2565-some unprejudiced men among the country ’s hills attention to the subject , and by a few sensible words redeemed the reputation of the race . When , in [some obscure country town]2568-some obscure country town , [the farmers]1456-the farmers come together to [a special town]2570-a special town - meeting , to express [their]1456-the farmers opinion on some subject which is vexing [the land]834-the land , that , [I]0-i think , is the true Congress , and the most respectable one that is ever assembled in [the United States]1794-the united states .

It is evident that there are , in [this Commonwealth]2465-this commonwealth at least , [two parties]2574-two parties , becoming more and more distinct,—the party of [the city]903-the city , and [the party of [the country]750-the country]2576-the party of the country . [I]0-i know that [the country]750-the country is mean enough , but [I]0-i am glad to believe that there is a slight difference in [her]2579-she favor . But as yet , [she]2579-she has few , if any organs , through which to express [herself]2579-she . The editorials which [she]2579-she reads , like the news , come from [the seaboard]2580-the seaboard . Let [us]2581-we , [the inhabitants of [the country]750-the country]2582-the inhabitants of the country , cultivate self - respect . Let [us]2581-we not send to [the city]903-the city for aught more essential than [our]2581-we broadcloths and groceries ; or , if [we]2581-we read the opinions of [the city]903-the city , let [us]2581-we entertain opinions of [our]2581-we own .

Among measures to be adopted , [I]0-i would suggest to make as earnest and vigorous an assault on the press as has already been made , and with effect , on [the church]980-the church . [The church]980-the church has much improved within a few years ; but the press is almost , without exception , corrupt . [I]0-i believe that , in [this country]5239-this country , the press exerts a greater and a more pernicious influence than [the church]980-the church did in its worst period . [We]2581-we are not [a religious people]2590-a religious people , but [we]2581-we are [a nation of [politicians]2592-politicians]2591-a nation of politicians . [We]2581-we do not care for the Bible , but [we]2581-we do care for the newspaper . At any meeting of politicians,—like that at [Concord]24-concord the other evening , for instance,—how impertinent it would be to quote from the Bible ! how pertinent to quote from a newspaper or from the Constitution ! The newspaper is a Bible which [we]2581-we read every morning and every afternoon , standing and sitting , riding and walking . It is a Bible which [every man]2593-every man carries in [his]2593-every man pocket , which lies on every table and counter , and which the mail , and [thousands of [missionaries]2595-missionaries]2594-thousands of missionaries , are continually dispersing . It is , in short , the only book which [America]23-america has printed , and which [America]23-america reads . So wide is its influence . [The editor]2596-the editor is [a preacher whom [you]2598-you voluntarily support]2597-a preacher whom you voluntarily support . [Your]2599-your tax is commonly one cent daily , and it costs nothing for pew hire . But how [many of [these preachers]2601-these preachers]2600-many of these preachers preach the truth ? [I]0-i repeat the testimony of many [an intelligent foreigner]2602-an intelligent foreigner , as well as [my]0-i own convictions , when [I]0-i say , that probably [no country]2603-no country was ever ruled by so mean [a class of tyrants]2604-a class of tyrants as , with a few noble exceptions , are the editors of the periodical press in _ [this _ country]2605-this _ country . And as [they]2604-a class of tyrants live and rule only by [their]2604-a class of tyrants servility , and appealing to the worse , and not the better , nature of [man]2119-man , [the people who read [them]2604-a class of tyrants are in the condition of the dog that returns to [his]2119-man vomit]2607-the people who read them are in the condition of the dog that returns to his vomit .

[The _ Liberator _]293-the _ liberator _ and the _ Commonwealth _ were the only papers in [Boston]8-boston , as far as [I]0-i know , which made [themselves]2604-a class of tyrants heard in condemnation of the cowardice and meanness of [the authorities of [that city]2609-that city]2608-the authorities of that city , as exhibited in ’ 51 . The other journals , almost without exception , by [their]2604-a class of tyrants manner of referring to and speaking of [the Fugitive Slave Law]2413-the fugitive slave law , and the carrying back of [the slave Simms]2611-the slave simms , insulted the common sense of [the country]750-the country , at least . And , for the most part , [they]2604-a class of tyrants did this , [one]936-one would say , because [they]2604-a class of tyrants thought so to secure the approbation of [[their]2604-a class of tyrants patrons]2614-their patrons , not being aware that a sounder sentiment prevailed to any extent in [the heart of [the Commonwealth]2616-the commonwealth]2615-the heart of the commonwealth . [I]0-i am told that [some of [them]1051-some of them]1051-some of them have improved of late ; but [they]1051-some of them are still eminently time - serving . Such is the character [they]1051-some of them have won .

But , thank fortune , [this preacher]2618-this preacher can be even more easily reached by the weapons of [the reformer]2619-the reformer than could [the recreant priest]2620-the recreant priest . [The free men of [New England]20-new england]2621-the free men of new england have only to refrain from purchasing and reading these sheets , have only to withhold [their]2621-the free men of new england cents , to kill a score of [them]2621-the free men of new england at once . One whom [I]0-i respect told [me]0-i that [he]2618-this preacher purchased [Mitchell]533-mitchell ’s _ Citizen _ in [the cars]789-the cars , and then threw it out the window . But would not [his]2618-this preacher contempt have been more fatally expressed if [he]2618-this preacher had not bought it ?

Are [they]2621-the free men of new england Americans ? are [they]2621-the free men of new england New - Englanders ? are [[they]2621-the free men of new england inhabitants of [Lexington]294-lexington and [Concord]24-concord and [Framingham]285-framingham]2623-they inhabitants of lexington and concord and framingham , who read and support the [Boston]8-boston _ Post , Mail , Journal , Advertiser , Courier _ , and _ Times ? _ Are these the Flags of [[our]2624-our Union]2625-our union ? [I]0-i am not [a newspaper reader]2626-a newspaper reader , and may omit to name the worst .

Could slavery suggest a more complete servility than some of these journals exhibit ? Is there any dust which [their]2621-the free men of new england conduct does not lick , and make fouler still with its slime ? [I]0-i do not know whether [the Boston _ Herald _]2627-the boston _ herald _ is still in existence , but [I]0-i remember to have seen it about [the streets]995-the streets when [Simms]534-simms was carried off . Did it not act its part well,—serve [its master]2629-its master faithfully ? How could it have gone lower on its belly ? How can [a man]1027-a man stoop lower than [he]1027-a man is low ? do more than put [his]1027-a man extremities in the place of the head [he]1027-a man has ? than make [his]1027-a man head [his]1027-a man lower extremity ? When [I]0-i have taken up this paper with [my]0-i cuffs turned up , [I]0-i have heard the gurgling of [the sewer]2631-the sewer through every column . [I]0-i have felt that [I]0-i was handling a paper picked out of the public gutters , a leaf from the gospel of [the gambling - house]2632-the gambling - house , [the groggery]2633-the groggery , and [the brothel]2634-the brothel , harmonizing with the gospel of [the Merchants]2635-the merchants ’ Exchange .

[The majority of [the men of [the North]2638-the north]2637-the men of the north]2636-the majority of the men of the north , and of [the South]1040-the south and [East]295-east and [West]187-the west , are not [men of principle]2640-men of principle . If [they]2636-the majority of the men of the north vote , [they]2636-the majority of the men of the north do not send [men]1028-men to [Congress]526-congress on errands of humanity ; but while [[their]2636-the majority of the men of the north brothers]2642-their brothers and [sisters]2643-sisters are being scourged and hung for loving liberty , while — [I]0-i might here insert all that slavery implies and is,—it is the mismanagement of wood and iron and stone and gold which concerns [them]2642-their brothers . Do what [you]2644-you will , O Government , with [[my]0-i wife]2645-my wife and [children]1123-children , [[my]0-i mother]2647-my mother and [brother]2648-brother , [[my]0-i father]2649-my father and [sister]2650-sister , [I]0-i will obey [your]2644-you commands to the letter . It will indeed grieve [me]0-i if [you]2644-you hurt [them]2642-their brothers , if [you]2644-you deliver [them]2642-their brothers to [overseers]2651-overseers to be hunted by hounds or to be whipped to death ; but , nevertheless , [I]0-i will peaceably pursue [my]0-i chosen calling on [this fair earth]2652-this fair earth , until perchance , one day , when [I]0-i have put on mourning for [them]2642-their brothers dead , [I]0-i shall have persuaded [you]2653-you to relent . Such is the attitude , such are the words of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts .

Rather than do thus , [I]0-i need not say what match [I]0-i would touch , what system endeavor to blow up ; but as [I]0-i love [my]0-i life , [I]0-i would side with the light , and let the dark earth roll from under [me]0-i , calling [[my]0-i mother]2647-my mother and [[my]0-i brother]2655-my brother to follow .

[I]0-i would remind [[my]0-i countrymen]2508-my countrymen , that [they]2508-my countrymen are to be [men]1028-men first , and [Americans]2658-americans only at a late and convenient hour . No matter how valuable law may be to protect [your]2659-your property , even to keep soul and body together , if it do not keep [you]2659-your and humanity together .

[I]0-i am sorry to say , that [I]0-i doubt if there is [a judge in [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts who is prepared to resign [[his]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office office]2661-his office]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office , and get [his]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office living innocently , whenever it is required of [him]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office to pass sentence under a law which is merely contrary to the law of [God]521-god . [I]0-i am compelled to see that [they]2508-my countrymen put [themselves]2508-my countrymen , or rather , are by character , in this respect , exactly on a level with [the marine who discharges [his]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office musket in any direction [he]2660-a judge in massachusetts who is prepared to resign his office is ordered to]2662-the marine who discharges his musket in any direction he is ordered to . [They]2508-my countrymen are just as much tools , and as [little men]2663-little men . Certainly , [they]2508-my countrymen are not the more to be respected , because [[their]2508-my countrymen master]2664-their master enslaves [their]2508-my countrymen understandings and consciences , instead of [their]2508-my countrymen bodies .

[The judges]2665-the judges and lawyers,—simply as such , [I]0-i mean,—and [all men of expediency]2666-all men of expediency , try this case by a very low and incompetent standard . [They]2665-the judges consider , not whether [the Fugitive Slave Law]2413-the fugitive slave law is right , but whether it is what [they]2665-the judges call _ constitutional _ . Is virtue constitutional , or vice ? Is equity constitutional , or iniquity ? In important moral and vital questions , like this , it is just as impertinent to ask whether a law is constitutional or not , as to ask whether it is profitable or not . [They]2508-my countrymen persist in being [the servants of the worst of [men]1028-men]2668-the servants of the worst of men , and not [the servants of humanity]2670-the servants of humanity . The question is , not whether [you]2671-your or [[your]2671-your grandfather]2672-your grandfather , seventy years ago , did not enter into an agreement to serve [the Devil]2673-the devil , and that service is not accordingly now due ; but whether [you]2671-your will not now , for once and at last , serve [God,—in]535-god,—in spite of [your]2671-your own past recreancy , or that of [[your]2671-your ancestor,—by]2674-your ancestor,—by obeying that eternal and only just CONSTITUTION , which [He]2674-your ancestor,—by , and not any [Jefferson]536-jefferson or [Adams]537-adams , has written in [your]2671-your being .

The amount of it is , if the majority vote [the Devil]436-the devil to be [God]521-god , [the minority]2675-the minority will live and behave accordingly,—and obey [the successful candidate]2676-the successful candidate , trusting that , some time or other , by [some Speaker]2677-some speaker ’s casting - vote , perhaps , [they]2675-the minority may reinstate [God]521-god . This is the highest principle [I]0-i can get out or invent for [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors . [These men]1186-these men act as if [they]1186-these men believed that [they]1186-these men could safely slide down [a hill]819-a hill a little way — or a good way — and would surely come to a place , by and by , where [they]1186-these men could begin to slide up again . This is expediency , or choosing that course which offers the slightest obstacles to the feet , that is , a down - hill one . But there is no such thing as accomplishing a righteous reform by the use of “ expediency . ”[538-mammon] There is no such thing as sliding up hill . In morals , [the only sliders]2681-the only sliders are backsliders .

Thus [we]2682-we steadily worship [Mammon]538-mammon , both [school and state]2683-school and state and [church]962-church , and on the seventh day curse [God]521-god with a tintamar from one end of the Union to the other .

Will [mankind]2685-mankind never learn that policy is not morality,—that it never secures any moral right , but considers merely what is expedient ? chooses [the available candidate,—who]2686-the available candidate,—who is invariably [the Devil,—and]539-the devil,—and what right have [[his]539-the devil,—and constituents]2471-his constituents to be surprised , because [the Devil]436-the devil does not behave like [an angel of light]2688-an angel of light ? What is wanted is [men]1028-men , not of policy , but of probity,—who recognize a higher law than the Constitution , or the decision of [the majority]2690-the majority . The fate of [the country]750-the country does not depend on how [you]2692-you vote at the polls,—the [worst man]2693-worst man is as strong as the best at that game ; it does not depend on what kind of paper [you]2692-you drop into the ballot - box once a year , but on what kind of man [you]2692-you drop from [[your]2692-you chamber]2694-your chamber into [the street]5231-the street every morning .

What should concern [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts is not [the Nebraska Bill]540-the nebraska bill , nor [the Fugitive Slave Bill]541-the fugitive slave bill , but [her]541-the fugitive slave bill own slaveholding and servility . Let [the State]816-the state dissolve [her]541-the fugitive slave bill union with [the slaveholder]2468-the slaveholder . [She]541-the fugitive slave bill may wriggle and hesitate , and ask leave to read the Constitution once more ; but [she]541-the fugitive slave bill can find no respectable law or precedent which sanctions the continuance of such [a Union]2698-a union for an instant .

Let [each inhabitant of [the State]816-the state]2699-each inhabitant of the state dissolve [his]2699-each inhabitant of the state union with [her]541-the fugitive slave bill , as long as [she]541-the fugitive slave bill delays to do [her]541-the fugitive slave bill duty .

The events of the past month teach [me]0-i to distrust Fame . [I]0-i see that [she]541-the fugitive slave bill does not finely discriminate , but coarsely hurrahs . [She]541-the fugitive slave bill considers not the simple heroism of an action , but only as it is connected with its apparent consequences . [She]541-the fugitive slave bill praises till [she]541-the fugitive slave bill is hoarse the easy exploit of the [Boston]8-boston tea party , but will be comparatively silent about the braver and more disinterestedly heroic attack on [the Boston Court - House]289-boston court - house , simply because it was unsuccessful !

[Covered]542-covered with disgrace , [the State]816-the state has sat down coolly to try for [their]2699-each inhabitant of the state lives and liberties [the men who attempted to do its duty for [it]289-boston court - house]2702-the men who attempted to do its duty for it . And this is called _ justice _ ! [They]2699-each inhabitant of the state who have shown that [they]2699-each inhabitant of the state can behave particularly well may perchance be put under bonds for _ [their]2699-each inhabitant of the state good behavior _ . [They]2699-each inhabitant of the state whom truth requires at present to plead guilty are , of all [the inhabitants of [the State]816-the state]2703-the inhabitants of the state , pre - eminently innocent . While [the Governor]2432-the governor , and [the Mayor]2706-the mayor , and [countless officers of [the Commonwealth]2616-the commonwealth]2707-countless officers of the commonwealth are at large , [the champions of liberty]2709-the champions of liberty are imprisoned .

Only [they]2709-the champions of liberty are guiltless , who commit the crime of contempt of such a court . It behooves [every man]2593-every man to see that [his]2593-every man influence is on the side of justice , and let [the courts]2532-the courts make [their]2532-the courts own characters . [My]0-i sympathies in this case are wholly with [the accused]2712-the accused , and wholly against [[their]2532-the courts accusers]2713-their accusers and [judges]2546-judges . Justice is sweet and musical ; but injustice is harsh and discordant . [The judge]2528-the judge still sits grinding at [his]2528-the judge organ , but it yields no music , and [we]2716-we hear only the sound of the handle . [He]2528-the judge believes that all the music resides in the handle , and [the crowd]1111-the crowd toss [him]2528-the judge [their]1111-the crowd coppers the same as before .

Do [you]2718-you suppose that that [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts which is now doing these things,—which hesitates to crown [these men]1186-these men , [some of whose [lawyers]2721-lawyers , and even [judges]2546-judges , perchance]2720-some of whose lawyers , and even judges , perchance , may be driven to take refuge in some poor quibble , that [they]2720-some of whose lawyers , and even judges , perchance may not wholly outrage [their]2720-some of whose lawyers , and even judges , perchance instinctive sense of justice,—do [you]2718-you suppose that [she]2723-she is anything but base and servile ? that [she]2723-she is [the champion of liberty]2724-the champion of liberty ?

Show [me]0-i a free state , and a court truly of justice , and [I]0-i will fight for [them]2720-some of whose lawyers , and even judges , perchance , if need be ; but show [me]0-i [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts , and [I]0-i refuse [her]2723-she [my]0-i allegiance , and express contempt for [her]2723-she courts .

The effect of [a good government]2725-a good government is to make life more valuable,—of [a bad one]2726-a bad one , to make it less valuable . [We]2727-we can afford that railroad , and all merely material stock , should lose some of its value , for that only compels [us]2727-we to live more simply and economically ; but suppose that the value of life itself should be diminished ! How can [we]2727-we make a less demand on [man]2119-man and nature , how live more economically in respect to virtue and all noble qualities , than [we]2727-we do ? [I]0-i have lived for the last month,—and [I]0-i think that [every man in [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2729-every man in massachusetts capable of the sentiment of patriotism must have had a similar experience,—with the sense of having suffered a vast and indefinite loss . [I]0-i did not know at first what ailed [me]0-i . At last it occurred to [me]0-i that what [I]0-i had lost was [a country]1235-a country . [I]0-i had never respected the government near to which [I]0-i lived , but [I]0-i had foolishly thought that [I]0-i might manage to live here , minding [my]0-i private affairs , and forget it . For [my]0-i part , [my]0-i old and worthiest pursuits have lost [I]0-i can not say how much of [their]2731-their attraction , and [I]0-i feel that [my]0-i investment in life here is worth many per cent less since [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts last deliberately sent back [an innocent man]2732-an innocent man , [Anthony Burns]523-burns , to slavery . [I]0-i dwelt before , perhaps , in the illusion that [my]0-i life passed somewhere only _ between _ heaven and hell , but now [I]0-i can not persuade [myself]0-i that [I]0-i do not dwell _ wholly within _ hell . The site of [that political organization called [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2733-that political organization called massachusetts is to [me]0-i morally covered with volcanic scoriæ and cinders , such as [Milton]543-milton describes in [the infernal regions]2734-the infernal regions . If there is any hell more unprincipled than [[our]2735-our rulers]2736-our rulers , and [we]2735-our , the ruled , [I]0-i feel curious to see it . Life itself being worth less , all things with it , which [minister to it]2737-minister to it , are worth less . Suppose [you]2738-your have a small library , with pictures to adorn [the walls,—a garden]2739-the walls,—a garden laid out around,—and contemplate scientific and literary pursuits , and discover all at once that [[your]2738-your villa]2740-your villa , with all its contents , is located in hell , and that the justice of the peace has a cloven foot and a forked tail,—do not these things suddenly lose [their]2741-their value in [your]2738-your eyes ?

[I]0-i feel that , to some extent , [the State]816-the state has fatally interfered with [my]0-i lawful business . It has not only interrupted [me]0-i in [my]0-i passage through [Court Street]298-court street on errands of trade , but it has interrupted [me]0-i and [every man on [his]2743-every man on his onward and upward path onward and upward path]2743-every man on his onward and upward path , on which [he]2743-every man on his onward and upward path had trusted soon to leave [Court Street]298-court street far behind . What right had it to remind [me]0-i of [Court Street]298-court street ? [I]0-i have found that hollow which even [I]0-i had relied on for solid .

[I]0-i am surprised to see [men]1028-men going about [their]1028-men business as if nothing had happened . [I]0-i say to [myself]0-i , “ Unfortunates ! [they]1028-men have not heard the news . ”[0-i] [I]0-i am surprised that [the man whom [I]0-i just met on horseback]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback should be so earnest to overtake [his]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback newly bought cows running away,—since [all property]2746-all property is insecure , and if [they]2746-all property do not run away again , [they]2746-all property may be taken away from [him]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback when [he]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback gets [them]2746-all property . [Fool]544-fool ! does [he]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback not know that [his]2745-the man whom i just met on horseback seed - corn is worth less this year,—that all beneficent harvests fail as [you]2747-you approach [the empire of [hell]2749-hell]2748-the empire of hell ? [No prudent man]2750-no prudent man will build [a stone house]2751-a stone house under these circumstances , or engage in any peaceful enterprise which it requires a long time to accomplish . Art is as long as ever , but life is more interrupted and less available for [a man]1027-a man ’s proper pursuits . It is not an era of repose . [We]2753-we have used up all [our]2753-we inherited freedom . If [we]2753-we would save [our]2753-we lives , [we]2753-we must fight for [them]2746-all property .

[I]0-i walk toward one of [[our]2753-we ponds]2754-our ponds ; but what signifies the beauty of nature when [men]1028-men are base ? [We]2753-we walk to [lakes]832-lakes to see [our]2753-we serenity reflected in [them]2746-all property ; when [we]2753-we are not serene , [we]2753-we go not to [them]2746-all property . Who can be serene in [a country where both [the rulers and the ruled]2758-the rulers and the ruled are without principle]2757-a country where both the rulers and the ruled are without principle ? The remembrance of [[my]0-i country]1538-my country spoils [my]0-i walk . [My]0-i thoughts are murder to [the State]816-the state , and involuntarily go plotting against [her]2761-her .

But it chanced the other day that [I]0-i scented a white water - lily , and a season [I]0-i had waited for had arrived . It is the emblem of purity . It bursts up so pure and fair to the eye , and so sweet to the scent , as if to show [us]2753-we what purity and sweetness reside in , and can be extracted from , the slime and muck of [earth]2762-earth . [I]0-i think [I]0-i have plucked the first one that has opened for a mile . What confirmation of [our]2753-we hopes is in the fragrance of this flower ! [I]0-i shall not so soon despair of [the world]741-the world for it , notwithstanding slavery , and the cowardice and want of principle of [Northern men]2764-northern men . It suggests what kind of laws have prevailed longest and widest , and still prevail , and that the time may come when [man]2119-man ’s deeds will smell as sweet . Such is the odor which the plant emits . If Nature can compound this fragrance still annually , [I]0-i shall believe [her]2761-her still young and full of vigor , [her]2761-her integrity and genius unimpaired , and that there is virtue even in [man]2119-man , too , who is fitted to perceive and love it . It reminds [me]0-i that [Nature]545-nature has been partner to no [Missouri]299-missouri Compromise . [I]0-i scent no compromise in the fragrance of the water - lily . It is not a _ Nymphæa _ DOUGLASSII . In it , the sweet , and pure , and innocent are wholly sundered from the obscene and baleful . [I]0-i do not scent in this the time - serving irresolution of [a Massachusetts Governor]2767-a massachusetts governor , nor of [a Boston Mayor]2768-a boston mayor . So behave that the odor of [your]2769-your actions may enhance the general sweetness of the atmosphere , that when [we]2770-we behold or scent a flower , [we]2770-we may not be reminded how inconsistent [your]2769-your deeds are with it ; for all odor is but one form of advertisement of a moral quality , and if fair actions had not been performed , the lily would not smell sweet . The foul slime stands for the sloth and vice of [man]2119-man , the decay of humanity ; the fragrant flower that springs from it , for the purity and courage which are immortal .

Slavery and servility have produced no sweet - scented flower annually , to charm the senses of [men]1028-men , for [they]1028-men have no real life : [they]1028-men are merely a decaying and a death , offensive to all healthy nostrils . [We]2770-we do not complain that [they]1028-men _ live _ , but that [they]1028-men do not _ get buried _ . Let the living bury [them]1028-men ; even [they]1028-men are good for manure .

------------------------------------------------------------------------

PRAYERS .

Not with fond shekels of the tested gold , Nor gems whose rates are either rich or poor , As fancy values [them]1028-men : but with true prayers , That shall be up at heaven , and enter [there Ere]2773-there ere sunrise ; prayers from preserved souls , From fasting maids , whose minds are dedicate To nothing temporal . [SHAKESPEARE]546-shakespeare .

[Pythagoras]547-pythagoras said that the time when [men]1028-men are honestest , is when [they]1028-men present [themselves]1028-men before [the gods]2775-the gods . If [we]2770-we can overhear the prayer , [we]2770-we shall know [the man]1697-the man . But prayers are not made to be overheard , or to be printed , so that [we]2770-we seldom have the prayer otherwise than it can be inferred from [the man]1697-the man and [his]1697-the man fortunes , which are the answer to the prayer , and always accord with it . Yet there are scattered about in [the earth]1074-the earth a few records of these devout hours , which it would edify [us]2779-us to read , could [they]1028-men be collected in a more catholic spirit than the wretched and repulsive volumes which usurp that name . Let [us]2779-us not have the prayers of [one sect]2780-one sect , nor of [the Christian Church]2781-the christian church , but of [men in all ages and religions]2782-men in all ages and religions , who have prayed well . The prayer of [Jesus]548-jesus is , as it deserves , become a form for the human race . [Many men]2783-many men have contributed a single expression , a single word to the language of devotion , which is immediately caught and stereotyped in the prayers of [[their]2783-many men church and [nation]2785-nation]2784-their church and nation . Among the remains of [Euripides]549-euripides , [we]2779-us have this prayer : “ [Thou]548-jesus God of all ! infuse light into the souls of [men]1028-men , whereby [they]1028-men may be enabled to know what is the root from whence all [their]1028-men evils spring , and by what means [they]1028-men may avoid [them]1028-men . ”[2779-us] In the Phædrus of [Plato]550-plato , [we]2779-us find this petition in the mouth of [Socrates]551-socrates : “ O gracious Pan ! and [[ye]5360-ye other gods who preside over [this place]5313-this place]5361-ye other gods who preside over this place ! grant that [I]2779-us may be beautiful within ; and that those external things which [I]2779-us have may be such as may best agree with a right internal disposition of mind ; and that [I]2779-us may account [him]552-wacic the caliph to be rich , who is wise and just . ”[2779-us] [Wacic the Caliph]552-wacic the caliph , who died A. D. 845 , ended [his]552-wacic the caliph life , [the Arabian historians]2786-the arabian historians tell [us]2779-us , with these words : “ O [thou]5363-thee whose kingdom never passes away , pity [one whose dignity is so transient]5364-one whose dignity is so transient . ”[2786-the arabian historians] But what led [us]2779-us to these remembrances was the happy accident which , in this undevout age , lately brought [us]2779-us acquainted with two or three diaries , which attest , if there be need of attestation , the eternity of the sentiment and its equality to [itself]2787-itself through all the variety of expression . The first is the prayer of [a deaf and dumb boy]2788-a deaf and dumb boy .

“ When [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy long - attached friend]5365-my long - attached friend comes to [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy have pleasure to converse with [him]5365-my long - attached friend , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy rejoice to pass [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy eyes over [his]5365-my long - attached friend countenance ; but soon [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am weary of spending [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy time causelessly and unimproved , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy desire to leave [him]5365-my long - attached friend ( _ but not in rudeness _ ) , because [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy wish to be engaged in [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy business . But [thou]5363-thee , O [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy Father]2649-my father , knowest [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy always delight to [commune]5367-commune with [thee]5363-thee in [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy lone and silent heart ; [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am never full of [thee]5363-thee ; [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am never weary of [thee]5363-thee ; [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am always desiring [thee]5363-thee . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy hunger with strong hope and affection for [thee]5363-thee , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy thirst for [thy]5363-thee grace and spirit .[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

“ When [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy go to visit [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy friends]5368-my friends , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy must put on [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy best garments , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy must think of [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy manner to please [them]5368-my friends . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am tired to stay long , because [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy mind is not free , and [they]5368-my friends sometimes talk gossip with [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy . But , O [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy Father]2649-my father , [thou]5363-thee visitest [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy in [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy work , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy can lift up [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy desires to [thee]5363-thee , and [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy heart is cheered and at rest with [thy]5363-thee presence , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am always alone with [thee]5363-thee , _ and [thou]5363-thee dost not steal [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy time by foolishness _ . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy always ask in [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy heart , Where can [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy find [thee]5363-thee ? ”[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

The next is a voice out of a solitude as strict and sacred as that in which nature had isolated this eloquent mute .

“ [[My]2788-a deaf and dumb boy Father]2649-my father , when [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy can not be cheerful or happy , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy can be true and obedient , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy will not forget that joy has been , and may still be . If there is no hour of solitude granted [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , still [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy will commune with [thee]5363-thee . If [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy may not search out and pierce [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy thought , so much the more may [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy living praise [thee]5363-thee . At whatever price , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy must be alone with [thee]5363-thee ; this must be the demand [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy make . These _ duties _ are not the life , but the means which enable [us]5371-we to show forth the life . So must [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy take up this cross , and bear it willingly . Why should [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy feel reproved when [a busy one]5372-a busy one enters [the room]1352-the room ? [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am not idle , though [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy sit with folded hands ; but instantly [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy must seek some cover . For that shame [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy reprove [myself]2788-a deaf and dumb boy . Are [they]5374-they only [the valuable members of [society who labor to dress and feed it]5376-society who labor to dress and feed it]5375-the valuable members of society who labor to dress and feed it ? Shall [we]5371-we never ask the aim of all this hurry and foam , of this aimless activity ? Let the purpose for which [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy live be always before [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy ; let every thought and word go to confirm and illuminate that end ; namely , that [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy must become near and dear to [thee]5363-thee ; that now [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy am beyond the reach of all but [thee]5363-thee .[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

“ How can [we]5371-we not be reconciled to [thy]5363-thee will ? [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy will know the joy of giving to [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy friend]2015-my friend the dearest treasure [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy have . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy know that sorrow comes not at once only . [We]5371-we can not meet it , and say , now it is overcome , but again , and yet again its flood pours over [us]5371-we , and as full as at first .[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

“ If but this tedious battle could be fought , Like [[Sparta]553-sparta ’s heroes]5378-sparta ’s heroes at [one rocky pass]5379-one rocky pass , ‘ One day be spent in dying , ’ [men]1028-men had sought The spot and been cut down like mower ’s grass . ”[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

The next is all in metrical form . It is the aspiration of a different mind , in quite other regions of power and duty , yet [they]2789-they all accord at last .

“ [Great God]554-god , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy ask [thee]5363-thee for no meaner pelf Than that [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy may not disappoint [myself]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , That in [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy action [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy may soar as high As [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy can now discern with this clear eye .[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

“ And next in value , which [thy]5363-thee kindness lends , That [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy may greatly disappoint [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy friends]5368-my friends , [Howe’er]555-howe’er [they]5368-my friends think or hope that it may be , [They]5368-my friends may not dream how thou’st distinguished [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy .[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

“ That [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy weak hand may equal [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy firm faith , And [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy life practise more than [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy tongue saith ; That [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy low conduct may not show , Nor [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy relenting lines , That [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy [thy]5363-thee purpose did not know , Or overrated [thy]5363-thee designs . ”[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

The last of the four orisons is written in a singularly calm and healthful spirit , and contains this petition : —

“ [[My]2788-a deaf and dumb boy Father]2649-my father ! [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy now come to [thee]5363-thee with a desire to thank [thee]5363-thee for the continuance of [our]5383-our love , the one for the other . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy feel that without [thy]5363-thee love in [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy should be alone here in the flesh . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy can not express [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy gratitude for what [thou]5363-thee hast been and continuest to be to [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy . But [thou]5363-thee knowest what [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy feelings are . When naught on earth seemeth pleasant to [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , [thou]5363-thee dost make [thyself]5363-thee known to [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , and teach [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy that which is needful for [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , and dost cheer [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy travels on . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy know that [thou]5363-thee hast not created [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy and placed [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy here on [earth]2762-earth , amidst its toils and troubles , and the follies of those around [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , and told [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy to be like thyself , when [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy see so little of [thee]5363-thee here to profit by ; [thou]5363-thee hast not done this , and then left [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy to [myself]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , [a poor , weak man]5385-a poor , weak man , scarcely able to earn [my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy bread . No ; [thou]5363-thee art [[my]2788-a deaf and dumb boy Father]2649-my father , and [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy will love [thee]5363-thee , for [thou]5363-thee didst first love [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , and lovest [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy still . [We]5387-we will ever be [parent]5388-parent and [child]5389-child . [Wilt]556-wilt [thou]5363-thee give [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy strength to persevere in this great work of redemption . [Wilt]556-wilt [thou]5363-thee show [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy the true means of accomplishing it .... [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy thank [thee]5363-thee for the knowledge that [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy have attained of [thee]5363-thee by [[thy]5363-thee sons who have been before [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , and especially for [him]5390-thy sons who have been before me , and especially for him who brought me so perfect a type of thy goodness and love to men who brought [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy so perfect a type of [thy]5363-thee goodness and love to [men]1028-men]5390-thy sons who have been before me , and especially for him who brought me so perfect a type of thy goodness and love to men .... [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy know that [thou]5363-thee wilt deal with [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy as [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy deserve . [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy place [myself]2788-a deaf and dumb boy , therefore in [thy]5363-thee hand , knowing that [thou]5363-thee wilt keep [me]2788-a deaf and dumb boy from all harm so long as [I]2788-a deaf and dumb boy consent to live under [thy]5363-thee protecting care . ”[2788-a deaf and dumb boy]

Let these few scattered leaves , which a chance , as [men]1028-men say , but which to [us]2791-we shall be holy , brought under [our]2791-we eye nearly at the same moment , stand as an example of innumerable similar expressions which [no mortal witness]2792-no mortal witness has reported , and be a sign of the times . Might [they]1028-men be suggestion to many a heart of yet higher secret experiences which are ineffable ! But [we]2791-we must not tie up the rosary on which [we]2791-we have strung these few white beads , without adding a pearl of great price from that book of prayer , the “ Confessions of [Saint Augustine]557-saint augustine . ”[0-i]

“ And being admonished to reflect upon [myself]0-i , [I]0-i entered into the very inward parts of [my]0-i soul , by [thy]5363-thee conduct ; and [I]0-i was able to do it , because now [thou]5363-thee wert become [[my]0-i helper]5392-my helper . [I]0-i entered and discerned with the eye of [my]0-i soul ( such as it was ) , even beyond [my]0-i soul and mind itself the Light unchangeable . Not this vulgar light which all flesh may look upon , nor as it were a greater of the same kind , as though the brightness of this should be manifold greater and with its greatness take up all space . Not such was this light , but other , yea , far other from all these . Neither was it so above [my]0-i understanding , as oil swims above water , or as [the heaven]5393-the heaven is above [the earth]1074-the earth .
