But it is above [me]0-i , because it made [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i am under it , because [I]0-i was made by it . [He]5395-he that knows truth or verity , knows what that Light is , and [he]5395-he that knows it , knows eternity , and it is known by charity . [O eternal Verity]558-o eternal verity ! and true [Charity]559-charity ! and dear Eternity ! [thou]5363-thee art [[my]0-i God]5396-my god , to [thee]5363-thee do [I]0-i sigh day and night . [Thee]5363-thee when [I]0-i first knew , [thou]5363-thee liftedst [me]0-i up that [I]0-i might see there was what [I]0-i might see , and that [I]0-i was not yet such as to see . And [thou]5363-thee didst beat back [my]0-i weak sight upon [myself]0-i , shooting out beams upon [me]0-i after a vehement manner , and [I]0-i even trembled between love and horror , and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i to be far off , and even in the very region of dissimilitude from [thee]5363-thee . ”[0-i]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE.[4 ]

Footnote 4 :

Æsthetic Papers , No . I. [Boston]8-boston , 1849 .

[I]0-i heartily accept [the motto,—“That government]5397-the motto,—“that government is best which governs least ”[0-i] ; and [I]0-i should like to see it acted up to more rapidly and systematically . Carried out , it finally amounts to this , which also [I]0-i believe,—“That government is best which governs not at all ”[0-i] ; and when [men]1028-men are prepared for it , that will be the kind of government which [they]1028-men will have . [Government]2794-government is at best but an expedient ; but [most governments]2795-most governments are usually , and [all governments]2796-all governments are sometimes , inexpedient . The objections which have been brought against [a standing army]2797-a standing army , and [they]2795-most governments are many and weighty , and deserve to prevail , may also at last be brought against a standing government . [The standing army]2798-the standing army is only an arm of [the standing government]2799-the standing government . The government itself , which is only the mode which [the people]1562-the people have chosen to execute [their]1562-the people will , is equally liable to be abused and perverted before [the people]1562-the people can act through it . Witness the present Mexican war , the work of comparatively [a few individuals using [the standing government]2799-the standing government]2802-a few individuals using the standing government as [their]2802-a few individuals using the standing government tool ; for , in the outset , [the people]1562-the people would not have consented to this measure .

This American government,—what is it but a tradition , though a recent one , endeavoring to transmit itself unimpaired to posterity , but each instant losing some of its integrity ? It has not the vitality and force of [a single living man]2805-a single living man ; for [a single man]2806-a single man can bend it to [his]2806-a single man will . It is a sort of wooden gun to [the people [themselves]2807-the people themselves]2807-the people themselves . But it is not the less necessary for this ; for [the people]1562-the people must have some complicated machinery or other , and hear its din , to satisfy that idea of government which [they]2802-a few individuals using the standing government have . Governments show thus how successfully [men]1028-men can be imposed on , even impose on [themselves]1028-men , for [their]1028-men own advantage . It is excellent , [we]2810-we must all allow . Yet this government never of itself furthered any enterprise , but by the alacrity with which it got out of its way . _ It _ does not keep [the country]750-the country free . _ It _ does not settle [the West]1801-the west . _ It _ does not educate . The character inherent in [the American people]2813-the american people has done all that has been accomplished ; and it would have done somewhat more , if [the government]1992-the government had not sometimes got in its way . For government is an expedient by which [men]1028-men would fain succeed in letting [one another]1750-one another alone ; and , as has been said , when it is most expedient , the governed are most let alone by it . Trade and commerce , if [they]1028-men were not made of [India]300-india - rubber , would never manage to bounce over the obstacles which [legislators]2817-legislators are continually putting in [their]2817-legislators way ; and , if [one]936-one were to judge [these men]1186-these men wholly by the effects of [their]1186-these men actions and not partly by [their]1186-these men intentions , [they]1186-these men would deserve to be classed and punished with [those mischievous persons who put obstructions on [the railroads]2821-the railroads]2820-those mischievous persons who put obstructions on the railroads .

But , to speak practically and as [a citizen]2822-a citizen , unlike [those who call [themselves]2823-those who call themselves no - government men no - [government men]2824-government men]2823-those who call themselves no - government men , [I]0-i ask for , not at once no government , but _ at once _ [a better government]2825-a better government . Let [every man]2593-every man make known what kind of government would command [his]2593-every man respect , and that will be one step toward obtaining it .

After all , the practical reason why , when the power is once in the hands of [the people]1562-the people , [a majority]2828-a majority are permitted , and for a long period continue , to rule , is not because [they]2828-a majority are most likely to be in the right , nor because this seems fairest to [the minority]2675-the minority , but because [they]2828-a majority are physically the strongest . But a government in which the majority rule in all cases can not be based on justice , even as far as [men]1028-men understand it . Can there not be a government in which majorities do not virtually decide right and wrong , but conscience?—in which majorities decide only those questions to which the rule of expediency is applicable ? Must [the citizen]2831-the citizen ever for a moment , or in the least degree , resign [his]2831-the citizen conscience to [the legislator]2832-the legislator ? Why has [every man]2593-every man a conscience , then ? [I]0-i think that [we]2834-we should be [men]1028-men first , and subjects afterward . It is not desirable to cultivate a respect for the law , so much as for the right . The only obligation which [I]0-i have a right to assume , is to do at any time what [I]0-i think right . It is truly enough said , that [a corporation]2836-a corporation has no conscience ; but [a corporation of [conscientious men]2838-conscientious men]2837-a corporation of conscientious men is [a corporation _ with _ a conscience]2839-a corporation _ with _ a conscience . Law never made [men]1028-men a whit more just ; and , by means of [their]1028-men respect for it , even the well - disposed are daily made [the agents of injustice]2841-the agents of injustice . A common and natural result of an undue respect for law is , that [you]2842-you may see a file of [soldiers]1016-soldiers , [colonel]2844-colonel , [captain]2845-captain , [corporal]2846-corporal , [privates]2847-privates , powder - monkeys , and all , marching in admirable order over hill and dale to the wars , against [their]2848-their wills , ay , against [their]2848-their common sense and consciences , which makes it very steep marching indeed , and produces a palpitation of the heart . [They]1028-men have no doubt that it is a damnable business in which [they]1028-men are concerned ; [they]1028-men are all peaceably inclined . Now , what are [they]1028-men ? [Men]1028-men at all ? or [small movable forts]2850-small movable forts and magazines , at the service of [some unscrupulous man in power]2851-some unscrupulous man in power ? Visit [the Navy - Yard]2852-the navy - yard , and behold [a marine]2853-a marine , such [a man as [an American government]2855-an american government]2854-a man as an american government can make , or such as it can make [a man with its black arts,—a mere shadow and reminiscence of humanity]2856-a man with its black arts,—a mere shadow and reminiscence of humanity , [a man laid out alive and standing , and already , as one]2857-a man laid out alive and standing , and already , as one may say , buried under arms with funeral accompaniments , though it may be , —

“ Not a drum was heard , not a funeral note , As [his]2857-a man laid out alive and standing , and already , as one corse to [the rampart]5398-the rampart [we]5399-we hurried ; Not [a soldier]1943-a soldier discharged [his]2857-a man laid out alive and standing , and already , as one farewell shot [O’er]560-o’er the grave where [[our]5399-we hero]5401-our hero [we]5399-we buried . ”[1028-men]

The mass of [men]1028-men serve [the state]816-the state thus , not as [men]1028-men mainly , but as machines , with [their]1028-men bodies . [They]1028-men are [the standing army]2798-the standing army , and [the militia]2862-the militia , [jailers]2863-jailers , [constables]2864-constables , posse comitatus , & c. In most cases there is no free exercise whatever of the judgment or of the moral sense ; but [they]1028-men put [themselves]1028-men on a level with wood and earth and stones ; and [wooden men]2865-wooden men can perhaps be manufactured that will serve the purpose as well . Such command no more respect than [men of straw or a lump of dirt]2866-men of straw or a lump of dirt . [They]2866-men of straw or a lump of dirt have the same sort of worth only as horses and dogs . Yet such as these even are commonly esteemed [good citizens]2867-good citizens . [Others,—as most legislators]2868-others,—as most legislators , [politicians]2592-politicians , [lawyers]2721-lawyers , [ministers]2871-ministers , and office - holders,—serve [the state]816-the state chiefly with [their]2866-men of straw or a lump of dirt heads ; and , as [they]2866-men of straw or a lump of dirt rarely make any moral distinctions , [they]2866-men of straw or a lump of dirt are as likely to serve [the Devil]2673-the devil , without _ intending _ it , as [God]554-god . A very few , as [heroes]2874-heroes , [patriots]2875-patriots , [martyrs]2876-martyrs , [reformers]2877-reformers in the great sense , and [_ men]2878-_ men _ , serve [the state]816-the state with [their]2878-_ men consciences also , and so necessarily resist it for the most part ; and [they]2878-_ men are commonly treated as [enemies]2880-enemies by it . [A wise man]2881-a wise man will only be useful as [a man]1027-a man , and will not submit to be “ clay , ”[1027-a man] and “ stop a hole to keep the wind away , ”[1027-a man] but leave [that office]2883-that office to [his]2881-a wise man dust at least : —

“ [I]1027-a man am too high - born to be propertied , To be a secondary at control , Or useful serving - man and instrument To [any sovereign state throughout [the world]741-the world]5402-any sovereign state throughout the world . ”[1027-a man]

[He]2881-a wise man who gives [himself]2881-a wise man entirely to [[his]2881-a wise man fellow - men]2884-his fellow - men appears to [them]2884-his fellow - men useless and selfish ; but [he]2881-a wise man who gives [himself]2881-a wise man partially to [them]2884-his fellow - men is pronounced [a benefactor and philanthropist]2885-a benefactor and philanthropist .

How does it become [a man]1027-a man to behave toward this American government to - day ? [I]0-i answer , that [he]1027-a man can not without disgrace be associated with it . [I]0-i can not for an instant recognize that political organization as _ [[my]0-i _ government]2887-my _ government which is [the _ slave]2888-the _ slave ’s _ government also .

[All men]2889-all men recognize the right of revolution ; that is , the right to refuse allegiance to , and to resist , [the government]1992-the government , when its tyranny or its inefficiency are great and unendurable . But almost all say that such is not the case now . But such was the case , [they]2889-all men think , in the Revolution of ’ 75 . If [one]936-one were to tell [me]0-i that this was a bad government because it taxed certain foreign commodities brought to [[its]2888-the _ slave ports]2892-its ports , it is most probable that [I]0-i should not make an ado about it , for [I]0-i can do without [them]2884-his fellow - men . All machines have [their]2884-his fellow - men friction ; and possibly this does enough good to counterbalance the evil . At any rate , it is a great evil to make a stir about it . But when the friction comes to have its machine , and oppression and robbery are organized , [I]0-i say , let [us]2893-us not have such a machine any longer . In other words , when [a sixth of [the population of [a nation]2510-a nation which has undertaken to be the refuge of liberty are [slaves]2543-slaves , and [a whole country]2898-a whole country]2895-the population of a nation which has undertaken to be the refuge of liberty are slaves , and a whole country]2894-a sixth of the population of a nation which has undertaken to be the refuge of liberty are slaves , and a whole country is unjustly overrun and conquered by [a foreign army]2899-a foreign army , and subjected to military law , [I]0-i think that it is not too soon for [honest men]2900-honest men to rebel and revolutionize . What makes this duty the more urgent is the fact , that [the country so overrun]2901-the country so overrun is not [our]2893-us own , but [ours]2893-us is [the invading army]2902-the invading army .

[Paley]561-paley , a common authority with many on moral questions , in [his]561-paley chapter on the “ Duty of Submission to [Civil Government]5404-civil government , ”[561-paley] resolves all civil obligation into expediency ; and [he]561-paley proceeds to say , “ that so long as the interest of [the whole society]5405-the whole society requires it , that is , so long as the established government can not be resisted or changed without public inconveniency , it is the will of [God]554-god that [the established government]5406-the established government be obeyed , and no longer ..... This principle being admitted , the justice of every particular case of resistance is reduced to a computation of the quantity of the danger and grievance on the one side , and of the probability and expense of redressing it on the other . ”[561-paley] Of this , [he]561-paley says , [every man]2593-every man shall judge for [himself]2593-every man . But [Paley]561-paley appears never to have contemplated those cases to which the rule of expediency does not apply , in which [a people]2904-a people , as well as [an individual]1366-an individual , must do justice , cost what it may . If [I]0-i have unjustly wrested a plank from [a drowning man]2906-a drowning man , [I]0-i must restore it to [him]2906-a drowning man though [I]0-i drown [myself]0-i . This , according to [Paley]561-paley , would be inconvenient . But [he]561-paley that would save [his]561-paley life , in such a case , shall lose it . [This people]2907-this people must cease to hold [slaves]2543-slaves , and to make war on [Mexico]291-mexico , though it cost [them]2543-slaves [their]2543-slaves existence as [a people]2904-a people .

In [their]2543-slaves practice , [nations]2910-nations agree with [Paley]561-paley ; but does [any one]2425-any one think that [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts does exactly what is right at the present crisis ?

“ A drab of state , a cloth - o’-silver slut , To have [[her]5407-her train]5408-her train borne up , and [her]5407-her soul trail in the dirt . ”[561-paley]

Practically speaking , [the opponents to a reform in [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]2912-the opponents to a reform in massachusetts are not [a hundred thousand politicians at [the South]1040-the south]2913-a hundred thousand politicians at the south , but [a hundred thousand merchants and [farmers]2916-farmers [here]820-here , who are more interested in commerce and agriculture than [they]2915-a hundred thousand merchants and farmers here , who are more interested in commerce and agriculture than they are in humanity , and are not prepared to do justice to the slave and to mexico are in humanity , and are not prepared to do justice to [the slave]2484-the slave and to [Mexico]291-mexico]2915-a hundred thousand merchants and farmers here , who are more interested in commerce and agriculture than they are in humanity , and are not prepared to do justice to the slave and to mexico , _ cost what it may _ . [I]0-i quarrel not with [far - off foes]2919-far - off foes , but with [those who , near at [home]867-home]2920-those who , near at home , co - operate with , and do the bidding of , those far away , and without whom the latter would be harmless . [We]2922-we are accustomed to say , that the mass of [men]1028-men are unprepared ; but improvement is slow , because the few are not materially wiser or better than the many . It is not so important that many should be as good as [you]2924-you , as that there be some absolute goodness somewhere ; for that will leaven the whole lump . There are [thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery and to the war , who yet in effect do nothing to put an end to [them]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery ; who , esteeming [[themselves]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery children of [Washington]30-washington and [Franklin]562-franklin]2926-themselves children of washington and franklin , sit down with [their]2926-themselves children of washington and franklin hands in [their]2926-themselves children of washington and franklin pockets , and say that [they]2926-themselves children of washington and franklin know not what to do , and do nothing ; who even postpone the question of freedom to the question of free - trade , and quietly read the prices - current along with the latest advices from [Mexico]291-mexico , after dinner , and , it may be , fall asleep over [them]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery both . What is the price - current of [an honest man]2927-an honest man and patriot to - day ? [They]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery hesitate , and [they]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery regret , and sometimes [they]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery petition ; but [they]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery do nothing in earnest and with effect . [They]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery will wait , well disposed , for [others]985-others to remedy the evil , that [they]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery may no longer have it to regret . At most , [they]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery give only a cheap vote , and a feeble countenance and God - speed , to the right , as it goes by [them]2925-thousands who are _ in opinion _ opposed to slavery . There are [nine hundred and ninety - nine patrons of virtue to one virtuous man]2929-nine hundred and ninety - nine patrons of virtue to one virtuous man . But it is easier to deal with the real possessor of a thing than with [the temporary guardian of it]2930-the temporary guardian of it .

All voting is a sort of gaming , like checkers or backgammon , with a slight moral tinge to it , a playing with right and wrong , with moral questions ; and betting naturally accompanies it . The character of [the voters]2931-the voters is not staked . [I]0-i cast [my]0-i vote , perchance , as [I]0-i think right ; but [I]0-i am not vitally concerned that that right should prevail . [I]0-i am willing to leave it to [the majority]2690-the majority . Its obligation , therefore , never exceeds that of expediency . Even voting _ for the right _ is _ doing _ nothing for it . It is only expressing to [men]1028-men feebly [your]2934-your desire that it should prevail . [A wise man]2881-a wise man will not leave the right to the mercy of chance , nor wish it to prevail through the power of [the majority]2690-the majority . There is but little virtue in the action of masses of [men]1028-men . When [the majority]2690-the majority shall at length vote for the abolition of slavery , it will be because [they]2690-the majority are indifferent to slavery , or because there is but little slavery left to be abolished by [their]2690-the majority vote . _ [They]2690-the majority _ will then be [the only slaves]2939-the only slaves . Only _ [his]2881-a wise man _ vote can hasten the abolition of slavery who asserts [his]2881-a wise man own freedom by [his]2881-a wise man vote .

[I]0-i hear of a convention to be held at [Baltimore]301-baltimore , or elsewhere , for the selection of [a candidate for [the Presidency]2941-the presidency]2940-a candidate for the presidency , made up chiefly of [editors]2942-editors , and [men who are politicians by profession]2943-men who are politicians by profession ; but [I]0-i think , what is it to [any independent , intelligent , and respectable man]2944-any independent , intelligent , and respectable man what decision [they]2690-the majority may come to ? Shall [we]2945-we not have the advantage of [his]2881-a wise man wisdom and honesty , nevertheless ? Can [we]2945-we not count upon some independent votes ? Are there not [many individuals in [the country]750-the country who do not attend conventions]2946-many individuals in the country who do not attend conventions ? But no : [I]0-i find that [the respectable man]2948-the respectable man , so called , has immediately drifted from [his]2948-the respectable man position , and despairs of [[his]2948-the respectable man country]2191-his country , when [[his]2948-the respectable man country]2191-his country has more reason to despair of [him]2948-the respectable man . [He]2948-the respectable man forthwith adopts one of the candidates thus selected as the only _ available _ one , thus proving that [he]2948-the respectable man is [himself]2948-the respectable man _ available _ for any purposes of the demagogue . [His]2948-the respectable man vote is of no more worth than that of [any unprincipled foreigner or hireling native , who may have been bought]2951-any unprincipled foreigner or hireling native , who may have been bought . [O]558-o eternal verity for [a man who is [a _ man _]2953-a _ man _ , and , as [[my]0-i neighbor]2954-my neighbor]2952-a man who is a _ man _ , and , as my neighbor says , has a bone in [his]2952-a man who is a _ man _ , and , as my neighbor back which [you]2955-you can not pass [your]2955-you hand through ! [Our]2956-our statistics are at fault : [the population]1412-the population has been returned too large . How [many _ men]2958-many _ men _ are there to [a square thousand miles in [this country]5239-this country]2959-a square thousand miles in this country ? Hardly one . Does not [America]23-america offer any inducement for [men]1028-men to settle here ? [The American]2962-the american has dwindled into [an Odd Fellow,—one who may be known by the development of [his]2962-the american organ of gregariousness , and a manifest lack of intellect and cheerful self - reliance ; whose first and chief concern , on coming into [the world]741-the world , is to see that [the Almshouses]563-an odd fellow,—one who may be known by the development of his organ of gregariousness , and a manifest lack of intellect and cheerful self - reliance ; whose first and chief concern , on coming into the world , is to see that the almshouses are in good repair are in good repair]563-an odd fellow,—one who may be known by the development of his organ of gregariousness , and a manifest lack of intellect and cheerful self - reliance ; whose first and chief concern , on coming into the world , is to see that the almshouses are in good repair ; and , before yet [he]2962-the american has lawfully donned the virile garb , to collect a fund for the support of [the widows]2964-the widows and [orphans that may be]2965-orphans that may be ; who , in short , ventures to live only by the aid of [the Mutual Insurance company]2966-the mutual insurance company , which has promised to bury [him]2962-the american decently .

It is not [a man]1027-a man ’s duty , as a matter of course , to devote [himself]2962-the american to the eradication of any , even the most enormous wrong ; [he]2962-the american may still properly have other concerns to engage [him]2962-the american ; but it is [his]2962-the american duty , at least , to wash [his]2962-the american hands of it , and , if [he]2962-the american gives it no thought longer , not to give it practically [his]2962-the american support . If [I]0-i devote [myself]0-i to other pursuits and contemplations , [I]0-i must first see , at least , that [I]0-i do not pursue [them]2968-them sitting upon [another man]2969-another man ’s shoulders . [I]0-i must get off [him]2969-another man first , that [he]2969-another man may pursue [his]2969-another man contemplations too . See what gross inconsistency is tolerated . [I]0-i have heard [some of [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen]2496-some of my townsmen say , “ [I]2496-some of my townsmen should like to have [them]2496-some of my townsmen order [me]2496-some of my townsmen out to help put down an insurrection of [the slaves]5409-the slaves , or to march to [Mexico;—see]302-mexico;—see if [I]2496-some of my townsmen would go ”[2496-some of my townsmen] ; and yet [these very men]2972-these very men have each , directly by [their]2972-these very men allegiance , and so indirectly , at least , by [their]2972-these very men money , furnished a substitute . [The soldier]1002-the soldier is applauded who refuses to serve in an unjust war by [those who do not refuse to sustain [the unjust government which makes the war]2975-the unjust government which makes the war]2974-those who do not refuse to sustain the unjust government which makes the war ; is applauded by [those whose own act and authority [he]1002-the soldier disregards and sets at naught]2976-those whose own act and authority he disregards and sets at naught ; as if [the State]816-the state were penitent to that degree that it hired [one]936-one to scourge it while it sinned , but not to that degree that it left off sinning for a moment . Thus , under the name of [Order and Civil Government]2979-order and civil government , [we]2980-we are all made at last to pay homage to and support [our]2980-we own meanness . After the first blush of sin comes its indifference ; and from immoral it becomes , as it were , _ un_moral , and not quite unnecessary to that life which [we]2980-we have made .

The broadest and most prevalent error requires the most disinterested virtue to sustain it . The slight reproach to which the virtue of patriotism is commonly liable , [the noble]2981-the noble are most likely to incur . [Those who , while [they]2982-those who , while they disapprove of the character and measures of a government disapprove of the character and measures of [a government]2983-a government]2982-those who , while they disapprove of the character and measures of a government , yield to [it]2983-a government [their]2982-those who , while they disapprove of the character and measures of a government allegiance and support , are undoubtedly [its most conscientious supporters]2984-its most conscientious supporters , and so frequently the most serious obstacles to reform . [Some]1812-some are petitioning [the State]816-the state to dissolve the Union , to disregard the requisitions of [the President]2987-the president . Why do [they]1812-some not dissolve it themselves,—the union between [themselves]1812-some and [the State,—and]2988-the state,—and refuse to pay [their]1812-some quota into [its]2988-the state,—and treasury ? Do not [they]1812-some stand in the same relation to [the State]816-the state , that [the State]816-the state does to [the Union]2991-the union ? And have not the same reasons prevented [the State]816-the state from resisting [the Union]2991-the union , which have prevented [them]2982-those who , while they disapprove of the character and measures of a government from resisting [the State]816-the state ?

How can [a man]1027-a man be satisfied to entertain an opinion merely , and enjoy _ it _ ? Is there any enjoyment in it , if [his]1027-a man opinion is that [he]1027-a man is aggrieved ? If [you]2996-you are cheated out of a single dollar by [[your]2997-your neighbor]2998-your neighbor , [you]2997-your do not rest satisfied with knowing that [you]2999-you are cheated , or with saying that [you]2999-you are cheated , or even with petitioning [him]1027-a man to pay [you]2999-you [your]2999-you due ; but [you]2999-you take effectual steps at once to obtain the full amount , and see that [you]2999-you are never cheated again . Action from principle , the perception and the performance of right , changes things and relations ; it is essentially revolutionary , and does not consist wholly with anything which was . It not only divides [states]3000-states and [churches]3001-churches , it divides [families]1596-families ; ay , it divides [the _ individual _]3003-the _ individual _ , separating the diabolical in [him]1027-a man from the divine .

Unjust laws exist : shall [we]3004-we be content to obey [them]3004-we , or shall [we]3004-we endeavor to amend [them]3004-we , and obey [them]3004-we until [we]3004-we have succeeded , or shall [we]3004-we transgress [them]3004-we at once ? [Men]1028-men generally , under [such a government]3006-such a government as this , think that [they]1028-men ought to wait until [they]1028-men have persuaded [the majority]2690-the majority to alter [them]2690-the majority . [They]1028-men think that , if [they]2690-the majority should resist , the remedy would be worse than the evil . But it is the fault of [the government]1992-the government itself that the remedy _ is _ worse than the evil . _ It _ makes it worse . Why is it not more apt to anticipate and provide for reform ? Why does it not cherish [its wise minority]3009-its wise minority ? Why does it cry and resist before it is hurt ? Why does it not encourage [[its]3009-its wise minority citizens]3010-its citizens to be on the alert to point out its faults , and _ do _ better than it would have [them]3010-its citizens ? Why does it always crucify Christ , and excommunicate [Copernicus]564-copernicus and [Luther]565-luther , and pronounce [Washington]566-washington and [Franklin]562-franklin rebels ?

[One]936-one would think , that a deliberate and practical denial of its authority was the only offence never contemplated by government ; else , why has it not assigned its definite , its suitable and proportionate penalty ? If [a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for [the State]816-the state]3012-a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for the state , [he]3012-a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for the state is put in [prison]2399-prison for a period unlimited by any law that [I]0-i know , and determined only by the discretion of [those who placed [him]3012-a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for the state [there]939-there]3015-those who placed him there ; but if [he]3012-a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for the state should steal ninety times nine shillings from [the State]816-the state , [he]3012-a man who has no property refuses but once to earn nine shillings for the state is soon permitted to go at large again .

If the injustice is part of the necessary friction of the machine of government , let it go , let it go : perchance it will wear smooth,—certainly the machine will wear out . If the injustice has a spring , or a pulley , or a rope , or a crank , exclusively for [itself]939-there , then perhaps [you]3018-you may consider whether the remedy will not be worse than the evil ; but if it is of such a nature that it requires [you]3019-you to be the agent of injustice to another , then , [I]0-i say , break the law . Let [your]3019-you life be a counter friction to stop the machine . What [I]0-i have to do is to see , at any rate , that [I]0-i do not lend [myself]0-i to the wrong which [I]0-i condemn .

As for adopting the ways which [the State]816-the state has provided for remedying the evil , [I]0-i know not of such ways . [They]3021-they take too much time , and [a man]1027-a man ’s life will be gone . [I]0-i have other affairs to attend to . [I]0-i came into [this world]3023-this world , not chiefly to make this a good place to live in , but to live in it , be it good or bad . [A man]1027-a man has not everything to do , but something ; and because [he]1027-a man can not do _ everything _ , it is not necessary that [he]1027-a man should do _ something _ wrong . It is not [my]0-i business to be petitioning [the Governor]2432-the governor or [the Legislature]3026-the legislature any more than it is [theirs]3027-they to petition [me]0-i ; and , if [they]3027-they should not hear [my]0-i petition , what should [I]0-i do then ? But in this case [the State]816-the state has provided no way : its very Constitution is the evil . This may seem to be harsh and stubborn and unconciliatory ; but it is to treat with the utmost kindness and consideration the only spirit that can appreciate or deserves it . So is all change for the better , like birth and death , which convulse the body .

[I]0-i do not hesitate to say , that [those who call [[themselves]3029-those who call themselves abolitionists should at once effectually withdraw their support , both in person and property , from the government of massachusetts Abolitionists]3030-themselves abolitionists should at once effectually withdraw [their]3030-themselves abolitionists support , both in [person]3031-person and [property]3032-property , from [the government of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]3033-the government of massachusetts]3029-those who call themselves abolitionists should at once effectually withdraw their support , both in person and property , from the government of massachusetts , and not wait till [they]3027-they constitute a majority of one , before [they]3027-they suffer the right to prevail through [them]3027-they . [I]0-i think that it is enough if [they]3027-they have [God]554-god on [their]3027-they side , without waiting for [that other one]3034-that other one . Moreover , [any man more right than [[his]3035-any man more right than his neighbors neighbors]3036-his neighbors]3035-any man more right than his neighbors constitutes a majority of one already .

[I]0-i meet [this American government]3037-this american government , or [[its]3037-this american government representative]3038-its representative , [the State government]3039-the state government , directly , and face to face , once a - year — no more — in [the person of [its]3037-this american government tax - gatherer]3040-the person of its tax - gatherer ; this is the only mode in which [a man situated as [I]0-i am necessarily meets it]3041-a man situated as i am necessarily meets it ; and it then says distinctly , Recognize [me]0-i ; and the simplest , the most effectual , and , in the present posture of affairs , the indispensablest mode of treating with it on this head , of expressing [your]3042-your little satisfaction with and love for it , is to deny it then . [[My]0-i civil neighbor]3043-my civil neighbor , [the tax - gatherer]3044-the tax - gatherer , is [the very man [I]0-i have to deal]3045-the very man i have to deal with,—for it is , after all , with [men]1028-men and not with parchment that [I]0-i quarrel,—and [he]3043-my civil neighbor has voluntarily chosen to be [an agent of [the government]1992-the government]3047-an agent of the government . How shall [he]3043-my civil neighbor ever know well what [he]3043-my civil neighbor is and does as [an officer of [the government]1992-the government]3049-an officer of the government , or as [a man]1027-a man , until [he]3043-my civil neighbor is obliged to consider whether [he]3043-my civil neighbor shall treat [me]0-i , [[his]3043-my civil neighbor neighbor]3052-his neighbor , for whom [he]3043-my civil neighbor has respect , as [a neighbor and well - disposed man]3053-a neighbor and well - disposed man , or as [a maniac and disturber of the peace]3054-a maniac and disturber of the peace , and see if [he]3043-my civil neighbor can get over this obstruction to [[his]3043-my civil neighbor neighborliness]3055-his neighborliness without a ruder and more impetuous thought or speech corresponding with [his]3043-my civil neighbor action . [I]0-i know this well , that if one thousand , if one hundred , if ten men whom [I]0-i could name,—if ten _ honest _ [men]1028-men only,—ay , if _ [one _ HONEST man]3057-one _ honest man , in [this State of Massachusetts]3058-this state of massachusetts , _ ceasing to hold [slaves _]3059-slaves _ , were actually to withdraw from [this copartnership]3060-this copartnership , and be locked up in [the county jail]3061-the county jail therefor , it would be the abolition of slavery in [America]23-america . For it matters not how small the beginning may seem to be : what is once well done is done forever . But [we]3062-we love better to talk about it : that [we]3062-we say is [our]3062-we mission . [Reform]567-reform keeps many scores of newspapers in its service , but not [one man]788-one man . If [[my]0-i esteemed neighbor]3064-my esteemed neighbor , [[the State]816-the state ’s ambassador , who will devote [his]3066-the state ’s ambassador , who will devote his days to the settlement of the question of human rights in the council chamber days to the settlement of the question of human rights in [the Council Chamber]3067-the council chamber]3066-the state ’s ambassador , who will devote his days to the settlement of the question of human rights in the council chamber , instead of being threatened with [the prisons of [Carolina]303-carolina]3068-the prisons of carolina , were to sit down [the prisoner of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]3069-the prisoner of massachusetts , that State which is so anxious to foist the sin of slavery upon [her]3064-my esteemed neighbor sister,—though at present [she]3064-my esteemed neighbor can discover only an act of inhospitality to be the ground of a quarrel with [her,—the Legislature]568-her,—the legislature would not wholly waive the subject the following winter .

Under a government which imprisons any unjustly , the true place for [a just man]3070-a just man is also [a prison]3071-a prison . The proper place to - day , [the only place which [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts has provided for [her]3064-my esteemed neighbor freer and less desponding spirits]3072-the only place which massachusetts has provided for her freer and less desponding spirits , is in [[her]3064-my esteemed neighbor prisons]3073-her prisons , to be put out and locked out of [the State]816-the state by [her]3064-my esteemed neighbor own act , as [they]3075-they have already put [themselves]3075-they out by [their]3075-they principles . It is there that [the fugitive slave]3076-the fugitive slave , and [the Mexican prisoner on parole]3077-the mexican prisoner on parole , and [the Indian]3078-the indian come to plead the wrongs of [his]3078-the indian race , should find [them]3078-the indian ; on that separate , but more free and honorable ground , where [the State]816-the state places those who are not _ with _ [her]3064-my esteemed neighbor , but _ against _ her,—the only house in [a slave State in which [a free man]3081-a free man can abide with honor]3080-a slave state in which a free man can abide with honor . If any think that [their]3075-they influence would be lost there , and [their]3075-they voices no longer afflict the ear of [the State]816-the state , that [they]3075-they would not be as [an enemy]2038-an enemy within [its]3075-they walls , [they]3075-they do not know by how much truth is stronger than error , nor how much more eloquently and effectively [he]3081-a free man can combat injustice who has experienced a little in [[his]3081-a free man own person]3084-his own person . Cast [your]3085-your whole vote , not a strip of paper merely , but [your]3085-your whole influence . [A minority]3086-a minority is powerless while it conforms to [the majority]2690-the majority ; it is not even a minority then ; but it is irresistible when it clogs by its whole weight . If the alternative is to keep [all just men in [prison]2399-prison]3088-all just men in prison , or give up war and slavery , [the State]816-the state will not hesitate which to choose . If [a thousand men]1023-a thousand men were not to pay [their]1023-a thousand men tax - bills this year , that would not be a violent and bloody measure , as it would be to pay [them]1023-a thousand men , and enable [the State]816-the state to commit violence and shed innocent blood . This is , in fact , the definition of a peaceable revolution , if any such is possible . If [the tax - gatherer]3044-the tax - gatherer , or [any other public officer]3094-any other public officer , asks [me]0-i , as [one]936-one has done , “ But what shall [I]936-one do ? ”[936-one] [my]0-i answer is , “ If [you]0-i really wish to do anything , resign [[your]0-i office]5410-your office . ”[936-one] When the subject has refused allegiance , and [the officer]2452-the officer has resigned [[his]2452-the officer office]2661-his office , then the revolution is accomplished . But even suppose blood should flow . Is there not a sort of blood shed when the conscience is wounded ? Through this wound [a man]1027-a man ’s real manhood and immortality flow out , and [he]1027-a man bleeds to an everlasting death . [I]0-i see this blood flowing now .

[I]0-i have contemplated the imprisonment of [the offender]3099-the offender , rather than the seizure of [his]3099-the offender goods,—though both will serve the same purpose,—because [they]3100-they who assert the purest right , and consequently are most dangerous to [a corrupt State]3101-a corrupt state , commonly have not spent much time in accumulating [property]3032-property . To such [the State]816-the state renders comparatively small service , and a slight tax is wo nt to appear exorbitant , particularly if [they]3100-they are obliged to earn it by special labor with [their]3100-they hands . If there were [one who lived wholly without the use of money]3104-one who lived wholly without the use of money , [the State]816-the state itself would hesitate to demand it of [him]816-the state . But [the rich man,—not]3106-the rich man,—not to make any invidious comparison,—is always sold to the institution which makes [him]816-the state rich . Absolutely speaking , the more money , the less virtue ; for money comes between [a man]1027-a man and [his]1027-a man objects , and obtains [them]3100-they for [him]816-the state ; and it was certainly no great virtue to obtain it . It puts to rest many questions which [he]816-the state would otherwise be taxed to answer ; while the only new question which it puts is the hard but superfluous one , how to spend it . Thus [his]816-the state moral ground is taken from under [his]816-the state feet . The opportunities of living are diminished in proportion as what are called the “ means ”[1027-a man] are increased . The best thing [a man]1027-a man can do for [his]1027-a man culture when [he]1027-a man is rich is to endeavor to carry out those schemes which [he]1027-a man entertained when [he]1027-a man was poor . [Christ]452-christ answered [the Herodians]569-the herodians according to [their]569-the herodians condition . “ Show [me]452-christ the tribute - money , ”[452-christ] said he;—and one took a penny out of [his]452-christ pocket;—if [you]3109-you use money which has the image of [Cæsar]570-cæsar on it , and which [he]570-cæsar has made current and valuable , that is , _ if [you]3110-you are [men of the State _]3111-men of the state _ , and gladly enjoy the advantages of [Cæsar]570-cæsar ’s government , then pay [him]570-cæsar back some of [his]570-cæsar own when [he]570-cæsar demands it ; “ Render therefore to [Cæsar]570-cæsar that which is [Cæsar]570-cæsar ’s , and to [God]554-god those things which are God’s,”—leaving[3111-men of the state _] [them]3111-men of the state _ no wiser than before as to which was which ; for [they]3111-men of the state _ did not wish to know .

When [I]0-i converse with the freest of [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors , [I]0-i perceive that , whatever [they]2501-my neighbors may say about the magnitude and seriousness of the question , and [their]2501-my neighbors regard for the public tranquillity , the long and the short of the matter is , that [they]2501-my neighbors can not spare the protection of [the existing government]3113-the existing government , and [they]2501-my neighbors dread the consequences to [their]2501-my neighbors property and families of disobedience to [it]570-cæsar . For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i should not like to think that [I]0-i ever rely on the protection of [the State]816-the state . But , if [I]0-i deny the authority of [the State]816-the state when it presents its tax - bill , it will soon take and waste all [my]0-i property , and so harass [me]0-i and [[my]0-i children]3116-my children without end . This is hard . This makes it impossible for [a man]1027-a man to live honestly , and at the same time comfortably , in outward respects . It will not be worth the while to accumulate property ; that would be sure to go again . [You]3118-you must hire or squat somewhere , and raise but a small crop , and eat that soon . [You]3118-you must live within [yourself]3118-you , and depend upon [yourself]3118-you always tucked up and ready for a start , and not have many affairs . [A man]1027-a man may grow rich in [Turkey]304-turkey even , if [he]1027-a man will be in all respects a good subject of [the Turkish government]3120-the turkish government . [Confucius]571-confucius said : “ If [a state]5411-a state is governed by the principles of reason , poverty and misery are subjects of shame ; if [a state]5411-a state is not governed by the principles of reason , riches and honors are the subjects of shame . ”[571-confucius] No : until [I]0-i want the protection of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts to be extended to [me]0-i in [some distant Southern port]3121-some distant southern port , where [my]0-i liberty is endangered , or until [I]0-i am bent solely on building up [an estate]3122-an estate at [home]867-home by peaceful enterprise , [I]0-i can afford to refuse allegiance to [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts , and [her]3124-her right to [[my]0-i property]3125-my property and life . It costs [me]0-i less in every sense to incur the penalty of disobedience to [the State]816-the state , than it would to obey . [I]0-i should feel as if [I]0-i were worth less in that case .

Some years ago , [the State]816-the state met [me]0-i in behalf of [the Church]980-the church , and commanded [me]0-i to pay a certain sum toward the support of [a clergyman whose preaching [[my]0-i father]2649-my father attended , but never [I]0-i [myself]0-i]3129-a clergyman whose preaching my father attended , but never i myself . “ Pay , ”[2649-my father] it said , “ or be locked up in [the jail]5413-the jail . ”[0-i] [I]0-i declined to pay . But , unfortunately , [another man]2969-another man saw fit to pay it . [I]0-i did not see why [the schoolmaster]3132-the schoolmaster should be taxed to support [the priest]959-the priest , and not [the priest]959-the priest [the schoolmaster]3132-the schoolmaster ; for [I]0-i was not [[the State]816-the state ’s schoolmaster]3137-the state ’s schoolmaster , but [I]0-i supported [myself]0-i by voluntary subscription . [I]0-i did not see why the lyceum should not present its tax - bill , and have [the State]816-the state to back its demand , as well as [the Church]980-the church . However , at the request of [the selectmen]3140-the selectmen , [I]0-i condescended to make some such statement as this in writing:—“Know [all men]2889-all men by these presents , that [I]0-i , [Henry Thoreau]395-henry d. thoreau , do not wish to be regarded as [a member of any incorporated society which [I]0-i have not joined]5415-a member of any incorporated society which i have not joined . ”[0-i] This [I]0-i gave to [the town clerk]3141-the town clerk ; and [he]3141-the town clerk has it . [The State]816-the state , having thus learned that [I]0-i did not wish to be regarded as [a member of [that church]3144-that church]3143-a member of that church , has never made a like demand on [me]0-i since ; though it said that it must adhere to its original presumption that time . If [I]0-i had known how to name [them]3145-them , [I]0-i should then have signed off in detail from all the societies which [I]0-i never signed on to ; but [I]0-i did not know where to find a complete list .

[I]0-i have paid no poll - tax for six years . [I]0-i was put into [a jail]3146-a jail once on this account , for one night ; and , as [I]0-i stood considering the walls of solid stone , two or three feet thick , the door of wood and iron , a foot thick , and the iron grating which strained the light , [I]0-i could not help being struck with the foolishness of that institution which treated [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were mere flesh and blood and bones , to be locked up . [I]0-i wondered that it should have concluded at length that this was the best use it could put [me]0-i to , and had never thought to avail itself of [my]0-i services in some way . [I]0-i saw that , if there was a wall of stone between [me]0-i and [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen , there was a still more difficult one to climb or break through , before [they]2394-my townsmen could get to be as free as [I]0-i was . [I]0-i did not for a moment feel confined , and the walls seemed a great waste of stone and mortar . [I]0-i felt as if [I]0-i alone of all [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen had paid [my]0-i tax . [They]2394-my townsmen plainly did not know how to treat [me]0-i , but behaved like [persons who are underbred]3149-persons who are underbred . In every threat and in every compliment there was a blunder ; for [they]2394-my townsmen thought that [my]0-i chief desire was to stand the other side of that stone wall . [I]0-i could not but smile to see how industriously [they]2394-my townsmen locked the door on [my]0-i meditations , which followed [them]2394-my townsmen out again without let or hindrance , and _ [they]2394-my townsmen _ were really all that was dangerous . As [they]2394-my townsmen could not reach [me]0-i , [they]2394-my townsmen had resolved to punish [my]0-i body ; just as [boys]1307-boys , if [they]2394-my townsmen can not come at [some person against whom [they]2394-my townsmen have a spite , will abuse [his]3151-some person against whom they have a spite , will abuse his dog dog]3151-some person against whom they have a spite , will abuse his dog . [I]0-i saw that [the State]816-the state was half - witted , that it was timid as [a lone woman with [her]3153-a lone woman with her silver spoons silver spoons]3153-a lone woman with her silver spoons , and that it did not know [[its]816-the state friends from [its]816-the state foes]3154-its friends from its foes , and [I]0-i lost all [my]0-i remaining respect for it , and pitied it .

Thus [the State]816-the state never intentionally confronts [a man]1027-a man ’s sense , intellectual or moral , but only [his]1027-a man body , [his]1027-a man senses . It is not armed with superior wit or honesty , but with superior physical strength . [I]0-i was not born to be forced . [I]0-i will breathe after [my]0-i own fashion . Let [us]3157-us see who is the strongest . What force has a multitude ? [They]2394-my townsmen only can force [me]0-i who obey a higher law than [I.]0-i [They]2394-my townsmen force [me]0-i to become like [themselves]2394-my townsmen . [I]0-i do not hear of _ men _ being _ forced _ to live this way or that by [masses of [men]1028-men]3158-masses of men . What sort of life were that to live ? When [I]0-i meet a government which says to [me]0-i , “ [Your]5416-your money or [your]5416-your life , ”[0-i] why should [I]0-i be in haste to give it [my]0-i money ? It may be in a great strait , and not know what to do : [I]0-i can not help that . It must help itself ; do as [I]0-i do . It is not worth the while to snivel about it . [I]0-i am not responsible for the successful working of [the machinery of society]3160-the machinery of society . [I]0-i am not [the son of [the engineer]3162-the engineer]3161-the son of the engineer . [I]0-i perceive that , when an acorn and a chestnut fall side by side , [the one]2519-the one does not remain inert to make way for the other , but both obey [their]3158-masses of men own laws , and spring and grow and flourish as best [they]3158-masses of men can , till one , perchance , overshadows and destroys the other . If [a plant]3164-a plant can not live according to its nature , it dies ; and so [a man]1027-a man .

The night in [prison]2399-prison was novel and interesting enough . [The prisoners]3167-the prisoners in [their]3167-the prisoners shirt - sleeves were enjoying a chat and the evening air in the doorway , when [I]0-i entered . But [the jailer]3168-the jailer said , “ Come , [boys]1307-boys , it is time to lock up ”[3168-the jailer] ; and so [they]3167-the prisoners dispersed , and [I]0-i heard the sound of [their]3167-the prisoners steps returning into [the hollow apartments]3169-the hollow apartments . [[My]0-i room]3170-my room - mate was introduced to [me]0-i by [the jailer]3168-the jailer , as “ [a first - rate fellow]5418-a first - rate fellow and [a clever man]5419-a clever man . ”[3168-the jailer] When the door was locked , [he]3168-the jailer showed [me]0-i where to hang [my]0-i hat , and how [he]3168-the jailer managed matters [there]939-there . [The rooms]3173-the rooms were whitewashed once a month ; and this one , at least , was the whitest , most simply furnished , and probably [the neatest apartment in [the town]762-the town]3174-the neatest apartment in the town . [He]3168-the jailer naturally wanted to know where [I]0-i came from , and what brought [me]0-i [there]939-there ; and , when [I]0-i had told [him]3168-the jailer , [I]0-i asked [him]3168-the jailer in [my]0-i turn how [he]3168-the jailer came [there]939-there , presuming [him]3168-the jailer to be [an honest man]2927-an honest man , of course ; and , as [the world]741-the world goes , [I]0-i believe [he]3168-the jailer was . “ Why , ”[3168-the jailer] said [he]3168-the jailer , “ [they]5420-they accuse [me]3168-the jailer of burning [a barn]5421-a barn ; but [I]3168-the jailer never did it . ”[3168-the jailer] As near as [I]0-i could discover , [he]3168-the jailer had probably gone to bed in [a barn]5421-a barn when drunk , and smoked [his]3168-the jailer pipe there ; and so [a barn]5421-a barn was burnt . [He]3168-the jailer had the reputation of being [a clever man]5419-a clever man , had been there some three months waiting for [his]3168-the jailer trial to come on , and would have to wait as much longer ; but [he]3168-the jailer was quite domesticated and contented , since [he]3168-the jailer got [his]3168-the jailer board for nothing , and thought that [he]3168-the jailer was well treated .

[He]3168-the jailer occupied one window , and [I]0-i the other ; and [I]0-i saw , that , if [one]936-one stayed there long , [his]3168-the jailer principal business would be to look out the window . [I]0-i had soon read all the tracts that were left there , and examined where [former prisoners]3184-former prisoners had broken out , and where [a grate]3185-a grate had been sawed off , and heard the history of [the various occupants of [that room]3187-that room]3186-the various occupants of that room ; for [I]0-i found that even here there was a history and a gossip which never circulated beyond the walls of [the jail]5413-the jail . Probably this is [the only house in [the town]762-the town]3189-the only house in the town where verses are composed , which are afterward printed in a circular form , but not published . [I]0-i was shown quite a long list of verses which were composed by [some young men who had been detected in an attempt to escape]3191-some young men who had been detected in an attempt to escape , who avenged [themselves]3191-some young men who had been detected in an attempt to escape by singing [them]3191-some young men who had been detected in an attempt to escape .

[I]0-i pumped [[my]0-i fellow - prisoner]3192-my fellow - prisoner as dry as [I]0-i could , for fear [I]0-i should never see [him]3168-the jailer again ; but at length [he]3168-the jailer showed [me]0-i which was [my]0-i bed , and left [me]0-i to blow out the lamp .

It was like travelling into [a far country]3193-a far country , such as [I]0-i had never expected to behold , to lie there for one night . It seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i never had heard [the town]762-the town - clock strike before , nor the evening sounds of [the village]891-the village ; for [we]3196-we slept with the windows open , which were inside [the grating]3197-the grating . It was to see [[my]0-i native village]3198-my native village in the light of [the Middle Ages]1676-the middle ages , and [[our]3196-we Concord]3200-our concord was turned into [a Rhine stream]3201-a rhine stream , and visions of [knights and castles]3202-knights and castles passed before [me]0-i . [They]3202-knights and castles were the voices of old burghers that [I]0-i heard in [the streets]995-the streets . [I]0-i was [an involuntary spectator]3204-an involuntary spectator and auditor of whatever was done and said in the kitchen of [the adjacent village - inn,—a]3205-the adjacent village - inn,—a wholly new and rare experience to [me]0-i . It was a closer view of [[my]0-i native town]3206-my native town . [I]0-i was fairly inside of [it]3205-the adjacent village - inn,—a . [I]0-i never had seen [[its]3205-the adjacent village - inn,—a institutions]3207-its institutions before . This is [one of [[its]3205-the adjacent village - inn,—a peculiar institutions]3209-its peculiar institutions]3208-one of its peculiar institutions ; for it is [a shire town]3210-a shire town . [I]0-i began to comprehend what [[its]3205-the adjacent village - inn,—a inhabitants]2039-its inhabitants were about .

In the morning , [our]3212-our breakfasts were put through the hole in the door , in small oblong - square tin pans , made to fit , and holding a pint of chocolate , with brown bread , and an iron spoon . When [they]2039-its inhabitants called for [the vessels]924-the vessels again , [I]0-i was green enough to return what bread [I]0-i had left ; but [[my]0-i comrade]3214-my comrade seized it , and said that [I]0-i should lay that up for lunch or dinner . Soon after [he]3214-my comrade was let out to work at haying in [a neighboring field]3215-a neighboring field , whither [he]3214-my comrade went every day , and would not be back till noon ; so [he]3214-my comrade bade [me]0-i good - day , saying that [he]3214-my comrade doubted if [he]3214-my comrade should see [me]0-i again .

When [I]0-i came out of prison,—for [some one]3216-some one interfered , and paid that tax,—I did not perceive that great changes had taken place on the common , such as [he]3214-my comrade observed who went in a youth , and emerged [a tottering and gray - headed man]3217-a tottering and gray - headed man ; and yet a change had to [my]0-i eyes come over [the scene,—the town]3218-the scene,—the town , and [State]305-state , and country,—greater than any that mere time could effect . [I]0-i saw yet more distinctly [the State in which [I]0-i lived]3219-the state in which i lived . [I]0-i saw to what extent [the people among whom [I]0-i lived could be trusted as [good neighbors]3221-good neighbors and [friends]3222-friends]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends ; that [their]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends friendship was for summer weather only ; that [they]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends did not greatly propose to do right ; that [they]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends were a distinct race from [me]0-i by [their]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends prejudices and superstitions , as [the Chinamen]572-the chinamen and [Malays]3223-malays are ; that , in [their]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends sacrifices to humanity , [they]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends ran no risks , not even to [their]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends property ; that , after all , [they]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends were not so noble but [they]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends treated [the thief]3224-the thief as [he]3224-the thief had treated [them]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends , and hoped , by a certain outward observance and a few prayers , and by walking in a particular straight though useless path from time to time , to save [their]3220-the people among whom i lived could be trusted as good neighbors and friends souls . This may be to judge [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors harshly ; for [I]0-i believe that [many of [them]3226-many of them]3226-many of them are not aware that [they]3226-many of them have such an institution as [the jail in [[their]3226-many of them village]3228-their village]3227-the jail in their village .

It was formerly the custom in [[our]3229-our village]3230-our village , when [a poor debtor]3231-a poor debtor came out of [jail]3232-jail , for [[his]3231-a poor debtor acquaintances]3233-his acquaintances to salute [him]3231-a poor debtor , looking through [their]3233-his acquaintances fingers , which were crossed to represent the grating of a jail window , “ How do [ye]5422-ye do ? ”[3233-his acquaintances] [[My]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors did not thus salute [me]0-i , but first looked at [me]0-i , and then at one another , as if [I]0-i had returned from a long journey . [I]0-i was put into [jail]3232-jail as [I]0-i was going to [the shoemaker]3236-the shoemaker ’s to get a shoe which was mended . When [I]0-i was let out the next morning , [I]0-i proceeded to finish [my]0-i errand , and having put on [my]0-i mended shoe , joined [a huckleberry party , who were impatient to put [themselves]3237-a huckleberry party , who were impatient to put themselves under my conduct under [my]0-i conduct]3237-a huckleberry party , who were impatient to put themselves under my conduct ; and in half an hour,—for the horse was soon tackled,—was in the midst of [a huckleberry field]3238-a huckleberry field , on one of [[our]3239-our highest hills]3240-our highest hills , two miles off , and then [the State]816-the state was nowhere to be seen .

This is the whole history of “ [[My]3242-a good neighbor Prisons]5423-my prisons . ”[3242-a good neighbor]

[I]0-i have never declined paying the highway tax , because [I]0-i am as desirous of being [a good neighbor]3242-a good neighbor as [I]0-i am of being a bad subject ; and , as for supporting [schools]3243-schools , [I]0-i am doing [my]0-i part to educate [[my]0-i fellow - countrymen]3244-my fellow - countrymen now . It is for no particular item in the tax - bill that [I]0-i refuse to pay it . [I]0-i simply wish to refuse allegiance to [the State]816-the state , to withdraw and stand aloof from it effectually . [I]0-i do not care to trace the course of [my]0-i dollar , if [I]0-i could , till it buys [a man]1027-a man or a musket to shoot [one with,—the dollar]3247-one with,—the dollar is innocent,—but [I]0-i am concerned to trace the effects of [my]0-i allegiance . In fact , [I]0-i quietly declare war with [the State]816-the state , after [my]0-i fashion , though [I]0-i will still make what use and get what advantage of [her]3249-her [I]0-i can , as is usual in such cases .

If [others]985-others pay the tax which is demanded of [me]0-i , from a sympathy with [the State]816-the state , [they]985-others do but what [they]985-others have already done in [their]985-others own case , or rather [they]985-others abet injustice to a greater extent than the State requires . If [they]985-others pay the tax from a mistaken interest in the individual taxed , to save [[his]3247-one with,—the dollar property]3252-his property , or prevent [his]3247-one with,—the dollar going to [jail]3232-jail , it is because [they]985-others have not considered wisely how far [they]985-others let [their]985-others private feelings interfere with the public good .

This , then , is [my]0-i position at present . But [one]936-one can not be too much on [his]936-one guard in such a case , lest [his]936-one action be biassed by obstinacy , or an undue regard for the opinions of [men]1028-men . Let [him]936-one see that [he]936-one does only what belongs to [himself]936-one and to the hour .

[I]0-i think sometimes , Why , [this people]2907-this people mean well ; [they]2907-this people are only ignorant ; [they]2907-this people would do better if [they]2907-this people knew how : why give [[your]3257-your neighbors]3258-your neighbors this pain to treat [you]3257-your as [they]2907-this people are not inclined to ? But [I]0-i think again , this is no reason why [I]0-i should do as [they]2907-this people do , or permit [others]985-others to suffer much greater pain of a different kind . Again , [I]0-i sometimes say to [myself]0-i , When many millions of [men]1028-men , without heat , without ill will , without personal feeling of any kind , demand of [you]3261-you a few shillings only , without the possibility , such is [their]2907-this people constitution , of retracting or altering [their]2907-this people present demand , and without the possibility , on [your]3261-you side , of appeal to any other millions , why expose [yourself]3261-you to this overwhelming brute force ? [You]3261-you do not resist cold and hunger , the winds and the waves , thus obstinately ; [you]3261-you quietly submit to a thousand similar necessities . [You]3261-you do not put [your]3261-you head into the fire . But just in proportion as [I]0-i regard this as not wholly a brute force , but partly a human force , and consider that [I]0-i have relations to those millions as to so many millions of [men]1028-men , and not of mere brute or inanimate things , [I]0-i see that appeal is possible , first and instantaneously , from [them]2907-this people to [the Maker of [them]2907-this people]3263-the maker of them , and , secondly , from [them]2907-this people to [themselves]2907-this people . But , if [I]0-i put [my]0-i head deliberately into the fire , there is no appeal to fire or to the Maker of fire , and [I]0-i have only [myself]0-i to blame . If [I]0-i could convince [myself]0-i that [I]0-i have any right to be satisfied with [men]1028-men as [they]1028-men are , and to treat [them]1028-men accordingly , and not according , in some respects , to [my]0-i requisitions and expectations of what [they]1028-men and [I]0-i ought to be , then , like [a good Mussulman and fatalist]3265-a good mussulman and fatalist , [I]0-i should endeavor to be satisfied with things as [they]1028-men are , and say it is the will of [God]554-god . And , above all , there is this difference between resisting this and a purely brute or natural force , that [I]0-i can resist this with some effect ; but [I]0-i can not expect , like [Orpheus]573-orpheus , to change the nature of the rocks and trees and beasts .

[I]0-i do not wish to quarrel with [any man]3266-any man or nation . [I]0-i do not wish to split hairs , to make fine distinctions , or set [myself]0-i up as better than [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors . [I]0-i seek rather , [I]0-i may say , even an excuse for conforming to the laws of [the land]834-the land . [I]0-i am but too ready to conform to [them]1028-men . Indeed , [I]0-i have reason to suspect [myself]0-i on this head ; and each year , as [the tax - gatherer]3044-the tax - gatherer comes round , [I]0-i find [myself]0-i disposed to review the acts and position of [the general and State governments]3270-the general and state governments , and the spirit of [the people]1562-the people , to discover a pretext for conformity .

“ [We]5424-we must affect [[our]5424-we country]5425-our country as [[our]5424-we parents]5426-our parents ; And if at any time [we]5424-we alienate [Our]5424-we love or industry from doing it honor , [We]5424-we must respect effects and teach the soul Matter of conscience and religion , And not desire of rule or benefit . ”[0-i]

[I]0-i believe that [the State]816-the state will soon be able to take all [my]0-i work of this sort out of [my]0-i hands , and then [I]0-i shall be no better a patriot than [[my]0-i fellow - countrymen]3244-my fellow - countrymen . Seen from a lower point of view , the Constitution , with all its faults , is very good ; the law and [the courts]2532-the courts are very respectable ; even [this State]2450-this state and this American government are , in many respects , very admirable and rare things , to be thankful for , such as a great many have described [them]2532-the courts ; but seen from a point of view a little higher , [they]2532-the courts are what [I]0-i have described [them]2532-the courts ; seen from a higher still , and [the highest , who shall say what [they]2532-the courts are , or that [they]2532-the courts are worth looking at or thinking of at all]3276-the highest , who shall say what they are , or that they are worth looking at or thinking of at all ?

However , [the government]1992-the government does not concern [me]0-i much , and [I]0-i shall bestow the fewest possible thoughts on it . It is not many moments that [I]0-i live under a government , even in [this world]3023-this world . If [a man]1027-a man is thought - free , fancy - free , imagination - free , that which _ is not _ never for a long time appearing _ to be _ to [him]1027-a man , [unwise rulers]3280-unwise rulers or [reformers]2877-reformers can not fatally interrupt [him]1027-a man .

[I]0-i know that [most men]3282-most men think differently from [myself]0-i ; but [those whose lives are by profession devoted to the study of these or kindred subjects]3283-those whose lives are by profession devoted to the study of these or kindred subjects , content [me]0-i as little as any . [Statesmen]3284-statesmen and [legislators]2817-legislators , standing so completely within [the institution]3286-the institution , never distinctly and nakedly behold it . [They]3282-most men speak of moving society , but have no resting - place without it . [They]3282-most men may be [men of a certain experience and discrimination]3287-men of a certain experience and discrimination , and have no doubt invented ingenious and even useful systems , for which [we]3288-we sincerely thank [them]3282-most men ; but all [their]3282-most men wit and usefulness lie within certain not very wide limits . [They]3282-most men are wo nt to forget that [the world]741-the world is not governed by policy and expediency . [Webster]529-webster never goes behind government , and so can not speak with authority about it . [His]529-webster words are wisdom to [those legislators who contemplate no essential reform in [the existing government]3113-the existing government]3290-those legislators who contemplate no essential reform in the existing government ; but for [thinkers]3292-thinkers , and [those who legislate for all time]3293-those who legislate for all time , [he]529-webster never once glances at the subject . [I]0-i know of [those whose serene and wise speculations on this theme]3294-those whose serene and wise speculations on this theme would soon reveal the limits of [his]529-webster mind ’s range and hospitality . Yet , compared with the cheap professions of [most reformers]3295-most reformers , and the still cheaper wisdom and eloquence of [politicians in general]3296-politicians in general , [his]529-webster are almost the only sensible and valuable words , and [we]3288-we thank Heaven for [him]529-webster . Comparatively , [he]529-webster is always strong , original , and , above all , practical . Still [his]529-webster quality is not wisdom , but prudence . [The lawyer]3297-the lawyer ’s truth is not Truth , but consistency , or a consistent expediency . Truth is always in harmony with [herself]3298-herself , and is not concerned chiefly to reveal the justice that may consist with wrong - doing . [He]529-webster well deserves to be called , as [he]529-webster has been called , [the Defender of the Constitution]3299-the defender of the constitution . There are really no blows to be given by [him]529-webster but [defensive ones]3300-defensive ones . [He]529-webster is not [a leader]3301-a leader , but [a follower]3302-a follower . [[His]3302-a follower leaders]3303-his leaders are [the men of ’ 87]3304-the men of ’ 87 . “ [I]3302-a follower have never made an effort , ”[3302-a follower] [he]3302-a follower says , “ and never propose to make an effort ; [I]3302-a follower have never countenanced an effort , and never mean to countenance an effort , to disturb the arrangement as originally made , by which [the various States]5427-the various states came into [the Union]2991-the union . ”[3302-a follower] Still thinking of the sanction which the Constitution gives to slavery , [he]3302-a follower says , “ Because it was a part of the original compact,—let it stand . ”[3302-a follower] Notwithstanding [his]3302-a follower special acuteness and ability , [he]3302-a follower is unable to take a fact out of its merely political relations , and behold it as it lies absolutely to be disposed of by the intellect,—what , for instance , [it]3305-it behooves [a man]1027-a man to do here in [America]23-america to - day with regard to slavery , but ventures , or is driven , to make some such desperate answer as the following , while professing to speak absolutely , and as [a private man,—from which what new and singular code of social duties]3307-a private man,—from which what new and singular code of social duties might be inferred ? “ The manner , ”[3302-a follower] says [he]3302-a follower , “ in which the governments of [those States where slavery exists are to regulate it]5429-those states where slavery exists are to regulate it , is for [their]3308-their own consideration , under [their]3308-their responsibility to [[their]3308-their constituents]5430-their constituents , to the general laws of propriety , humanity , and justice , and to [God]554-god . Associations formed elsewhere , springing from a feeling of humanity , or any other cause , have nothing whatever to do with it . [They]3308-their have never received any encouragement from [me]3302-a follower , and [they]3308-their never will . ”[5[3302-a follower] ]

Footnote 5 :

These extracts have been inserted since the Lecture was read .

[They]3308-their who know of no purer sources of truth , who have traced up its stream no higher , stand , and wisely stand , by the Bible and the Constitution , and drink at it there with reverence and humility ; but [they]3308-their who behold where it comes trickling into [this lake]5227-this lake or [that pool]3310-that pool , gird up [their]3308-their loins once more , and continue [their]3308-their pilgrimage toward [its]3308-their fountain - head .

[No man with a genius for legislation]3311-no man with a genius for legislation has appeared in [America]23-america . [They]3308-their are rare in the history of [the world]741-the world . There are [orators]3313-orators , [politicians]2592-politicians , and [eloquent men]3315-eloquent men , by [the thousand]3316-the thousand ; but [the speaker]3317-the speaker has not yet opened [his]3317-the speaker mouth to speak , who is capable of settling the much - vexed questions of the day . [We]3318-we love eloquence for [its]3308-their own sake , and not for any truth which it may utter , or any heroism it may inspire . [[Our]3318-we legislators]3319-our legislators have not yet learned the comparative value of free - trade and of freedom , of union , and of rectitude , to [a nation]2510-a nation . [They]3319-our legislators have no genius or talent for comparatively humble questions of taxation and finance , commerce and manufactures and agriculture . If [we]3318-we were left solely to the wordy wit of [legislators]2817-legislators in Congress for [our]3318-we guidance , uncorrected by the seasonable experience and the effectual complaints of [the people]1562-the people , [America]23-america would not long retain [her]23-america rank among [the nations]3323-the nations . For eighteen hundred years , though perchance [I]0-i have no right to say it , the New Testament has been written ; yet where is [the legislator who has wisdom and practical talent enough to avail himself of the light which it sheds on the science of legislation]3324-the legislator who has wisdom and practical talent enough to avail himself of the light which it sheds on the science of legislation ?

The authority of government , even such as [I]0-i am willing to submit to,—for [I]0-i will cheerfully obey those who know and can do better than [I]0-i , and in many things even [those who neither know nor can do so well,—is still an impure one]3325-those who neither know nor can do so well,—is still an impure one : to be strictly just , it must have the sanction and consent of the governed . It can have no pure right over [[my]0-i person]3326-my person and property but what [I]0-i concede to it . The progress from an absolute to a limited monarchy , from a limited monarchy to a democracy , is a progress toward a true respect for [the individual]3327-the individual . Even [the Chinese philosopher]3328-the chinese philosopher was wise enough to regard [the individual]3327-the individual as the basis of [the empire]3330-the empire . Is a democracy , such as [we]3318-we know it , the last improvement possible in government ? Is it not possible to take a step further towards recognizing and organizing the rights of [man]2119-man ? There will never be a really free and enlightened State , until [the State]816-the state comes to recognize [the individual]3327-the individual as a higher and independent power , from which all [its]3327-the individual own power and authority are derived , and treats [him]3327-the individual accordingly . [I]0-i please [myself]0-i with imagining a State at last which can afford to be just to [all men]2889-all men , and to treat [the individual]3327-the individual with respect as [a neighbor]3336-a neighbor ; which even would not think it inconsistent with its own repose , if a few were to live aloof from it , not meddling with it , nor embraced by it , who fulfilled all the duties of [neighbors]1826-neighbors and [fellow - men]3338-fellow - men . A State which bore this kind of fruit , and suffered it to drop off as fast as it ripened , would prepare the way for a still more perfect and glorious State , which also [I]0-i have imagined , but not yet anywhere seen .
