------------------------------------------------------------------------

A PLEA FOR [CAPTAIN JOHN BROWN.[6]574-captain john brown.[6 ]

Footnote 6 :

Read to [the citizens of [Concord]24-concord]2393-the citizens of concord , Mass. , Sunday Evening , October 30 , 1859 .

[I]0-i trust that [you]3340-you will pardon [me]0-i for being [here]820-here . [I]0-i do not wish to force [my]0-i thoughts upon [you]3340-you , but [I]0-i feel forced [myself]0-i . Little as [I]0-i know of [Captain Brown]400-brown , [I]0-i would fain do [my]0-i part to correct the tone and the statements of the newspapers , and of [[my]0-i countrymen]2508-my countrymen generally , respecting [his]400-brown character and actions . It costs [us]3343-us nothing to be just . [We]3343-us can at least express [our]3343-us sympathy with , and admiration of , [him]400-brown and [[his]400-brown companions]3344-his companions , and that is what [I]0-i now propose to do .

First , as to [his]400-brown history . [I]0-i will endeavor to omit , as much as possible , what [you]3340-you have already read . [I]0-i need not describe [[his]400-brown person]3345-his person to [you]3340-you , for probably most of [you]3340-you have seen and will not soon forget [him]3345-his person . [I]0-i am told that [[his]3345-his person grandfather]3346-his grandfather , [John Brown]400-brown , was [an officer in the Revolution]3347-an officer in the revolution ; that [he]400-brown [himself]400-brown was born in [Connecticut]33-connecticut about the beginning of this century , but early went with [[his]400-brown father]3348-his father to [Ohio]306-ohio . [I]0-i heard [him]400-brown say that [[his]400-brown father]3348-his father was [a contractor who furnished beef to the army there]3350-a contractor who furnished beef to the army there , in the war of 1812 ; that [he]400-brown accompanied [him]400-brown to [the camp]3351-the camp , and assisted [him]400-brown in that employment , seeing a good deal of military life,—more , perhaps , than if [he]400-brown had been [a soldier]1943-a soldier ; for [he]400-brown was often present at [the councils of [the officers]877-the officers]3353-the councils of the officers . Especially , [he]400-brown learned by experience how [armies]3355-armies are supplied and maintained in the field,—a work which , [he]400-brown observed , requires at least as much experience and skill as to lead [them]3355-armies in battle . [He]400-brown said that [few persons]3356-few persons had any conception of the cost , even the pecuniary cost , of firing a single bullet in war . [He]400-brown saw enough , at any rate , to disgust [him]400-brown with a military life ; indeed , to excite in [him]400-brown a great abhorrence of it ; so much so , that though [he]400-brown was tempted by the offer of [some petty office in [the army]3358-the army]3357-some petty office in the army , when [he]400-brown was about eighteen , [he]400-brown not only declined that , but [he]400-brown also refused to train when warned , and was fined for it . [He]400-brown then resolved that [he]400-brown would never have anything to do with any war , unless it were a war for liberty .

When the troubles in [Kansas]307-kansas began , [he]400-brown sent several of [[his]400-brown sons]3359-his sons thither to strengthen [the party of [the Free State men]3361-the free state men]3360-the party of the free state men , fitting [them]3361-the free state men out with such weapons as [he]400-brown had ; telling [them]3361-the free state men that if the troubles should increase , and there should be need of [him]400-brown , [he]400-brown would follow , to assist [them]3361-the free state men with [his]400-brown hand and counsel . This , as [you]3362-you all know , [he]400-brown soon after did ; and it was through [his]400-brown agency , far more than any other ’s , that [Kansas]307-kansas was made free .

For a part of [his]400-brown life [he]400-brown was [a surveyor]3363-a surveyor , and at one time [he]400-brown was engaged in wool - growing , and [he]400-brown went to [Europe]135-europe as [an agent about that business]3364-an agent about that business . There , as everywhere , [he]400-brown had [his]400-brown eyes about [him]400-brown , and made many original observations . [He]400-brown said , for instance , that [he]400-brown saw why [the soil of [England]31-england]3365-the soil of england was so rich , and that of [Germany]176-germany ( [I]0-i think it was ) so poor , and [he]400-brown thought of writing to some of the crowned heads about it . It was because in [England]31-england the peasantry live on the soil which [they]3366-they cultivate , but in [Germany]176-germany [they]3366-they are gathered into [villages]1687-villages , at night . It is a pity that [he]400-brown did not make a book of [his]400-brown observations .

[I]0-i should say that [he]400-brown was [an old - fashioned man in [his]400-brown respect for the Constitution]3368-an old - fashioned man in his respect for the constitution , and [his]400-brown faith in the permanence of [this Union]3369-this union . Slavery [he]400-brown deemed to be wholly opposed to these , and [he]400-brown was [its determined foe]3370-its determined foe .

[He]400-brown was by descent and birth [a New England farmer]3371-a new england farmer , [a man of great common sense , deliberate and practical as that class]3372-a man of great common sense , deliberate and practical as that class is , and tenfold more so . [He]400-brown was like [the best of [those who stood at [Concord Bridge]308-concord bridge once , on [Lexington Common]288-lexington common]3374-those who stood at concord bridge once , on lexington common]3373-the best of those who stood at concord bridge once , on lexington common , and on [Bunker Hill]309-bunker hill , only [he]400-brown was firmer and higher principled than any that [I]0-i have chanced to hear of as there . It was [no abolition lecturer]3375-no abolition lecturer that converted [him]400-brown . [Ethan Allen]575-ethan allen and [Stark]576-stark , with whom [he]575-ethan allen may in some respects be compared , were rangers in [a lower and less important field]3376-a lower and less important field . [They]3377-they could bravely face [[their]3377-they country ’s foes]3378-their country ’s foes , but [he]400-brown had the courage to face [[his]400-brown country]2191-his country [herself]3380-herself , when [she]3380-herself was in the wrong . [A Western writer]3381-a western writer says , to account for [his]3381-a western writer escape from so many perils , that [he]3381-a western writer was concealed under [a “ rural exterior ”]5431-a “ rural exterior ”[3381-a western writer] ; as if , in [that prairie land]3382-that prairie land , [a hero]3383-a hero should , by good rights , wear [a citizen]2822-a citizen ’s dress only .

[He]3381-a western writer did not go to [the college called [Harvard]310-harvard]3385-the college called harvard , good old [Alma Mater]311-alma mater as [she]311-alma mater is . [He]3381-a western writer was not fed on the pap that is there furnished . As [he]3381-a western writer phrased it , “ [I]3381-a western writer know no more of grammar than one of [your]3388-your calves . ”[3381-a western writer] But [he]3381-a western writer went to [the great university of [the West]1801-the west]3386-the great university of the west , where [he]3381-a western writer sedulously pursued the study of Liberty , for which [he]3381-a western writer had early betrayed a fondness , and having taken many degrees , [he]3381-a western writer finally commenced the public practice of Humanity in [Kansas]307-kansas , as [you]3388-your all know . Such were _ [his]3381-a western writer humanities _ and not any study of grammar . [He]3381-a western writer would have left a Greek accent slanting the wrong way , and righted up [a falling man]3389-a falling man .

[He]3381-a western writer was one of [that class of whom [we]3391-we hear a great deal]3390-that class of whom we hear a great deal , but , for the most part , see nothing at [all,—the Puritans]577-all,—the puritans . It would be in vain to kill [him]3381-a western writer . [He]3381-a western writer died lately in the time of [Cromwell]578-cromwell , but [he]3381-a western writer reappeared here . Why should [he]3381-a western writer not ? [Some of the Puritan stock]3392-some of the puritan stock are said to have come over and settled in [New England]20-new england . [They]3392-some of the puritan stock were [a class that did something else than celebrate [their]3392-some of the puritan stock forefathers ’ day]3393-a class that did something else than celebrate their forefathers ’ day , and eat parched corn in remembrance of that time . [They]3392-some of the puritan stock were neither Democrats nor [Republicans]3394-republicans , but [men of simple habits]3395-men of simple habits , straightforward , prayerful ; not thinking much of [rulers who did not fear [God]554-god , not making many compromises , nor seeking after [available candidates]3397-available candidates]3396-rulers who did not fear god , not making many compromises , nor seeking after available candidates .

“ In [[his]936-one camp]5432-his camp , ”[936-one] as [one]936-one has recently written , and as [I]0-i have [myself]0-i heard [him]936-one state , “ [he]936-one permitted no profanity ; [no man of loose morals]5433-no man of loose morals was suffered to remain there , unless , indeed , as [a prisoner of war]5434-a prisoner of war . ‘ [I]3399-i would rather , ’ said [he]936-one , ‘ have the small - pox , yellow - fever , and cholera , all together in [[my]3399-i camp]5435-my camp , than [a man]1027-a man without principle .... It is a mistake , [sir]5242-sir , that [[our]5438-our people]5439-our people make , when [they]5439-our people think that bullies are [the best fighters]5440-the best fighters , or that [they]5439-our people are [the fit men]5441-the fit men to oppose [these Southerners]5442-these southerners . Give [me]3399-i [men of good principles,—God - fearing men,—men]5443-men of good principles,—god - fearing men,—men who respect [themselves]5442-these southerners , and with a dozen of [them]5442-these southerners [I]3399-i will oppose [any hundred such men as these Buford ruffians]5444-any hundred such men as these buford ruffians . ’ ”[3399-i] [He]3399-i said that if [one]936-one offered [himself]936-one to be [a soldier under [him]936-one , who was forward to tell what [he]936-one could or would do , if [he]936-one could only get sight of [the enemy]2040-the enemy]3401-a soldier under him , who was forward to tell what he could or would do , if he could only get sight of the enemy , [he]936-one had but little confidence in [him]936-one .

[He]936-one was never able to find more than a score or so of [recruits whom [he]936-one would accept , and only about a dozen , among [them]3403-recruits whom he would accept , and only about a dozen , among them his sons , in whom he had perfect faith [[his]936-one sons]3359-his sons , in whom [he]936-one had perfect faith]3403-recruits whom he would accept , and only about a dozen , among them his sons , in whom he had perfect faith . When [he]936-one was [here]820-here , some years ago , [he]936-one showed to a few a little manuscript book,—his “ orderly book ”[936-one] [I]0-i think [he]936-one called it,—containing the names of [[his]936-one company in [Kansas]307-kansas]3406-his company in kansas , and the rules by which [they]3359-his sons bound [themselves]3359-his sons ; and [he]936-one stated that [several of [them]3359-his sons]3407-several of them had already sealed the contract with [their]3407-several of them blood . When [some one]3216-some one remarked that , with the addition of [a chaplain]2434-a chaplain , it would have been [a perfect Cromwellian troop]3410-a perfect cromwellian troop , [he]936-one observed that [he]936-one would have been glad to add [a chaplain]2434-a chaplain to the list , if [he]936-one could have found one who could fill [that office]2883-that office worthily . It is easy enough to find one for [the United States army]3413-the united states army . [I]0-i believe that [he]936-one had prayers in [[his]936-one camp]5432-his camp morning and evening , nevertheless .

[He]936-one was [a man of Spartan habits]3415-a man of spartan habits , and at sixty was scrupulous about [his]936-one diet at [your]3416-your table , excusing [himself]936-one by saying that [he]936-one must eat sparingly and fare hard , as became [a soldier]1943-a soldier , or [one who was fitting [himself]936-one for difficult enterprises , a life of exposure]3418-one who was fitting himself for difficult enterprises , a life of exposure .

[A man of rare common sense and directness of speech]3419-a man of rare common sense and directness of speech , as of action ; a transcendentalist above all , [a man of ideas and principles,—that]3420-a man of ideas and principles,—that was what distinguished [him]3420-a man of ideas and principles,—that . Not yielding to a whim or transient impulse , but carrying out the purpose of a life . [I]0-i noticed that [he]936-one did not overstate anything , but spoke within bounds . [I]0-i remember , particularly , how , in [his]936-one speech here , [he]936-one referred to what [[his]936-one family]1350-his family had suffered in [Kansas]307-kansas , without ever giving the least vent to [his]936-one pent - up fire . It was a volcano with an ordinary chimney - flue . Also referring to the deeds of [certain Border Ruffians]3422-certain border ruffians , [he]936-one said , rapidly paring away [his]936-one speech , like [an experienced soldier , keeping a reserve of force and meaning]3423-an experienced soldier , keeping a reserve of force and meaning , “ [They]3423-an experienced soldier , keeping a reserve of force and meaning had a perfect right to be hung . ”[936-one] [He]936-one was not in the least [a rhetorician]3424-a rhetorician , was not talking to [Buncombe]579-buncombe or [[his]936-one constituents]2471-his constituents anywhere , had no need to invent anything but to tell the simple truth , and communicate [his]936-one own resolution ; therefore [he]936-one appeared incomparably strong , and eloquence in Congress and elsewhere seemed to [me]0-i at a discount . It was like the speeches of [Cromwell]578-cromwell compared with [those of [an ordinary king]3427-an ordinary king]3426-those of an ordinary king .

As for [his]936-one tact and prudence , [I]0-i will merely say , that at a time when scarcely [a man from [the Free States]3429-the free states]3428-a man from the free states was able to reach [Kansas]307-kansas by any direct route , at least without having [his]3428-a man from the free states arms taken from [him]3428-a man from the free states , [he]3428-a man from the free states , carrying what imperfect guns and other weapons [he]3428-a man from the free states could collect , openly and slowly drove [an ox - cart]3430-an ox - cart through [Missouri]299-missouri , apparently in the capacity of [a surveyor]3363-a surveyor , with [his]3363-a surveyor surveying compass exposed in it , and so passed unsuspected , and had ample opportunity to learn the designs of [the enemy]2040-the enemy . For some time after [his]3363-a surveyor arrival [he]3363-a surveyor still followed the same profession . When , for instance , [he]3363-a surveyor saw a knot of the ruffians on [the prairie]2396-the prairie , discussing , of course , the single topic which then occupied [their]3434-their minds , [he]3363-a surveyor would , perhaps , take [his]3363-a surveyor compass and one of [[his]3363-a surveyor sons]3359-his sons , and proceed to run an imaginary line right through the very spot on which [that conclave]3436-that conclave had assembled , and when [he]3363-a surveyor came up to [them]3359-his sons , [he]3363-a surveyor would naturally pause and have some talk with [them]3359-his sons , learning [their]3359-his sons news , and , at last , all [their]3359-his sons plans perfectly ; and having thus completed [his]3363-a surveyor real survey [he]3363-a surveyor would resume [his]3363-a surveyor imaginary one , and run on [his]3363-a surveyor line till [he]3363-a surveyor was out of sight .

When [I]0-i expressed surprise that [he]3363-a surveyor could live in [Kansas]307-kansas at all , with a price set upon [his]3363-a surveyor head , and so large a number , including [the authorities]1465-the authorities , exasperated against [him]3363-a surveyor , [he]3363-a surveyor accounted for it by saying , “ It is perfectly well understood that [I]3363-a surveyor will not be taken . ”[3363-a surveyor] Much of the time for some years [he]3363-a surveyor has had to skulk in [swamps]3438-swamps , suffering from poverty and from sickness , which was the consequence of exposure , befriended only by [Indians]2094-indians and a few whites . But though it might be known that [he]3363-a surveyor was lurking in [a particular swamp]3440-a particular swamp , [[his]3363-a surveyor foes]3441-his foes commonly did not care to go in after [him]3363-a surveyor . [He]3363-a surveyor could even come out into [a town where there were more [Border Ruffians]580-border ruffians than [Free State men]3443-free state men]3442-a town where there were more border ruffians than free state men , and transact some business , without delaying long , and yet not be molested ; for , said [he]3363-a surveyor , “ [No little handful of men]5445-no little handful of men were willing to undertake it , and a large body could not be got together in season . ”[3363-a surveyor]

As for [his]3363-a surveyor recent failure , [we]3444-we do not know the facts about it . It was evidently far from being a wild and desperate attempt . [[His]3363-a surveyor enemy]3445-his enemy , [Mr. Vallandigham]581-mr. vallandigham , is compelled to say , that “ it was among the best planned and executed conspiracies that ever failed . ”[581-mr. vallandigham]

Not to mention [his]3363-a surveyor other successes , was it a failure , or did it show a want of good management , to deliver from bondage [a dozen human beings]3446-a dozen human beings , and walk off with [them]3446-a dozen human beings by broad daylight , for weeks if not months , at a leisurely pace , through [one State]3447-one state after another , for half the length of [the North]2638-the north , conspicuous to all parties , with a price set upon [his]3363-a surveyor head , going into a court - room on [his]3363-a surveyor way and telling what [he]3363-a surveyor had done , thus convincing [Missouri]299-missouri that it was not profitable to try to hold [slaves]2543-slaves in [his]3363-a surveyor neighborhood?—and this , not because [the government menials]3450-the government menials were lenient , but because [they]3450-the government menials were afraid of [him]3363-a surveyor .

Yet [he]3363-a surveyor did not attribute [his]3363-a surveyor success , foolishly , to “ [his]3363-a surveyor star , ”[3363-a surveyor] or to any magic . [He]3363-a surveyor said , truly , that the reason why such greatly superior numbers quailed before [him]3363-a surveyor was , as one of [[his]3363-a surveyor prisoners]3451-his prisoners confessed , because [they]3451-his prisoners _ lacked a cause_,—a kind of armor which [he]3363-a surveyor and [[his]3363-a surveyor party]3452-his party never lacked . When the time came , [few men]3453-few men were found willing to lay down [their]3453-few men lives in defence of what [they]3453-few men knew to be wrong ; [they]3453-few men did not like that this should be [their]3453-few men last act in [this world]3023-this world .

But to make haste to _ [his]3363-a surveyor _ last act , and its effects .

The newspapers seem to ignore , or perhaps are really ignorant of the fact , that there are at least as many as two or three individuals to [a town throughout [the North]312-the north]3455-a town throughout the north who think much as [the present speaker]3456-the present speaker does about [him]3456-the present speaker and [his]3456-the present speaker enterprise . [I]0-i do not hesitate to say that [they]3451-his prisoners are an important and growing party . [We]3457-we aspire to be something more than stupid and timid chattels , pretending to read history and [our]3457-we Bibles , but desecrating [every house]970-every house and every day [we]3457-we breathe in . Perhaps [anxious politicians]3459-anxious politicians may prove that [only seventeen white men]3460-only seventeen white men and [five negroes]3461-five negroes were concerned in the late enterprise ; but [their]3460-only seventeen white men very anxiety to prove this might suggest to [themselves]3460-only seventeen white men that all is not told . Why do [they]3460-only seventeen white men still dodge the truth ? [They]3460-only seventeen white men are so anxious because of a dim consciousness of the fact , which [they]3460-only seventeen white men do not distinctly face , that at least [a million of [the free inhabitants of [the United States]1794-the united states]3463-the free inhabitants of the united states]3462-a million of the free inhabitants of the united states would have rejoiced if it had succeeded . [They]3460-only seventeen white men at most only criticise the tactics . Though [we]3457-we wear no crape , the thought of [that man]2442-that man ’s position and probable fate is spoiling many [a man]1027-a man ’s day here at [the North]2638-the north for other thinking . If [any one who has seen [him]2442-that man here]3468-any one who has seen him here can pursue successfully any other train of thought , [I]0-i do not know what [he]2442-that man is made of . If there is [any such who gets [his]2442-that man usual allowance of sleep]3469-any such who gets his usual allowance of sleep , [I]0-i will warrant [him]2442-that man to fatten easily under any circumstances which do not touch [his]2442-that man body or purse . [I]0-i put a piece of paper and a pencil under [my]0-i pillow , and when [I]0-i could not sleep , [I]0-i wrote in the dark .

On the whole , [my]0-i respect for [[my]0-i fellow - men]3470-my fellow - men , except as one may outweigh a million , is not being increased these days . [I]0-i have noticed the cold - blooded way in which [newspaper writers]3471-newspaper writers and [men]1028-men generally speak of this event , as if [an ordinary malefactor]3473-an ordinary malefactor , though one of unusual “ pluck,”—as[3474-the governor of virginia] [the Governor of [Virginia]195-virginia]3474-the governor of virginia is reported to have said , using the language of [the cock - pit]3475-the cock - pit , “ [the gamest man [he]5446-the gamest man he ever saw,”—had been caught ever saw,”—had[3474-the governor of virginia] been caught]5446-the gamest man he ever saw,”—had been caught , and were about to be hung . [He]3474-the governor of virginia was not dreaming of [[his]3474-the governor of virginia foes]3441-his foes when [the governor]2432-the governor thought [he]3474-the governor of virginia looked so brave . It turns what sweetness [I]0-i have to gall , to hear , or hear of , the remarks of [some of [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors]3478-some of my neighbors . When [we]3480-we heard at first that [he]3474-the governor of virginia was dead , [one of [[my]0-i townsmen]2394-my townsmen]3481-one of my townsmen observed that “ [he]3474-the governor of virginia died as [the fool dieth ”]5447-the fool dieth ”[3474-the governor of virginia] ; which , pardon [me]0-i , for an instant suggested a likeness in [him]3474-the governor of virginia dying to [[my]0-i neighbor]2954-my neighbor living . [Others]985-others , craven - hearted , said disparagingly , that “ [he]3474-the governor of virginia threw [his]3474-the governor of virginia life away , ”[985-others] because [he]3481-one of my townsmen resisted [the government]1992-the government . Which way have [they]985-others thrown _ [their]985-others _ lives , pray?—such as would praise [a man]1027-a man for attacking singly [an ordinary band of [thieves]2418-thieves or [murderers]3489-murderers]3487-an ordinary band of thieves or murderers . [I]0-i hear another ask , [Yankee]583-yankee - like , “ What will [he]1027-a man gain by it ? ”[583-yankee] as if [he]1027-a man expected to fill [his]1027-a man pockets by this enterprise . [Such a one]3490-such a one has no idea of gain but in this worldly sense . If it does not lead to a “ surprise ”[1027-a man] party , if [he]1027-a man does not get a new pair of boots , or a vote of thanks , it must be a failure . “ But [he]1027-a man wo n’t gain anything by it . ”[0-i] Well , no , [I]0-i do n’t suppose [he]1027-a man could get four - and - sixpence a day for being hung , take the year round ; but then [he]1027-a man stands a chance to save a considerable part of [his]1027-a man soul,—and _ such _ a soul!—when _ [you]3491-you _ do not . No doubt [you]3491-you can get more in [your]3491-you market for a quart of milk than for a quart of blood , but that is not the market that [heroes]2874-heroes carry [their]2874-heroes blood to .

Such do not know that like the seed is the fruit , and that , in [the moral world]3493-the moral world , when good seed is planted , good fruit is inevitable , and does not depend on [our]3494-our watering and cultivating ; that when [you]3495-you plant , or bury , [a hero in [[his]3496-a hero in his field field]3497-his field]3496-a hero in his field , a crop of [heroes]2874-heroes is sure to spring up . This is a seed of such force and vitality , that it does not ask [our]3494-our leave to germinate .

The momentary charge at [Balaclava]584-balaclava , in obedience to a blundering command , proving what a perfect machine [the soldier]1002-the soldier is , has , properly enough , been celebrated by [a poet - laureate]3500-a poet - laureate ; but the steady , and for the most part successful , charge of [this man]1573-this man , for some years , against the legions of Slavery , in obedience to an infinitely higher command , is as much more memorable than that , as [an intelligent and conscientious man]3502-an intelligent and conscientious man is superior to a machine . Do [you]3503-you think that that will go unsung ?

“ Served [him]1573-this man right,”—“A[1573-this man] dangerous man,”—“He is undoubtedly insane . ”[2874-heroes] So [they]2874-heroes proceed to live [their]2874-heroes sane , and wise , and altogether admirable lives , reading [their]2874-heroes Plutarch a little , but chiefly pausing at that feat of [Putnam]585-putnam , who was let down into [a wolf ’s den]3504-a wolf ’s den ; and in this wise [they]2874-heroes nourish [themselves]2874-heroes for brave and patriotic deeds some time or other . [The Tract Society]3505-the tract society could afford to print that story of [Putnam]585-putnam . [You]3506-you might open [the district schools]3507-the district schools with the reading of it , for there is nothing about Slavery or the Church in [it]3505-the tract society ; unless it occurs to [the reader]747-the reader that [some pastors]3509-some pastors are _ wolves _ in sheep ’s clothing . “ The American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions ”[747-the reader] even , might dare to protest against _ that _ wolf . [I]0-i have heard of boards , and of American boards , but it chances that [I]0-i never heard of this particular lumber till lately . And yet [I]0-i hear of [Northern men]2764-northern men , and [women]1302-women , and [children]1123-children , by [families]1596-families , buying a “ life membership ”[2764-northern men] in such societies as these . A life membership in the grave ! [You]3514-you can get buried cheaper than that .

[Our]3515-our foes are in [our]3515-our midst and all about [us]3515-our . [We]3515-our are mere figure - heads upon a hulk , with livers in the place of hearts . “ All is quiet at [Harper ’s Ferry]317-harper ’s ferry , ”[581-mr. vallandigham] say the journals . What is the character of that calm which follows when the law and [the slaveholder]2468-the slaveholder prevail ? [I]0-i regard this event as a touchstone designed to bring out , with glaring distinctness , the character of [this government]1187-this government . [We]3675-we needed to be thus assisted to see it by the light of history . It needed to see itself . When [a government]2983-a government puts forth its strength on the side of injustice , as [ours]3677-ours to maintain slavery and kill the liberators of [the slave]2484-the slave , it reveals itself a merely brute force , or worse , a demoniacal force . It is the head of [the Plug - Uglies]318-the plug - uglies . It is more manifest than ever that tyranny rules . [I]0-i see [this government]1187-this government to be effectually allied with [France]116-france and [Austria]319-austria in oppressing mankind . There sits [a tyrant holding fettered four millions of slaves]3680-a tyrant holding fettered four millions of slaves ; here comes [[their]3680-a tyrant holding fettered four millions of slaves heroic liberator]3681-their heroic liberator . [This most hypocritical and diabolical government]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government looks up from [its]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government seat on the gasping four millions , and inquires with an assumption of innocence : “ What do [you]5464-you assault [me]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government for ? Am [I]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government not [an honest man]2927-an honest man ? Cease agitation on this subject , or [I]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government will make [a slave of [you]5464-you]5466-a slave of you , too , or else hang [you]5464-you . ”[3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government]

[We]3683-we talk about [a _ representative _ government]3684-a _ representative _ government ; but what a monster of a government is that where [the noblest faculties of the mind]3685-the noblest faculties of the mind , and [the _ whole _ heart]3686-the _ whole _ heart , are not _ represented _ . A semi - human tiger or ox , stalking over the earth , with [its]3682-this most hypocritical and diabolical government heart taken out and the top of its brain shot away . [Heroes]2874-heroes have fought well on [their]2874-heroes stumps when [their]2874-heroes legs were shot off , but [I]0-i never heard of any good done by [such a government]3006-such a government as that .

The only government that [I]0-i recognize,—and it matters not how few are at the head of [it]3006-such a government , or how small [its]3006-such a government army,—is that power that establishes justice in [the land]834-the land , never that which establishes injustice . What shall [we]3683-we think of a government to which [all the truly brave and just men in [the land]834-the land]3690-all the truly brave and just men in the land are [enemies]2880-enemies , standing between it and those whom it oppresses ? A government that pretends to be [Christian]597-christian and crucifies a million Christs every day !

Treason ! Where does such treason take its rise ? [I]0-i can not help thinking of [you]3693-you as [you]3693-you deserve , [ye]3694-ye governments . Can [you]3693-you dry up the fountains of thought ? High treason , when it is resistance to tyranny here below , has its origin in , and is first committed by , the power that makes and forever recreates [man]2119-man . When [you]3696-you have caught and hung all [these human rebels]3697-these human rebels , [you]3696-you have accomplished nothing but [your]3696-you own guilt , for [you]3696-you have not struck at the fountain - head . [You]3696-you presume to contend with a foe against whom [West Point]320-west point cadets and rifled cannon _ point _ not . Can all the art of the cannon - founder tempt matter to turn against [its maker]3698-its maker ? Is the form in which [the founder]772-the founder thinks [he]772-the founder casts it more essential than the constitution of it and of [himself]772-the founder ?

[The United States]1794-the united states have a coffle of [four millions of [slaves]2543-slaves]3701-four millions of slaves . [They]3701-four millions of slaves are determined to keep [them]3701-four millions of slaves in this condition ; and [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts is [one of [the confederated overseers to prevent [their]3701-four millions of slaves escape]3704-the confederated overseers to prevent their escape]3703-one of the confederated overseers to prevent their escape . Such are not [all the inhabitants of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]3705-all the inhabitants of massachusetts , but such are [[they]3705-all the inhabitants of massachusetts who rule and are obeyed here]3706-they who rule and are obeyed here . It was [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts , as well as [Virginia]195-virginia , that put down this insurrection at [[Harper]598-harper ’s Ferry]317-harper ’s ferry . [She]317-harper ’s ferry sent [the marines]3707-the marines [there]939-there , and [she]317-harper ’s ferry will have _ to pay the penalty of [her]317-harper ’s ferry sin _ .

Suppose that there is a society in [this State that out of [its]3709-this state that out of its own purse and magnanimity saves all the fugitive slaves that run to us , and protects our colored fellow - citizens own purse and magnanimity saves [all the fugitive slaves that run to [us]3711-our]3710-all the fugitive slaves that run to us , and protects [[our]3711-our colored fellow - citizens]3712-our colored fellow - citizens]3709-this state that out of its own purse and magnanimity saves all the fugitive slaves that run to us , and protects our colored fellow - citizens , and leaves the other work to [the government]1992-the government , so - called . If [private men]3715-private men are obliged to perform [the offices of government]3716-the offices of government , to protect [the weak and dispense justice]3717-the weak and dispense justice , then [the government]1992-the government becomes only [a hired man]3719-a hired man , or [clerk]3720-clerk , to perform [menial or indifferent services]3721-menial or indifferent services . Of course , that is but the shadow of [a government whose existence necessitates a Vigilant Committee]3722-a government whose existence necessitates a vigilant committee . What should [we]3711-our think of [the Oriental Cadi]599-the oriental cadi even , behind whom worked in secret [a vigilant committee]3723-a vigilant committee ? But such is the character of [[our]3711-our Northern States]3724-our northern states generally ; each has [its Vigilant Committee]3725-its vigilant committee . And , to a certain extent , [these crazy governments]3726-these crazy governments recognize and accept this relation . [They]3726-these crazy governments say , virtually , “ [We]3711-our ’ll be glad to work for [you]5467-you on these terms , only do n’t make a noise about it . ”[3726-these crazy governments] And thus [the government]1992-the government , its salary being insured , withdraws into [the back shop]3728-the back shop , taking the Constitution with it , and bestows most of its labor on repairing that . When [I]0-i hear it at work sometimes , as [I]0-i go by , it reminds [me]0-i , at best , of [those farmers who in winter contrive to turn a penny by following the coopering business]3729-those farmers who in winter contrive to turn a penny by following the coopering business . And what kind of spirit is [their]3729-those farmers who in winter contrive to turn a penny by following the coopering business barrel made to hold ? [The only _ free _ road , [the Underground Railroad]3733-the underground railroad]3732-the only _ free _ road , the underground railroad , is owned and managed by [the Vigilant Committee]3734-the vigilant committee . _ [They]3734-the vigilant committee _ have tunnelled under [the whole breadth of [the land]834-the land]3735-the whole breadth of the land . Such a government is losing its power and respectability as surely as water runs out of [a leaky vessel]3737-a leaky vessel , and is held by one that can contain it .

[I]0-i hear many condemn [these men]1186-these men because [they]1186-these men were so few . When were the good and the brave ever in a majority ? Would [you]3739-you have had [him]3740-his wait till that time came?—till [you]3739-you and [I]0-i came over to [him]3740-his ? The very fact that [he]3740-his had no rabble or troop of hirelings about [him]3740-his would alone distinguish [him]3740-his from [ordinary heroes]3741-ordinary heroes . [[His]3740-his company]2307-his company was small indeed , because few could be found worthy to pass muster . [Each one who there laid down [his]3743-each one who there laid down his life for the poor and oppressed life for [the poor and oppressed]3744-the poor and oppressed]3743-each one who there laid down his life for the poor and oppressed was [a picked man]3745-a picked man , culled out of many thousands , if not millions ; apparently [a man of principle , of rare courage , and devoted humanity]3746-a man of principle , of rare courage , and devoted humanity ; ready to sacrifice [his]3743-each one who there laid down his life for the poor and oppressed life at any moment for the benefit of [[his]3743-each one who there laid down his life for the poor and oppressed fellow - man]3747-his fellow - man . When [I]0-i think of [him]3740-his , and [[his]3740-his six sons]3759-his six sons , and [[his]3740-his son]3760-his son - in - law , not to enumerate [the others]3761-the others , enlisted for this fight , proceeding coolly , reverently , humanely to work , for months if not years , sleeping and waking upon it , summering and wintering the thought , without expecting any reward but a good conscience , while almost all [America]23-america stood ranked on the other side,—I say again that it affects [me]0-i as a sublime spectacle . If [he]3740-his had had any journal advocating “ _ [his]3740-his cause _ , ”[3740-his] any organ , as the phrase is , monotonously and wearisomely playing the same old tune , and then passing round the hat , it would have been fatal to [his]3740-his efficiency . If [he]3740-his had acted in any way so as to be let alone by [the government]1992-the government , [he]3740-his might have been suspected . [I]0-i agree with [him]1027-a man . [[They]3769-they who are continually shocked by slavery have some right to be shocked by the violent death of [the slaveholder]2468-the slaveholder]3770-they who are continually shocked by slavery have some right to be shocked by the violent death of the slaveholder , but [no others]1771-no others . At any rate , [I]0-i do not think it is quite sane for [one]936-one to spend [his]936-one whole life in talking or writing about this matter , unless [he]936-one is continuously inspired , and [I]0-i have not done so . [A man]1027-a man may have other affairs to attend to . [I]0-i do not wish to kill nor to be killed , but [I]0-i can foresee circumstances in which both these things would be by [me]0-i unavoidable . [We]3777-we preserve the so - called peace of [[our]3777-we community]3778-our community by deeds of petty violence every day . Look at [the policeman]3779-the policeman ’s billy and handcuffs ! Look at [the jail]5413-the jail ! Look at the gallows ! Look at [the chaplain of [the regiment]3782-the regiment]3781-the chaplain of the regiment ! [We]3777-we are hoping only to live safely on the outskirts of _ this _ provisional army . So [we]3777-we defend [ourselves]3777-we and [our]3777-we hen - roosts , and maintain slavery . [I]0-i know that the mass of [[my]0-i countrymen]2508-my countrymen think that the only righteous use that can be made of [Sharpe]592-sharpe ’s rifles and revolvers is to fight duels with [them]2508-my countrymen , when [we]3777-we are insulted by other nations , or to hunt [Indians]2094-indians , or shoot [fugitive slaves]2479-fugitive slaves with [them]2094-indians , or the like . [I]0-i think that for once [the Sharpe]592-sharpe ’s rifles and the revolvers were employed in a righteous cause . The tools were in the hands of one who could use [them]592-sharpe .

The same indignation that is said to have cleared [the temple]3786-the temple once will clear it again . The question is not about the weapon , but the spirit in which [you]3787-you use it . [No man]5310-no man has appeared in [America]23-america , as yet , who loved [[his]5310-no man fellow - man]3747-his fellow - man so well , and treated [him]3747-his fellow - man so tenderly . [He]3747-his fellow - man lived for [him]3747-his fellow - man . [He]3747-his fellow - man took up [his]3747-his fellow - man life and [he]3747-his fellow - man laid it down for [him]3747-his fellow - man . What sort of violence is that which is encouraged , not by [soldiers]1016-soldiers , but by [peaceable citizens]3791-peaceable citizens , not so much by [laymen]3792-laymen as by [ministers of the Gospel]3793-ministers of the gospel , not so much by [the fighting sects]3794-the fighting sects as by [the Quakers]3795-the quakers , and not so much by [Quaker men]3796-quaker men as by [Quaker women]3797-quaker women ?

This event advertises [me]0-i that there is such a fact as death,—the possibility of [a man]1027-a man ’s dying . It seems as if [no man]5310-no man had ever died in [America]23-america before ; for in order to die [you]3800-you must first have lived . [I]0-i do n’t believe in the hearses , and palls , and funerals that [they]3796-quaker men have had . There was no death in the case , because there had been no life ; [they]3796-quaker men merely rotted or sloughed off , pretty much as [they]3796-quaker men had rotted or sloughed along . [No temple]3801-no temple ’s veil was rent , only a hole dug somewhere . Let [the dead]3802-the dead bury [their]3802-the dead dead . The best of [them]3802-the dead fairly ran down like a clock . [Franklin,—Washington,—they]600-franklin,—washington,—they were let off without dying ; [they]3802-the dead were merely missing one day . [I]0-i hear a good many pretend that [they]3802-the dead are going to die ; or that [they]3802-the dead have died , for aught that [I]0-i know . Nonsense ! [I]0-i ’ll defy [them]3802-the dead to do it . [They]3802-the dead have n’t got life enough in [them]3802-the dead . [They]3802-the dead ’ll deliquesce like fungi , and keep [a hundred eulogists]3803-a hundred eulogists mopping the spot where [they]3802-the dead left off . [Only half a dozen or so]3804-only half a dozen or so have died since [the world]741-the world began . Do [you]3806-you think that [you]3806-you are going to die , [sir]5242-sir ? No ! there ’s no hope of [you]3806-you . [You]3806-you have n’t got [your]3806-you lesson yet . [You]3806-you ’ve got to stay after [school]3808-school . [We]3809-we make a needless ado about capital punishment,—taking lives , when there is no life to take . _ Memento mori ! _ [We]3809-we do n’t understand that sublime sentence which [some worthy]3810-some worthy got sculptured on [his]3810-some worthy gravestone once . [We]3809-we ’ve interpreted it in a grovelling and snivelling sense ; [we]3809-we ’ve wholly forgotten how to die .

But be sure [you]3811-you do die nevertheless . Do [your]3811-you work , and finish it . If [you]3811-you know how to begin , [you]3811-you will know when to end .

[These men]1186-these men , in teaching [us]3809-we how to die , have at the same time taught [us]3809-we how to live . If [this man]1573-this man ’s acts and words do not create a revival , it will be the severest possible satire on the acts and words that do . It is the best news that [America]23-america has ever heard . It has already quickened the feeble pulse of [the North]2638-the north , and infused more and more generous blood into [her]3815-her veins and heart , than any number of years of what is called commercial and political prosperity could . [They]3823-they talk as if it were impossible that [a man could be “ divinely appointed ”]5469-a man could be “ divinely appointed ”[5469-a man could be “ divinely appointed ”] in these days to do any work whatever ; as if vows and religion were out of date as connected with [any man]3266-any man ’s daily work ; as if [the agent]3825-the agent to abolish slavery could only be [somebody appointed by [the President]2987-the president]3826-somebody appointed by the president , or by [some political party]3828-some political party .
