After [his]401-carlyle marriage [he]401-carlyle “ resided partly at [Comely Bank]352-comely bank , [Edinburgh]67-edinburgh ; and for a year or two at [Craigenputtock]353-craigenputtock , [a wild and solitary farm - house in [the upper part of [Dumfriesshire]354-dumfriesshire]5608-the upper part of dumfriesshire , ”[401-carlyle] at which last place , amid [barren heather hills]4129-barren heather hills , [he]401-carlyle was visited by [[our]4130-our countryman]4131-our countryman , [Emerson]643-emerson]5607-a wild and solitary farm - house in the upper part of dumfriesshire , ” at which last place , amid barren heather hills , he was visited by our countryman , emerson . With [Emerson]643-emerson [he]401-carlyle still corresponds . [He]401-carlyle was early intimate with [Edward Irving]639-edward irving , and continued to be [[his]401-carlyle friend]4132-his friend until the latter ’s death . Concerning this “ freest , [brotherliest]5609-brotherliest , bravest human soul , ”[401-carlyle] and [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s relation to [him]401-carlyle , [those whom it concerns]4133-those whom it concerns will do well to consult a notice of [his]401-carlyle death in [Fraser]642-fraser ’s Magazine for 1835 , reprinted in the Miscellanies . [He]401-carlyle also corresponded with [Goethe]644-goethe . Latterly , [we]4134-we hear , [the poet Sterling]4135-the poet sterling was [his]4135-the poet sterling only intimate acquaintance in [England]31-england .

[He]4135-the poet sterling has spent the last quarter of [his]4135-the poet sterling life in [London]240-london , writing books ; has the fame , as [all readers]4136-all readers know , of having made [England]31-england acquainted with [Germany]176-germany , in late years , and done much else that is novel and remarkable in literature . [He]4135-the poet sterling especially is [the literary man of those parts]4137-the literary man of those parts . [You]4138-you may imagine [him]4135-the poet sterling living in altogether a retired and simple way , with [small family]4139-small family , in a quiet part of [London]240-london , called [Chelsea]355-chelsea , a little out of the din of commerce , in “ [Cheyne Row]356-cheyne row , ”[4140-one traveller] there , not far from [the “ Chelsea Hospital]5610-the “ chelsea hospital . ”[4140-one traveller] “ A little past this , and [an old ivy - clad church , with [its buried generations lying around it]5612-its buried generations lying around it]5611-an old ivy - clad church , with its buried generations lying around it , ”[4140-one traveller] writes [one traveller]4140-one traveller , “ [you]4140-one traveller come to [an antique street]5613-an antique street running at right angles with [the Thames]357-the thames , and , a few steps from [the river]905-the river , [you]4140-one traveller find [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s name on the door . ”[4140-one traveller] “ [A Scotch lass]5615-a scotch lass ushers [you]4140-one traveller into [the second story front chamber]5616-the second story front chamber , which is [the spacious workshop of [the world maker]5618-the world maker]5617-the spacious workshop of the world maker . ”[4135-the poet sterling] Here [he]4135-the poet sterling sits a long time together , with many books and papers about [him]4135-the poet sterling ; many new books , [we]4141-we have been told , on the upper shelves , uncut , with the “ [author]744-author ’s respects ”[4142-them] in [them]4142-them ; in late months , with many manuscripts in an old English hand , and innumerable pamphlets , from [the public libraries]4143-the public libraries , relating to the Cromwellian period ; now , perhaps , looking out into [the street on brick and pavement]4144-the street on brick and pavement , for a change , and now upon some rod of grass ground in the rear ; or , perchance , [he]4135-the poet sterling steps over to [the British Museum]4145-the british museum , and makes that [[his]4135-the poet sterling studio]4146-his studio for the time . This is the fore part of the day ; that is the way with [literary men]4147-literary men commonly ; and then in the afternoon , [we]4141-we presume , [he]4135-the poet sterling takes a short run of a mile or so through [the suburbs]1933-the suburbs out into [the country]750-the country ; [we]4141-we think [he]4135-the poet sterling would run that way , though so short a trip might not take [him]4135-the poet sterling to very sylvan or [rustic places]4150-rustic places . In the mean while , [people]3564-people are calling to _ see _ [him]4135-the poet sterling , from [various quarters]4152-various quarters , few very worthy of being _ seen _ by [him]4135-the poet sterling ; “ distinguished [travellers from [America]23-america]5620-travellers from america , ”[3564-people] not a few ; to all and sundry of whom [he]4135-the poet sterling gives freely of [his]4135-the poet sterling yet unwritten rich and flashing soliloquy , in exchange for whatever [they]4153-they may have to offer ; speaking [his]4135-the poet sterling English , as [they]4153-they say , with a “ broad Scotch accent , ”[4153-they] talking , to [their]4153-they astonishment and to [ours]4154-ours , very much as [he]4135-the poet sterling writes , a sort of [Carlylese]645-carlylese , [his]4135-the poet sterling discourse “ coming to its climaxes , ever and anon , in long , deep , chest - shaking bursts of laughter . ”[645-carlylese]

[He]4135-the poet sterling goes to [Scotland]358-scotland sometimes , to visit [[his]4135-the poet sterling native heath - clad hills]4155-his native heath - clad hills , having some interest still in [the earth there]4156-the earth there ; such names as [Craigenputtock]353-craigenputtock and [Ecclefechan]347-ecclefechan , which [we]4157-we have already quoted , stand for habitable places there to [him]4135-the poet sterling ; or [he]4135-the poet sterling rides to [the seacoast of [England]31-england]4158-the seacoast of england in [his]4135-the poet sterling vacations , upon [his]4135-the poet sterling horse [Yankee]583-yankee , bought by the sale of [his]4135-the poet sterling books here , as [we]4157-we have been told .

How , after all , [he]4135-the poet sterling gets [his]4135-the poet sterling living ; what proportion of [his]4135-the poet sterling daily bread [he]4135-the poet sterling earns by day - labor or job - work with [his]4135-the poet sterling pen , what [he]4135-the poet sterling inherits , what steals,—questions whose answers are so significant , and not to be omitted in [his]4135-the poet sterling biography,—we , alas ! are unable to answer here . It may be worth the while to state that [he]4135-the poet sterling is [not a Reformer]4159-not a reformer in [our]4157-we sense of the term,—eats , drinks , and sleeps , thinks and believes , professes and practises , not according to the New England standard , nor to the Old English wholly . Nevertheless , [we]4157-we are told that [he]4135-the poet sterling is a sort of lion in certain quarters there , “ an amicable centre for [men of the most opposite opinions , ”[4135-the poet sterling] and “ listened to as an oracle]5621-men of the most opposite opinions , ” and “ listened to as an oracle , ”[4135-the poet sterling] “ smoking [his]4135-the poet sterling perpetual pipe . ”[4135-the poet sterling]

[A rather tall , gaunt figure , with intent face , dark hair and complexion , and the air of a student]4160-a rather tall , gaunt figure , with intent face , dark hair and complexion , and the air of a student ; not altogether well in body , from sitting too long in [his]4135-the poet sterling workhouse,—he , born in [the border country]4161-the border country and descended from moss - troopers , it may be . [We]4157-we have seen several pictures of [him]4135-the poet sterling [here]820-here ; one , a full - length portrait , with hat and overall , if it did not tell [us]4157-we much , told the fewest lies ; another , [we]4157-we remember , was well said to have “ too combed a look ”[4157-we] ; one other also [we]4157-we have seen in which [we]4157-we discern some features of [the man [we]4157-we are thinking of]4163-the man we are thinking of ; but the only ones worth remembering , after all , are those which [he]4163-the man we are thinking of has unconsciously drawn of [himself]4163-the man we are thinking of .

When [we]4157-we remember how these volumes came over to [us]4157-we , with [their]4164-their encouragement and provocation from month to month , and what commotion [they]4164-their created in many private breasts , [we]4157-we wonder that [the country]750-the country did not ring , from [shore]2154-shore to [shore]2154-shore , from [the Atlantic]359-the atlantic to [the Pacific]325-the pacific , with its greeting ; and [the Boones]648-the boones and Crockets of [the West]187-the west make haste to hail [him]4163-the man we are thinking of , whose wide humanity embraces them too . Of all that the packets have brought over to [us]4157-we , has there been any richer cargo than this ? What else has been English news for so long a season ? What else , of late years , has been [England]31-england to us,—to [us]4157-we who read books , [we]4157-we mean ? Unless [we]4157-we remembered it as the scene where the age of [Wordsworth]640-wordsworth was spending itself , and [a few younger muses]4168-a few younger muses were trying [their]4168-a few younger muses wings , and from time to time , as [the residence of [Landor]649-landor]4169-the residence of landor , [Carlyle]401-carlyle alone , since the death of [Coleridge]650-coleridge , has kept the promise of [England]31-england . It is the best apology for all the bustle and the sin of commerce , that it has made [us]4157-we acquainted with the thoughts of [this man]1573-this man . Commerce would not concern [us]4157-we much if it were not for such results as this . [New England]20-new england owes [him]1573-this man a debt which [she]20-new england will be slow to recognize . [His]1573-this man earlier essays reached [us]4157-we at a time when [Coleridge]650-coleridge ’s were the only recent words which had made any notable impression so far , and [they]4168-a few younger muses found a field unoccupied by [him]1573-this man , before yet any words of moment had been uttered in [our]4157-we midst . [He]1573-this man had this advantage , too , in [a teacher]4171-a teacher , that [he]1573-this man stood near to [[his]1573-this man pupils]4172-his pupils ; and [he]1573-this man has no doubt afforded reasonable encouragement and sympathy to [many an independent but solitary thinker]4173-many an independent but solitary thinker .

It is remarkable , but on the whole , perhaps , not to be lamented , that [the world]741-the world is so unkind to a new book . [Any distinguished traveller who comes to [[our]4157-we shores]4176-our shores]4175-any distinguished traveller who comes to our shores is likely to get more dinners and speeches of welcome than [he]4175-any distinguished traveller who comes to our shores can well dispose of , but the best books , if noticed at all , meet with coldness and suspicion , or , what is worse , gratuitous , off - hand criticism . It is plain that [the reviewers]4177-the reviewers , both here and abroad , do not know how to dispose of [this man]1573-this man . [They]4177-the reviewers approach [him]1573-this man too easily , as if [he]1573-this man were one of [the men of letters about [town]4180-town]4179-the men of letters about town , who grace [Mr. Somebody]652-mr. somebody ’s administration , merely ; but [he]1573-this man already belongs to literature , and depends neither on the favor of [reviewers]4181-reviewers , nor the honesty of [booksellers]4182-booksellers , nor the pleasure of [readers]4183-readers for [his]1573-this man success . [He]1573-this man has more to impart than to receive from [[his]1573-this man generation]4184-his generation . [He]1573-this man is another such a strong and finished workman in [his]1573-this man craft as [Samuel Johnson]653-samuel johnson was , and , like [him]1573-this man , makes [the literary class respectable]4185-the literary class respectable . Since few are yet out of [their]4185-the literary class respectable apprenticeship , or , even if [they]4185-the literary class respectable learn to be [able writers]4186-able writers , are at the same time able and [valuable thinkers]4187-valuable thinkers . The aged and critical eye , especially , is incapacitated to appreciate the works of [this author]4188-this author . To such [their]4185-the literary class respectable meaning is impalpable and evanescent , and [they]4185-the literary class respectable seem to abound only in obstinate mannerisms , Germanisms , and whimsical ravings of all kinds , with now and then an unaccountably true and sensible remark . On the strength of this last , [Carlyle]401-carlyle is admitted to have what is called genius . [We]4189-we hardly know [an old man to whom these volumes are not hopelessly sealed]4190-an old man to whom these volumes are not hopelessly sealed . The language , [they]4185-the literary class respectable say , is foolishness and a stumbling - block to [them]4185-the literary class respectable ; but to many [a clear - headed boy]4191-a clear - headed boy , [they]4185-the literary class respectable are plainest English , and despatched with such hasty relish as [his]4191-a clear - headed boy bread and milk . [The fathers]4192-the fathers wonder how it is that [the children]4193-the children take to this diet so readily , and digest it with so little difficulty . [They]4192-the fathers shake [their]4192-the fathers heads with mistrust at [their]4192-the fathers free and easy delight , and remark that “ [Mr. Carlyle]654-carlyle is [a very learned man ”]5622-a very learned man ”[4192-the fathers] ; for [they]4192-the fathers , too , not to be out of fashion , have got grammar and dictionary , if the truth were known , and with the best faith cudgelled [their]4192-the fathers brains to get a little way into [the jungle]4194-the jungle , and [they]4192-the fathers could not but confess , as often as [they]4192-the fathers found the clew , that it was as intricate as [Blackstone]655-blackstone to follow , if [you]4195-you read it honestly . But merely reading , even with the best intentions , is not enough : [you]4196-yourself must almost have written these books [yourself]4196-yourself . [Only [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life who has had the good fortune to read [them]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life , can give any adequate account of [them]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life .

[Many]4198-many have tasted of this well with an odd suspicion , as if it were some fountain Arethuse which had flowed under [the sea]2243-the sea from [Germany]176-germany , as if the materials of [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life books had lain in some garret there , in danger of being appropriated for waste - paper . Over what [German ocean]4200-german ocean , from what [Hercynian forest]4201-hercynian forest , [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has been imported , piecemeal , into [England]31-england , or whether [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has now all arrived , [we]4202-we are not informed . This article is not invoiced in [Hamburg]360-hamburg nor in [London]240-london . Perhaps it was contraband . However , [we]4202-we suspect that this sort of goods can not be imported in this way . No matter how skilful the stevedore , all things being got into sailing trim , wait for a Sunday , and aft wind , and then weigh anchor , and run up the main - sheet,—straightway what of transcendent and permanent value is there resists the aft wind , and will doggedly stay behind that Sunday,—it does not travel Sundays ; while biscuit and pork make headway , and [sailors]5248-sailors cry heave - yo ! It must part company , if it open a seam . It is not quite safe to send out a venture in this kind , unless [yourself]4196-yourself go supercargo . Where [a man]1027-a man goes , there [he]1027-a man is ; but the slightest virtue is immovable,—it is real estate , not personal ; who would keep it , must consent to be bought and sold with it .

However , [we]4202-we need not dwell on this charge of a German extraction , it being generally admitted , by this time , that [Carlyle]654-carlyle is English , and [an inhabitant of [London]240-london]4205-an inhabitant of london . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has the English for [[his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life mother]4206-his mother - tongue , though with a Scotch accent , or never so many accents , and thoughts also , which are the legitimate growth of native soil , to utter therewith . [His]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life style is eminently colloquial , and no wonder it is strange to meet with in a book . It is not literary or classical ; it has not the music of poetry , nor the pomp of philosophy , but the rhythms and cadences of conversation endlessly repeated . It resounds with emphatic , natural , lively , stirring tones , muttering , rattling , exploding , like shells and shot , and with like execution . So far as it is a merit in composition , that the written answer to the spoken word , and the spoken word to a fresh and pertinent thought in the mind , as well as to the half thoughts , the tumultuary misgivings and expectancies , [this author]4188-this author is , perhaps , not to be matched in literature .

[He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life is [no mystic]4208-no mystic , either , more than [Newton]656-newton or [Arkwright]657-arkwright or [Davy]658-davy , and tolerates none . Not one obscure line , or half line , did [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life ever write . [His]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life meaning lies plain as the daylight , and [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life who runs may read ; indeed , only [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life who runs _ can _ read , and keep up with the meaning . It has the distinctness of picture to [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life mind , and [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life tells [us]4209-we only what [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life sees printed in largest English type upon the face of things . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life utters substantial English thoughts in plainest English dialects ; for it must be confessed , [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life speaks more than one of these . All [the shires of [England]31-england]4210-the shires of england , and [all the shires of [Europe]135-europe]4211-all the shires of europe , are laid under contribution to [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life genius ; for to be English does not mean to be exclusive and narrow , and adapt [one]936-one ’s self to the apprehension of [[his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life nearest neighbor]4213-his nearest neighbor only . And yet [no writer]4214-no writer is more thoroughly Saxon . In the translation of those fragments of Saxon poetry , [we]4209-we have met with the same rhythm that occurs so often in [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life poem on the French Revolution . And if [you]4215-you would know where many of [those obnoxious Carlyleisms and Germanisms]4216-those obnoxious carlyleisms and germanisms came from , read the best of [Milton]543-milton ’s prose , read those speeches of [Cromwell]578-cromwell which [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has brought to light , or go and listen once more to [[your]4217-your mother]4218-your mother ’s tongue . So much for [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life German extraction .

Indeed , for fluency and skill in the use of the English tongue , [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life is [a master]4219-a master unrivalled . [His]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life felicity and power of expression surpass even [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life special merits as [historian]4220-historian and [critic]4221-critic . Therein [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life experience has not failed [him]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life , but furnished [him]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life with such a store of winged , ay and legged words , as only a [London]240-london life , perchance , could give account of . [We]4209-we had not understood the wealth of the language before . Nature is ransacked , and all the resorts and [purlieus of humanity]4222-purlieus of humanity are taxed , to furnish the fittest symbol for [his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life thought . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life does not go to the dictionary , the word - book , but to the word - manufactory itself , and has made endless work for [the lexicographers]4223-the lexicographers . Yes , [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has that same English for [[his]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life mother]4206-his mother - tongue that [you]4225-you have , but with [him]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life it is [no dumb , muttering , mumbling faculty]4226-no dumb , muttering , mumbling faculty , concealing the thoughts , but a keen , unwearied , resistless weapon . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life has such command of it as neither [you]4227-you nor [I]0-i have ; and it would be well for any who have a lost horse to advertise , or [a town]783-a town - meeting warrant , or a sermon , or a letter to write , to study this universal letter - writer , for [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life knows more than the grammar or the dictionary .

The style is worth attending to , as one of the most important features of [the man which [we]4209-we at this distance]4229-the man which we at this distance can discern . It is for once quite equal to the matter . It can carry all its load , and never breaks down nor staggers . [His]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life books are solid and workmanlike , as all that [England]31-england does ; and [they]4230-they are graceful and readable also . [They]4230-they tell of huge labor done , well done , and all the rubbish swept away , like the bright cutlery which glitters in shop windows , while the coke and ashes , the turnings , filings , dust , and borings lie far away at [Birmingham]361-birmingham , unheard of . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life is [a masterly clerk]4231-a masterly clerk , [scribe]4232-scribe , [reporter]4233-reporter , [writer]4234-writer . [He]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life can reduce to writing most things,—gestures , winks , nods , significant looks , patois , brogue , accent , pantomime , and how much that had passed for silence before , does [he]4197-only he who has had the good fortune to read them in the nick of time , in the most perceptive and recipient season of life represent by written words . [The countryman who puzzled [the city lawyer]4236-the city lawyer]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer , requiring [him]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer to write , among other things , [his]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer call to [his]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer horses , would hardly have puzzled [him]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer ; [he]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer would have found a word for it , all right and classical , that would have started [his]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer team for [him]4235-the countryman who puzzled the city lawyer . Consider the ceaseless tide of speech forever flowing in [countless cellars]4237-countless cellars , garrets , _ parlors _ ; that of [the French]1821-the french , says [Carlyle]654-carlyle , “ only ebbs toward the short hours of night , ”[654-carlyle] and what a drop in the bucket is the printed word . Feeling , thought , speech , writing , and , [we]4239-we might add , poetry , inspiration,—for so the circle is completed ; how [they]4240-they gradually dwindle at length , passing through successive colanders , into [your]4241-your history and classics , from the roar of [the ocean]1556-the ocean , the murmur of [the forest]752-the forest , to the squeak of a mouse ; so much only parsed and spelt out , and punctuated , at last . The few who can talk like a book , [they]4240-they only get reported commonly . But [this writer]4244-this writer reports a new “ Lieferung . ”[4244-this writer]

[One]936-one wonders how so much , after all , was expressed in the old way , so much here depends upon the emphasis , tone , pronunciation , style , and spirit of the reading . [No writer]4214-no writer uses so profusely all the aids to intelligibility which [the printer]4247-the printer ’s art affords . [You]4241-your wonder how [others]985-others had contrived to write so many pages without emphatic or italicized words , [they]985-others are so expressive , so natural , so indispensable here , as if [none]1282-none had ever used the demonstrative pronouns demonstratively before . In another ’s sentences the thought , though it may be immortal , is as it were embalmed , and does not _ strike _ [you]4250-you , but here it is so freshly living , even the body of it not having passed through the ordeal of death , that it stirs in the very extremities , and the smallest particles and pronouns are all alive with it . It is not simple dictionary _ it _ , [yours]4251-yours or mine , but IT . The words did not come at the command of grammar , but of a tyrannous , inexorable meaning ; not like [standing soldiers]4252-standing soldiers , by vote of Parliament , but any able - bodied countryman pressed into the service , for “ [Sire]659-sire , it is not a revolt , it is a revolution . ”[4244-this writer]

[We]4253-we have never heard [him]4244-this writer speak , but [we]4253-we should say that [Carlyle]654-carlyle was [a rare talker]4254-a rare talker . [He]654-carlyle has broken the ice , and streams freely forth like a spring torrent . [He]654-carlyle does not trace back the stream of [his]654-carlyle thought , silently adventurous , up to its fountain - head , but is borne away with it , as it rushes through [his]654-carlyle brain like a torrent to overwhelm and fertilize . [He]654-carlyle holds a talk with [you]4255-you . [[His]654-carlyle audience]4256-his audience is such [a tumultuous mob of thirty thousand]4257-a tumultuous mob of thirty thousand , as assembled at [the University of [Paris]180-paris]4258-the university of paris , before printing was invented . Philosophy , on the other hand , does not talk , but write , or , when it comes personally before [an audience]4259-an audience , lecture or read ; and therefore it must be read to - morrow , or a thousand years hence . But [the talker]4260-the talker must naturally be attended to at once ; [he]4260-the talker does not talk on without [an audience]4259-an audience ; the winds do not long bear the sound of [his]654-carlyle voice . Think of [Carlyle]654-carlyle reading [his]654-carlyle French Revolution to [any audience]4262-any audience . [One]936-one might say it was never written , but spoken ; and thereafter reported and printed , that those not within sound of [his]654-carlyle voice might know something about it . [Some men]4264-some men read to [you]4255-you something which [they]4264-some men have written in a dead _ language _ , of course , but it may be in a living _ letter _ , in a Syriac , or Roman , or Runic character . [Men]1028-men must _ speak _ English who can _ write _ Sanscrit ; [they]1028-men must speak a modern language who write , perchance , [an ancient and universal one]4266-an ancient and universal one . [We]4267-we do not live in those days when the learned used a learned language . There is no writing of Latin with [Carlyle]654-carlyle ; but as [Chaucer]660-chaucer , with all reverence to [Homer]661-homer , and [Virgil]662-virgil , and [Messieurs the Normans]663-messieurs the normans , sung [his]663-messieurs the normans poetry in the homely Saxon tongue,—and [Locke]664-locke has at least the merit of having done philosophy into [English,—so Carlyle]665-english,—so carlyle has done a different philosophy still further into English , and thrown open the doors of literature and criticism to [the populace]4268-the populace .

Such a style,—so diversified and variegated ! It is like the face of [a country]1235-a country ; it is like a [New England]20-new england landscape , with [farm - houses]4270-farm - houses and [villages]1687-villages , and cultivated spots , and belts of [forests and blueberry - swamps round about]4272-forests and blueberry - swamps round about , with the fragrance of shad - blossoms and violets on certain winds . And as for the reading of it , it is novel enough to [the reader who has used only the diligence , and old line mail - coach]4273-the reader who has used only the diligence , and old line mail - coach . It is like travelling , sometimes on foot , sometimes in a gig tandem ; sometimes in [a full coach]4274-a full coach , over [highways]4275-highways , mended and unmended , for which [you]4276-you will prosecute [the town]762-the town ; on [level roads]4278-level roads , through [French departments]4279-french departments , by [Simplon roads over [the Alps]362-the alps]4280-simplon roads over the alps , and now and then [he]664-locke hauls up for a relay , and yokes in an unbroken colt of a Pegasus for [a leader]3301-a leader , driving off by [cart - paths]4282-cart - paths , and across [lots]2335-lots , by [corduroy roads and gridiron bridges]4284-corduroy roads and gridiron bridges ; and where [the bridges]4285-the bridges are gone , not even a string - piece left , and [the reader]747-the reader has to set [his]664-locke breast and swim . [You]4287-you have got [an expert driver]4288-an expert driver this time , who has driven ten thousand miles , and was never known to upset ; can drive six in hand on the edge of a precipice , and touch [the leaders]4289-the leaders anywhere with [his]664-locke snapper .

With wonderful art [he]664-locke grinds into paint for [his]664-locke picture all [his]664-locke moods and experiences , so that all [his]664-locke forces may be brought to the encounter . Apparently writing without a particular design or responsibility , setting down [his]664-locke soliloquies from time to time , taking advantage of all [his]664-locke humors , when at length the hour comes to declare [himself]664-locke , [he]664-locke puts down in plain English , without quotation - marks , what [he]664-locke , [Thomas Carlyle]401-carlyle , is ready to defend in the face of [the world]741-the world , and [fathers the rest]4291-fathers the rest , often quite as defensible , only more modest , or plain spoken , or insinuating , upon “ [Sauerteig]666-sauerteig , ”[4292-some other gentleman] or [some other gentleman]4292-some other gentleman long employed on the subject . Rolling [his]664-locke subject how many ways in [his]664-locke mind , [he]664-locke meets it now face to face , wrestling with it at arm ’s length , and striving to get it down , or throw it over [his]664-locke head ; and if that will not do , or whether it will do or not , tries the back - stitch and side - hug with it , and downs it again , scalps it , draws and quarters it , hangs it in chains , and leaves it to the winds and dogs . With [his]664-locke brows knit , [his]664-locke mind made up , [his]664-locke will resolved and resistless , [he]664-locke advances , crashing [his]664-locke way through the host of weak , half - formed , _ dilettante _ opinions , honest and dishonest ways of thinking , with [their]4293-their standards raised , sentimentalities and conjectures , and tramples them all into dust . See how [he]664-locke prevails ; [you]4294-you do n’t even hear the groans of the wounded and dying . Certainly it is not so well worth the while to look through [any man]3266-any man ’s eyes at history , for the time , as through [his]3266-any man ; and [his]3266-any man way of looking at things is fastest getting adopted by [his]3266-any man generation .

It is not in [man]2119-man to determine what [his]3266-any man style shall be . [He]3266-any man might as well determine what [his]3266-any man thoughts shall be . [We]4297-we would not have had [him]3266-any man write always as in the chapter on [Burns]523-burns , and the Life of [Schiller]667-schiller , and elsewhere . No ; [his]3266-any man thoughts were ever irregular and impetuous . Perhaps as [he]3266-any man grows older and writes more [he]3266-any man acquires a truer expression ; it is in some respects manlier , freer , struggling up to a level with its fountain - head . [We]4297-we think it is the richest prose style [we]4297-we know of .

Who cares what [a man]1027-a man ’s style is , so it is intelligible,—as intelligible as [his]3266-any man thought . Literally and really , the style is no more than the _ stylus _ , the pen [he]3266-any man writes with ; and it is not worth scraping and polishing , and gilding , unless it will write [his]3266-any man thoughts the better for it . It is something for use , and not to look at . The question for [us]4297-we is , not whether [Pope]668-pope had a fine style , wrote with a peacock ’s feather , but whether [he]668-pope uttered useful thoughts . Translate a book a dozen times from one language to another , and what becomes of its style ? Most books would be worn out and disappear in this ordeal . The pen which wrote it is soon destroyed , but the poem survives . [We]4297-we believe that [Carlyle]401-carlyle has , after all , [more readers]4299-more readers , and is better known to - day for this very originality of style , and that posterity will have reason to thank [him]3266-any man for emancipating the language , in some measure , from the fetters which [a merely conservative , aimless , and pedantic literary class]4300-a merely conservative , aimless , and pedantic literary class had imposed upon it , and setting an example of greater freedom and naturalness . [No man]5310-no man ’s thoughts are new , but the style of [their]5310-no man expression is the never - failing novelty which cheers and refreshes [men]1028-men . If [we]4297-we were to answer the question , whether the mass of [men]1028-men , as [we]4297-we know [them]1028-men , talk as [the standard authors]4304-the standard authors and [reviewers]4181-reviewers write , or rather as [this man]1573-this man writes , [we]4297-we should say that [he]1573-this man alone begins to write [their]1028-men language at all , and that the former is , for the most part , the mere effigies of a language , not the best method of concealing [one]936-one ’s thoughts even , but frequently a method of doing without thoughts at all .

In [his]3266-any man graphic description of [Richter]669-richter ’s style , [Carlyle]401-carlyle describes [his]3266-any man own pretty nearly ; and no doubt [he]3266-any man first got [his]3266-any man own tongue loosened at [that fountain]4308-that fountain , and was inspired by it to equal freedom and originality . “ The language , ”[3266-any man] as [he]3266-any man says of [Richter]669-richter , “ groans with indescribable metaphors and allusions to all things , human and divine , flowing onward , not like [a river]1643-a river , but like an inundation ; circling in complex eddies , chafing and gurgling , now this way , now that ”[669-richter] ; but in [Carlyle]401-carlyle , “ the proper current ”[401-carlyle] never “ sinks out of sight amid the boundless uproar . ”[669-richter] Again : “ [His]3266-any man very language is [Titanian,—deep]670-titanian,—deep , strong , tumultuous , shining with a thousand hues , fused from a thousand elements , and winding in labyrinthic mazes . ”[669-richter]

In short , if it is desirable that [a man]1027-a man be eloquent , that [he]1027-a man talk much , and address [himself]1027-a man to [his]1027-a man own age mainly , then this is not a bad style of doing it . But if it is desired rather that [he]1027-a man pioneer into unexplored regions of thought , and speak to silent centuries to come , then , indeed , [we]4310-we could wish that [he]1027-a man had cultivated the style of Goethe more , that of [Richter]669-richter less ; not that [Goethe]644-goethe ’s is the kind of utterance most to be prized by mankind , but it will serve for a model of the best that can be successfully cultivated .

But for style , and fine writing , and Augustan ages , that is but a poor style , and vulgar writing , and a degenerate age , which allows [us]4310-we to remember these things . [This man]1573-this man has something to communicate . [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s are not , in the common sense , works of art in [their]4312-their origin and aim ; and yet , perhaps , [no living English writer]4313-no living english writer evinces an equal literary talent . [They]4312-their are such works of art only as the plough and corn - mill and steam - engine,—not as pictures and statues . [Others]985-others speak with greater emphasis to [scholars]4315-scholars , as such , but none so earnestly and effectually to all who can read . [Others]985-others give [their]985-others advice , [he]1027-a man gives [his]1027-a man sympathy also . It is no small praise that [he]1027-a man does not take upon [himself]1027-a man the airs , has none of the whims , none of the pride , the nice vulgarities , the starched , impoverished isolation , and cold glitter of [the spoiled children of genius]4317-the spoiled children of genius . [He]1027-a man does not need to husband [his]1027-a man pearl , but excels by a greater humanity and sincerity .

[He]1027-a man is singularly serious and untrivial . [We]4310-we are everywhere impressed by the rugged , unwearied , and rich sincerity of [the man]1697-the man . [We]4310-we are sure that [he]1027-a man never sacrificed one jot of [his]1027-a man honest thought to art or whim , but to utter [himself]1027-a man in the most direct and effectual way,—that is the endeavor . These are merits which will wear well . When time has worn deeper into the substance of these books , this grain will appear . No such sermons have come to [us]4310-we here out of [England]31-england , in late years , as those of [this preacher,—sermons]4319-this preacher,—sermons to [kings]4320-kings , and sermons to [peasants]1808-peasants , and sermons to all intermediate classes . It is in vain that [John Bull]671-john bull , or any of [[his]671-john bull cousins]4322-his cousins , turns a deaf ear , and pretends not to hear [them]4322-his cousins : nature will not soon be weary of repeating [them]4322-his cousins . There are words less obviously true , more for the ages to hear , perhaps , but none so impossible for this age not to hear . What a cutting cimeter was that “ Past and Present , ”[1027-a man] going through heaps of silken stuffs , and glibly through the necks of [men]1028-men , too , without [their]1028-men knowing it , leaving no trace . [He]1027-a man has the earnestness of [a prophet]4324-a prophet . In an age of pedantry and dilettantism , [he]1027-a man has no grain of these in [his]1027-a man composition . There is nowhere else , surely , in recent readable English , or other books , such direct and effectual teaching , reproving , encouraging , stimulating , earnestly , vehemently , almost like [Mahomet]672-mahomet , like [Luther]565-luther ; not looking behind [him]1027-a man to see how [his]1027-a man _ Opera Omnia _ will look , but forward to other work to be done . [His]1027-a man writings are a gospel to [the young of this generation]4325-the young of this generation ; [they]4325-the young of this generation will hear [his]1027-a man manly , brotherly speech with responsive joy , and press forward to older or newer gospels .

* * * * *

[We]4326-we should omit a main attraction in these books , if [we]4326-we said nothing of [their]4325-the young of this generation humor . Of this indispensable pledge of sanity , without some leaven , of which [the abstruse thinker]4327-the abstruse thinker may justly be suspected of mysticism , fanaticism , or insanity , there is a superabundance in [Carlyle]401-carlyle . Especially the transcendental philosophy needs the leaven of humor to render it light and digestible . In [his]1027-a man later and longer works it is an unfailing accompaniment , reverberating through pages and chapters , long sustained without effort . The very punctuation , the italics , the quotation - marks , the blank spaces and dashes , and the capitals , each and all are pressed into its service .

[Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s humor is vigorous and Titanic , and has more sense in it than the sober philosophy of many another . It is not to be disposed of by laughter and smiles merely ; it gets to be too serious for that : only [they]4328-they may laugh who are not hit by it . For those who love a merry jest , this is a strange kind of fun,—rather too practical joking , if [they]4328-they understand it . The pleasant humor which [the public]4329-the public loves is but the innocent pranks of the ball - room , harmless flow of animal spirits , the light plushy pressure of dandy pumps , in comparison . But when [an elephant]4330-an elephant takes to treading on [your]4331-you corns , why then [you]4331-you are lucky if [you]4331-you sit high , or wear cowhide . [His]4330-an elephant humor is always subordinate to a serious purpose , though often the real charm for [the reader]747-the reader is not so much in the essential progress and final upshot of the chapter , as in this indirect side - light illustration of every hue . [He]4330-an elephant sketches first , with strong , practical English pencil , the essential features in outline , black on white , more faithfully than [Dryasdust]673-dryasdust would have done , telling [us]4326-we wisely whom and what to mark , to save time , and then with brush of camel ’s hair , or sometimes with more expeditious swab , [he]4330-an elephant lays on the bright and fast colors of [his]4330-an elephant humor everywhere . One piece of solid work , be it known , [we]4326-we have determined to do , about which let there be no jesting , but all things else under the heavens , to the right and left of that , are for the time fair game . To [us]4326-we this humor is not wearisome , as almost every other is . [Rabelais]674-rabelais , for instance , is intolerable ; one chapter is better than a volume,—it may be sport to [him]4330-an elephant , but it is death to [us]4326-we . A mere humorist , indeed , is [a most unhappy man]4333-a most unhappy man ; and [[his]4330-an elephant readers]3888-his readers are most unhappy also .

Humor is not so distinct a quality as , for the purposes of criticism , it is commonly regarded , but allied to every , even [the divinest faculty]4335-the divinest faculty . The familiar and cheerful conversation about every hearthside , if it be analyzed , will be found to be sweetened by this principle . There is not only a never - failing , pleasant , and earnest humor kept up there , embracing the domestic affairs , the dinner , and the scolding , but there is also a constant run upon [the neighbors]4336-the neighbors , and upon Church and [State]4337-state , and to cherish and maintain this , in a great measure , the fire is kept burning , and the dinner provided . There will be [neighbors]1826-neighbors , [parties to a very genuine , even romantic friendship , whose whole audible salutation and intercourse , abstaining from the usual cordial expressions , grasping of hands]4339-parties to a very genuine , even romantic friendship , whose whole audible salutation and intercourse , abstaining from the usual cordial expressions , grasping of hands , or affectionate farewells , consists in the mutual play and interchange of a genial and healthy humor , which excepts nothing , not even [themselves]4339-parties to a very genuine , even romantic friendship , whose whole audible salutation and intercourse , abstaining from the usual cordial expressions , grasping of hands , in its lawless range . [The child]4340-the child plays continually , if [you]4341-you will let it , and all [its]4340-the child life is a sort of practical humor of a very pure kind , often of so fine and ethereal a nature , that [its parents]4342-its parents , [[its]4340-the child uncles and [cousins]4344-cousins]4343-its uncles and cousins , can in no wise participate in it , but must stand aloof in silent admiration , and reverence even . The more quiet the more profound it is . Even Nature is observed to have [her]4340-the child playful moods or aspects , of which [man]2119-man seems sometimes to be the sport .

But , after all , [we]4326-we could sometimes dispense with the humor , though unquestionably incorporated in the blood , if it were replaced by [this author]4188-this author ’s gravity . [We]4326-we should not apply to [himself]2119-man , without qualification , [his]2119-man remarks on the humor of [Richter]669-richter . With more repose in [his]2119-man inmost being , [his]2119-man humor would become more thoroughly genial and placid . Humor is apt to imply but a half satisfaction at best . In [his]2119-man pleasantest and most genial hour , [man]2119-man smiles but as the globe smiles , and the works of nature . The fruits _ dry _ ripe , and much as [we]4326-we relish some of [them]4343-its uncles and cousins in [their]4343-its uncles and cousins green and pulpy state , [we]4326-we lay up for [[our]4326-we winter store]4348-our winter store , not out of these , but the rustling autumnal harvests . Though [we]4326-we never weary of this vivacious wit , while [we]4326-we are perusing its work , yet when [we]4326-we remember it from afar , [we]4326-we sometimes feel balked and disappointed , missing the security , the simplicity , and frankness , even the occasional magnanimity of acknowledged dulness and bungling . This never - failing success and brilliant talent become a reproach .

Besides , humor does not wear well . It is commonly enough said , that a joke will not bear repeating . The deepest humor will not keep . Humors do not circulate but stagnate , or circulate partially . In the oldest literature , in the Hebrew , [the Hindoo]528-the hindoo , the Persian , the Chinese , it is rarely humor , even the most divine , which still survives , but the most sober and private , painful or joyous thoughts , maxims of duty , to which the life of [all men]2889-all men may be referred . After time has sifted the literature of [a people]2904-a people , there is left only [their]2904-a people SCRIPTURE , for that is WRITING , _ par excellence _ . This is as true of [the poets]4351-the poets , as of [the philosophers]4352-the philosophers and [moralists by profession]4353-moralists by profession ; for what subsides in any of these is the moral only , to reappear as [dry land at some remote epoch]4354-dry land at some remote epoch .

[We]4326-we confess that [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s humor is rich , deep , and variegated , in direct communication with the backbone and risible muscles of the globe,—and there is nothing like it ; but much as [we]4326-we relish this jovial , this rapid and delugeous way of conveying [one]936-one ’s views and impressions , when [we]4326-we would not converse but meditate , [we]4326-we pray for [a man]1027-a man ’s diamond edition of [his]1027-a man thought , without the colored illuminations in the margin,—the fishes and dragons , and unicorns , the red or the blue ink , but its initial letter in distinct skeleton type , and the whole so clipped and condensed down to the very essence of it , that time will have little to do . [We]4326-we know not but [we]4326-we shall immigrate soon , and would fain take with [us]4326-we all the treasures of [the East]3930-the east ; and all kinds of _ dry _ , portable soups , in small tin canisters , which contain whole herds of English beeves boiled down , will be acceptable .

The difference between this flashing , fitful writing and pure philosophy is the difference between flame and light . The flame , indeed , yields light ; but when [we]4326-we are so near as to observe the flame , [we]4326-we are apt to be incommoded by the heat and smoke . But the sun , that [old Platonist]675-old platonist , is set so far off in the heavens , that only a genial summer - heat and ineffable daylight can reach [us]4326-we . But many a time , [we]4326-we confess , in wintry weather , [we]4326-we have been glad to forsake the sunlight , and warm [us]4326-we by these Promethean flames . [Carlyle]401-carlyle must undoubtedly plead guilty to the charge of mannerism . [He]401-carlyle not only has [his]401-carlyle vein , but [his]401-carlyle peculiar manner of working it . [He]401-carlyle has a style which can be imitated , and sometimes is an imitator of [himself]401-carlyle .

Certainly , [no critic]4358-no critic has anywhere said what is more to the purpose , than this which [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s own writings furnish , which [we]4326-we quote , as well for its intrinsic merit as for its pertinence here . “ It is true , ”[401-carlyle] says [he]401-carlyle , thinking of [Richter]669-richter , “ the beaten paths of literature lead the safeliest to the goal ; and the talent pleases [us]4326-we most which submits to shine with new gracefulness through old forms . Nor is [the noblest and most peculiar mind]5624-the noblest and most peculiar mind too noble or peculiar for working by prescribed laws ; Sophocles , [Shakespeare]546-shakespeare , [Cervantes]676-cervantes , and in [Richter]669-richter ’s own age , [Goethe]644-goethe , how little did [they]5624-the noblest and most peculiar mind innovate on the given forms of composition , how much in the spirit [they]5624-the noblest and most peculiar mind breathed into [them]5624-the noblest and most peculiar mind ! All this is true ; and [Richter]669-richter must lose of [our]4326-we esteem in proportion . ”[401-carlyle] And again , in the chapter on [Goethe]644-goethe , “ [We]4326-we read [Goethe]644-goethe for years before [we]4326-we come to see wherein the distinguishing peculiarity of [his]669-richter understanding , of [his]669-richter disposition , even of [his]669-richter way of writing , consists ! It seems quite a simple style , [ that of [his]669-richter ? ] remarkable chiefly for its calmness , its perspicuity , in short , its commonness ; and yet it is the most uncommon of all styles . ”[644-goethe] And this , too , translated for [us]4359-us by the same pen from [Schiller]667-schiller , which [we]4359-us will apply not merely to the outward form of [his]667-schiller works , but to [their]4360-their inner form and substance . [He]667-schiller is speaking of [the artist]4361-the artist . “ Let some beneficent divinity snatch [him]667-schiller , when a suckling , from the breast of [[his]667-schiller mother]4206-his mother , and nurse [him]667-schiller with the milk of a better time , that [he]667-schiller may ripen to [his]667-schiller full stature beneath a distant Grecian sky . And having grown to manhood , let [him]667-schiller return , a foreign shape , into [his]667-schiller century ; not , however , to delight it by [his]667-schiller presence , but , dreadful , like [the son of [Agamemnon]677-agamemnon]5626-the son of agamemnon , to purify it . The matter of [his]667-schiller works [he]667-schiller will take from the present , but [their]4363-their form [he]667-schiller will derive from a nobler time ; nay , from beyond all time , from the absolute unchanging unity of [his]667-schiller own nature . ”[667-schiller]

But enough of this . [Our]4362-we complaint is already out of all proportion to [our]4362-we discontent .

[Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s works , it is true , have not the stereotyped success which [we]4362-we call classic . [They]4363-their are a rich but inexpensive entertainment , at which [we]4362-we are not concerned lest [the host]4364-the host has strained or impoverished [himself]4364-the host to feed [[his]4364-the host guests]4365-his guests . It is not the most lasting word , nor the loftiest wisdom , but rather the word which comes last . For [his]4364-the host genius it was reserved to give expression to the thoughts which were throbbing in a million breasts . [He]4364-the host has plucked the ripest fruit in [the public garden]4366-the public garden ; but this fruit already least concerned the tree that bore it , which was rather perfecting the bud at the foot of the leaf - stalk . [His]4364-the host works are not to be studied , but read with a swift satisfaction . [Their]4364-the host flavor and gust is like what [poets]4367-poets tell of the froth of wine , which can only be tasted once and hastily . On a review [we]4362-we can never find the pages [we]4362-we had read . Yet [they]4364-the host are in some degree true natural products in this respect . All things are but once , and never repeated . These works were designed for such complete success that [they]4364-the host serve but for a single occasion .

But [he]4364-the host is wilfully and pertinaciously unjust , even scurrilous , impolite , ungentlemanly ; calls [us]4362-we “ [Imbeciles]678-imbeciles , ”[4364-the host] “ [Dilettants]679-dilettants , ”[4364-the host] “ [Philistines]680-philistines , ”[4364-the host] implying sometimes what would not sound well expressed . If [he]4364-the host would adopt the newspaper style , and take back these hard names — But where is [the reader]747-the reader who does not derive some benefit from these epithets , applying [them]4364-the host to [himself]4364-the host ?

[He]4364-the host is , in fact , the best tempered , and not the least impartial of [reviewers]4181-reviewers . [He]4364-the host goes out of [his]4364-the host way to do justice to profligates and quacks . There is somewhat even [Christian]597-christian , in the rarest and most peculiar sense , in [his]4364-the host universal brotherliness , [his]4364-the host simple , child - like endurance , and earnest , honest endeavor , with sympathy for the like . [Carlyle]401-carlyle , to adopt [his]401-carlyle own classification , is [himself]401-carlyle the hero as [literary man]4370-literary man . There is [no more notable workingman in [England]31-england]4371-no more notable workingman in england , in [Manchester]364-manchester or [Birmingham]361-birmingham , or [the mines]4372-the mines round about . [We]4373-we know not how many hours a day [he]4364-the host toils , nor for what wages , exactly : [we]4373-we only know the results for [us]4373-we .

Notwithstanding the very genuine , admirable , and loyal tributes to [Burns]523-burns , [Schiller]667-schiller , [Goethe]644-goethe , and [others]985-others , [Carlyle]401-carlyle is not a critic of poetry . In the book of [heroes]2874-heroes , [Shakespeare]546-shakespeare , [the hero]4376-the hero as [poet]4377-poet , comes off rather slimly . [His]4376-the hero sympathy , as [we]4373-we said , is with [the men of endeavor]4378-the men of endeavor ; not using the life got , but still bravely getting [their]4378-the men of endeavor life . “ In fact , ”[4376-the hero] as [he]4376-the hero says of [Cromwell]578-cromwell , “ everywhere [we]4373-we have to notice the decisive practical _ eye _ of [this man]1573-this man ; how [he]1573-this man drives toward the practical and practicable ; has a genuine insight into what _ is _ fact . ”[4376-the hero] [You]4379-you must have very stout legs to get noticed at all by [him]4376-the hero . [He]4376-the hero is thoroughly English in [his]4376-the hero love of [practical men]4380-practical men , and dislike for ca nt , and ardent enthusiastic heads that are not supported by any legs . [He]4376-the hero would kindly knock [them]4380-practical men down that [they]4380-practical men may regain some vigor by touching [their]4380-practical men mother earth . [We]4373-we have often wondered how [he]4376-the hero ever found out [Burns]523-burns , and must still refer a good share of [his]4376-the hero delight in [him]4376-the hero to [neighborhood]4381-neighborhood and early association . [The Lycidas]681-the lycidas and [Comus]682-comus , appearing in [Blackwood]365-blackwood ’s Magazine , would probably go unread by [him]4376-the hero , nor lead [him]4376-the hero to expect a Paradise Lost . The condition - of - England question is a practical one . The condition - of - [England]31-england demands [a hero]3383-a hero , not [a poet]2124-a poet . Other things demand [a poet]2124-a poet ; [the poet]3879-the poet answers other demands . [Carlyle]401-carlyle in [London]240-london , with this question pressing on [him]4376-the hero so urgently , sees no occasion for [minstrels]4386-minstrels and [rhapsodists]4387-rhapsodists [there]939-there . [Kings]4320-kings may have [[their]4320-kings bards]4390-their bards when there are [any kings]4391-any kings . [Homer]661-homer would _ certainly _ go a - begging there . [He]661-homer lives in [Chelsea]355-chelsea , not on [the plains of [Hindostan]366-hindostan]4392-the plains of hindostan , nor on [the prairies of [the West]187-the west]4393-the prairies of the west , where [settlers]2225-settlers are scarce , and [a man]1027-a man must at least go _ whistling _ to [himself]1027-a man .

What [he]1027-a man says of poetry is rapidly uttered , and suggestive of a thought , rather than the deliberate development of any . [He]1027-a man answers [your]4396-your question , What is poetry ? by writing a special poem , as that Norse one , for instance , in the Book of Heroes , altogether wild and original;—answers [your]4396-your question , What is light ? by kindling a blaze which dazzles [you]4397-you , and pales sun and moon , and not as [a peasant]4398-a peasant might , by opening a shutter .

[Carlyle]401-carlyle is not a _ seer _ , but [a brave looker - on and _ reviewer _]4399-a brave looker - on and _ reviewer _ ; not [the most free and catholic observer of [men]1028-men]4400-the most free and catholic observer of men and events , for [they]4400-the most free and catholic observer of men are likely to find [him]1027-a man preoccupied , but unexpectedly free and catholic when [they]4400-the most free and catholic observer of men fall within the focus of [his]1027-a man lens . [He]1027-a man does not live in the present hour , and read [men]1028-men and books as [they]4400-the most free and catholic observer of men occur for [his]1027-a man theme , but having chosen this , [he]1027-a man directs [his]1027-a man studies to this end . If [we]4403-we look again at [his]1027-a man page , [we]4403-we are apt to retract somewhat that [we]4403-we have said . Often a genuine poetic feeling dawns through it , like the texture of the earth seen through the dead grass and leaves in the spring . The History of the French Revolution is a poem , at length translated into prose,—an Iliad , indeed , as [he]1027-a man [himself]1027-a man has it,—“The destructive wrath of [Sansculotism]683-sansculotism : this is what [we]4403-we speak , having unhappily no voice for singing . ”[1027-a man]

One improvement [we]4403-we could suggest in this last , as indeed in most epics,—that [he]1027-a man should let in the sun oftener upon [his]1027-a man picture . It does not often enough appear , but it is all revolution , the old way of human life turned simply bottom upward , so that when at length [we]4403-we are inadvertently reminded of the “ [Brest Shipping]367-brest shipping , ”[4403-we] [a St. Domingo colony]4404-a st. domingo colony , and that [anybody]1009-anybody thinks of [owning plantations]4406-owning plantations , and simply turning up [the soil]4407-the soil there , and that now at length , after some years of this revolution , there is a falling off in the importation of sugar , [we]4403-we feel a queer surprise . Had [they]4408-they not sweetened [their]4408-they water with revolution then ? It would be well if there were several chapters headed “ Work for the Month,”—Revolution[747-the reader] - work inclusive , of course,—“Altitude of [the Sun]368-the sun , ”[747-the reader] “ State of [the Crops and Markets]5628-the crops and markets , ”[747-the reader] “ Meteorological Observations , ”[747-the reader] “ [Attractive Industry]5629-attractive industry , ”[747-the reader] “ Day - Labor , ”[747-the reader] & c. , just to remind [the reader]747-the reader that [the French peasantry]4410-the french peasantry did something beside go without breeches , burn châteaus , get ready knotted cords , and embrace and throttle one another by turns . These things are sometimes hinted at , but [they]4408-they deserve a notice more in proportion to [their]4408-they importance . [We]4403-we want not only a background to the picture , but a ground under the feet also . [We]4403-we remark , too , occasionally , an unphilosophical habit , common enough elsewhere , in [[Alison]684-alison ’s History of [Modern Europe]4412-modern europe]4411-alison ’s history of modern europe , for instance , of saying , undoubtedly with effect , that if a straw had not fallen this way or that , why then — but , of course , it is as easy in philosophy to make kingdoms rise and fall as straws .

[The poet]3879-the poet is blithe and cheery ever , and as well as nature . [Carlyle]401-carlyle has not the simple Homeric health of [Wordsworth]640-wordsworth , nor the deliberate philosophic turn of [Coleridge]650-coleridge , nor the scholastic taste of [Landor]649-landor , but , though sick and under restraint , the constitutional vigor of [one of [[his]4414-one of his old norse heroes old Norse heroes]4415-his old norse heroes]4414-one of his old norse heroes , struggling in a lurid light , with Jötuns still , striving to throw [the old woman]4416-the old woman , and “ [she]4416-the old woman was Time,”—striving[4416-the old woman] to lift the big cat , and that was “ the Great World - Serpent , which , tail in mouth , girds and keeps up [the whole created world]5630-the whole created world . ”[4417-the smith] [The smith]4417-the smith , though so brawny and tough , [I]0-i should not call [the healthiest man]4418-the healthiest man . There is too much shop - work , too great extremes of heat and cold , and incessant ten - pound - ten and thrashing of the anvil , in [his]4414-one of his old norse heroes life . But [the haymaker]4419-the haymaker ’s is a true sunny perspiration , produced by the extreme of summer heat only , and conversant with the blast of the zephyr , not of the forge - bellows . [We]4403-we know very well the nature of [this man]1573-this man ’s sadness , but [we]4403-we do not know the nature of [his]1573-this man gladness .

[The poet]3879-the poet will maintain serenity in spite of all disappointments . [He]1573-this man is expected to preserve an unconcerned and healthy outlook over [the world]741-the world , while [he]1573-this man lives . _ Philosophia practica est eruditionis meta_,—Philosophy practised is the goal of learning ; and for that other , _ Oratoris est celare artem _ , [we]4403-we might read , _ Herois est celare pugnam_,—the hero will conceal [his]1573-this man struggles . Poetry is the only life got , the only work done , the only pure product and free labor of [man]2119-man , performed only when [he]1573-this man has put all [the world]741-the world under [his]1573-this man feet , and conquered the last of [[his]1573-this man foes]3441-his foes .

[Carlyle]401-carlyle speaks of Nature with a certain unconscious pathos for the most part . [She]3879-the poet is to [him]1573-this man a receded but ever memorable splendor , casting still a reflected light over all [his]1573-this man scenery . As [we]4403-we read [his]1573-this man books here in [New England]20-new england , where there are potatoes enough , and [every man]2593-every man can get [his]2593-every man living peacefully and sportively as the birds and bees , and need think no more of that , it seems to [us]4403-we as if by [the world]741-the world [he]1573-this man often meant [London]240-london , at the head of the tide upon [the Thames]4428-the thames , the sorest place on the face of [the earth]1074-the earth , the very citadel of conservatism .

In [his]1573-this man writings , [we]4403-we should say that [he]1573-this man , as conspicuously as any , though with little enough expressed or even conscious sympathy , represents [the Reformer class]4430-the reformer class , and all the better for not being [the acknowledged leader of any]4431-the acknowledged leader of any . In [him]1573-this man the universal plaint is most settled , unappeasable , and serious . Until [a thousand named and nameless grievances]4432-a thousand named and nameless grievances are righted , there will be no repose for [him]1573-this man in the lap of nature , or the seclusion of science and literature . By foreseeing it , [he]1573-this man hastens the crisis in the affairs of [England]31-england , and is as good as many years added to [her]4433-her history .

To do [himself]1573-this man justice , and set some of [[his]1573-this man readers]3888-his readers right , [he]1573-this man should give [us]4403-we [some transcendent hero]4435-some transcendent hero at length , to rule [his]1573-this man demigods and [Titans]464-titans ; develop , perhaps , [his]1573-this man reserved and dumb reverence for [Christ]452-christ , not speaking to a [London]240-london or [Church of [England]31-england audience]4436-church of england audience merely . Let _ not _ “ sacred silence meditate that sacred matter ”[2593-every man] forever , but let [us]4403-we have sacred speech and sacred scripture thereon .

[Every man]2593-every man will include in [his]2593-every man list of worthies those whom [he]2593-every man [himself]2593-every man best represents . [Carlyle]401-carlyle , and [[our]4403-we countryman [Emerson]643-emerson , whose place and influence must erelong obtain a more distinct recognition]4438-our countryman emerson , whose place and influence must erelong obtain a more distinct recognition , are , to a certain extent , the complement of each other . The age could not do with [one of [them]4438-our countryman emerson , whose place and influence must erelong obtain a more distinct recognition]4439-one of them , it can not do with both . To make a broad and rude distinction , to suit [our]4403-we present purpose , [the former]906-the former , as [critic]4221-critic , deals with [the men of action,—Mahomet]4442-the men of action,—mahomet , [Luther]565-luther , [Cromwell]578-cromwell ; the latter with the thinkers,—Plato , [Shakespeare]546-shakespeare , [Goethe]644-goethe ; for , though both have written upon [Goethe]644-goethe , [they]4442-the men of action,—mahomet do not meet in [him]644-goethe . [The one]2519-the one has more sympathy with [the heroes]4444-the heroes , or [practical reformers]4445-practical reformers , the other with [the observers]4446-the observers , or [philosophers]4447-philosophers . Put [their]4442-the men of action,—mahomet worthies together , and [you]4448-you will have a pretty fair representation of mankind ; yet with one or more memorable exceptions . To say nothing of [Christ]452-christ , who yet awaits a just appreciation from literature , [the peacefully practical hero , whom [Columbus]613-columbus may represent]4449-the peacefully practical hero , whom columbus may represent , is obviously slighted ; but above and after all , [the Man of the Age]4450-the man of the age , come to be called [workingman]4451-workingman , it is obvious that none yet speaks to [his]4450-the man of the age condition , for [the speaker]3317-the speaker is not yet in [his]4450-the man of the age condition .

Like speaks to like only ; labor to labor , philosophy to philosophy , criticism to criticism , poetry to poetry . Literature speaks how much still to the past , how little to the future , how much to [the East]295-east , how little to [the West]187-the west , —

In [the East fames]4453-the east fames are won , In the West deeds are done .

One merit in [Carlyle]401-carlyle , let the subject be what it may , is the freedom of prospect [he]4450-the man of the age allows , the entire absence of ca nt and dogma . [He]4450-the man of the age removes many cart - loads of rubbish , and leaves open a broad highway . [His]4450-the man of the age writings are all unfenced on the side of the future and the possible . Though [he]4450-the man of the age does but inadvertently direct [our]4454-we eyes to the open heavens , nevertheless [he]4450-the man of the age lets [us]4454-we wander broadly underneath , and shows [them]4455-them to [us]4454-we reflected in innumerable pools and [lakes]832-lakes .

* * * * *

These volumes contain not the highest , but a very practicable wisdom , which startles and provokes , rather than informs [us]4454-we . [Carlyle]401-carlyle does not oblige [us]4454-we to think ; [we]4454-we have thought enough for [him]401-carlyle already , but [he]401-carlyle compels [us]4454-we to act . [We]4454-we accompany [him]401-carlyle rapidly through an endless gallery of pictures , and glorious reminiscences of experiences unimproved . “ Have [you]5631-you not had [Moses]629-moses norris and [the prophets]5632-the prophets ? Neither will [ye]629-moses norris be persuaded if [one]936-one should rise from the dead . ”[4454-we] There is no calm philosophy of life here , such as [you]4457-you might put at the end of [the Almanac]4458-the almanac , to hang over [the farmer]4459-the farmer ’s hearth , how [men]1028-men shall live in these winter , in these summer days . No philosophy , properly speaking , of love , or friendship , or religion , or politics , or education , or nature , or spirit ; perhaps a nearer approach to a philosophy of kingship , and of the place of [the literary man]4461-the literary man , than of anything else . [A rare preacher]4462-a rare preacher , with prayer , and psalm , and sermon , and benediction , but no contemplation of [man]2119-man ’s life from the serene oriental ground , nor yet from the stirring occidental . No thanksgiving sermon for the holydays , or the Easter vacations , when [all men]2889-all men submit to float on the full currents of life . When [we]4454-we see with what spirits , though with little heroism enough , [wood - choppers]4465-wood - choppers , [drovers]4466-drovers , and [apprentices]4467-apprentices take and spend life , playing all day long , sunning [themselves]4466-drovers , shading [themselves]4466-drovers , eating , drinking , sleeping , [we]4454-we think that the philosophy of [their]4466-drovers life written would be such a level natural history as [the Gardener]4468-the gardener ’s Calendar and the works of [the early botanists]4469-the early botanists , inconceivably slow to come to practical conclusions .

There is no philosophy here for [philosophers]4447-philosophers , only as [every man]2593-every man is said to have [his]2593-every man philosophy . No system but such as is [the man]1697-the man [himself]1697-the man ; and , indeed , [he]1697-the man stands compactly enough ; no progress beyond the first assertion and challenge , as it were , with trumpet blast . One thing is certain,—that [we]4454-we had best be doing something in good earnest henceforth forever ; that ’s an indispensable philosophy . The before impossible precept , “ _ know thyself _ , ”[1697-the man] [he]1697-the man translates into the partially possible one , “ _ know what [thou]5634-thou canst work at _ . ”[1697-the man] [Sartor Resartus]685-sartor resartus is , perhaps , the sunniest and most philosophical , as it is the most autobiographical of [his]685-sartor resartus works , in which [he]685-sartor resartus drew most largely on the experience of [his]685-sartor resartus youth . But [we]4454-we miss everywhere a calm depth , like [a lake]780-a lake , even stagnant , and must submit to rapidity and whirl , as on skates , with all kinds of skilful and antic motions , sculling , sliding , cutting punch - bowls and rings , forward and backward . The talent is very nearly equal to [the genius]4474-the genius . Sometimes it would be preferable to wade slowly through [a Serbonian bog]4475-a serbonian bog , and feel the juices of [the meadow]4476-the meadow .

Beside [some philosophers of larger vision]4477-some philosophers of larger vision , [Carlyle]401-carlyle stands like [an honest , half - despairing boy]4478-an honest , half - despairing boy , grasping at some details only of [their]4477-some philosophers of larger vision world systems . Philosophy , certainly , is some account of truths , the fragments and very insignificant parts of which [man]2119-man will practise in [this workshop]4480-this workshop ; truths infinite and in harmony with infinity ; in respect to which the very objects and ends of [the so - called practical philosopher]4481-the so - called practical philosopher will be mere propositions , like the rest . It would be no reproach to [a philosopher]4482-a philosopher , that [he]685-sartor resartus knew the future better than the past , or even than the present . It is better worth knowing . [He]685-sartor resartus will prophesy , tell what is to be , or in other words , what alone is , under appearances , laying little stress on the boiling of the pot , or the condition - of - England question . [He]685-sartor resartus has no more to do with the condition of [England]31-england than with [her]31-england national debt , which [a vigorous generation]4483-a vigorous generation would not inherit . [The philosopher]4484-the philosopher ’s conception of things will , above all , be truer than [other men]4485-other men ’s , and [his]4484-the philosopher philosophy will subordinate all the circumstances of life . To live like [a philosopher]4482-a philosopher is to live , not foolishly , like [other men]4485-other men , but wisely and according to universal laws . If [Carlyle]401-carlyle does not take two steps in philosophy , are there any who take three ? [Philosophy]686-philosophy having crept clinging to the rocks , so far , puts out its feelers many ways in vain . It would be hard to surprise [him]685-sartor resartus by the relation of any important human experience , but in some nook or corner of [his]685-sartor resartus works [you]4488-you will find that this , too , was sometimes dreamed of in [his]685-sartor resartus philosophy .

To sum up [our]4489-we most serious objections in a few words , [we]4489-we should say that [Carlyle]401-carlyle indicates a depth,—and [we]4489-we mean not impliedly , but distinctly,—which [he]401-carlyle neglects to fathom . [We]4489-we want to know more about that which [he]401-carlyle wants to know as well . If any luminous star or undissolvable nebula is visible from [[his]401-carlyle station]4490-his station which is not visible from [ours]4489-we , the interests of science require that the fact be communicated to [us]4489-we . The universe expects [every man]2593-every man to do [his]2593-every man duty in [his]2593-every man parallel of latitude . [We]4489-we want to hear more of [his]2593-every man inmost life ; [his]2593-every man hymn and prayer more ; [his]2593-every man elegy and eulogy less ; that [he]2593-every man should speak more from [his]2593-every man character , and less from [his]2593-every man talent ; communicate centrally with [[his]2593-every man readers]3888-his readers , and not by a side ; that [he]2593-every man should say what [he]2593-every man believes , without suspecting that [men]1028-men disbelieve it , out of [his]2593-every man never - misunderstood nature . [His]2593-every man genius can cover all [the land]834-the land with [gorgeous palaces]4495-gorgeous palaces , but [the reader]747-the reader does not abide in [them]4495-gorgeous palaces , but pitches [his]2593-every man tent rather in [the desert]4497-the desert and on [the mountain - peak]4498-the mountain - peak .
