When [we]4499-we look about for something to quote , as the fairest specimen of [the man]1697-the man , [we]4499-we confess that [we]4499-we labor under an unusual difficulty ; for [his]2593-every man philosophy is so little of the proverbial or sentential kind , and opens so gradually , rising insensibly from [the reviewer]4501-the reviewer ’s level , and developing its thought completely and in detail , that [we]4499-we look in vain for the brilliant passages , for point and antithesis , and must end by quoting [his]2593-every man works entire . What in [a writer of less breadth]4502-a writer of less breadth would have been the proposition which would have bounded [his]2593-every man discourse , [his]2593-every man column of victory , [his]2593-every man Pillar of [Hercules]619-hercules , and _ ne plus ultra _ , is in [Carlyle]401-carlyle frequently the same thought unfolded ; no Pillar of [Hercules]619-hercules , but a considerable prospect , north and south , along [the Atlantic coast]4503-the atlantic coast . There are other pillars of [Hercules]619-hercules , like beacons and [light - houses]4504-light - houses , still further in the horizon , toward [Atlantis]371-atlantis , set up by [a few ancient and modern travellers]4505-a few ancient and modern travellers ; but , so far as [this traveller]4506-this traveller goes , [he]4506-this traveller clears and colonizes , and [all the surplus population of [London]240-london]4507-all the surplus population of london is bound thither at once . What [we]4499-we would quote is , in fact , [his]4506-this traveller vivacity , and not any particular wisdom or sense , which last is ever synonymous with sentence [ _ sententia _ ] , as in [his]4506-this traveller contemporaries [Coleridge]650-coleridge , [Landor]649-landor , and [Wordsworth]640-wordsworth . [We]4499-we have not attempted to discriminate between [his]4506-this traveller works , but have rather regarded [them]4508-them all as one work , as is [the man [himself]4509-the man himself]4509-the man himself . [We]4499-we have not examined so much as remembered [them]4508-them . To do otherwise would have required a more indifferent , and perhaps even less just review , than the present .

All [his]4506-this traveller works might well enough be embraced under the title of [one of [them]4508-them]4439-one of them , a good specimen brick , “ On Heroes , Hero - Worship , and the Heroic in History . ”[4506-this traveller] Of [this department]4511-this department [he]4506-this traveller is [the Chief Professor in [the World ’s University]4513-the world ’s university]4512-the chief professor in the world ’s university , and even leaves Plutarch behind . Such intimate and living , such loyal and generous sympathy with [the heroes of history]4514-the heroes of history , not one in one age only , but forty in forty ages , such an unparalleled reviewing and greeting of all past worth , with exceptions , to be sure,—but exceptions were the rule before,—it was , indeed , to make this the age of review writing , as if now one period of the human story were completing itself , and getting its accounts settled . [This soldier]4515-this soldier has told the stories with new emphasis , and will be a memorable hander - down of fame to posterity . And with what wise discrimination [he]4515-this soldier has selected [[his]4515-this soldier men]5456-his men , with reference both to [his]4515-this soldier own genius and to theirs,—Mahomet , [Dante]687-dante , [Cromwell]578-cromwell , [Voltaire]688-voltaire , [Johnson]653-samuel johnson , [Burns]523-burns , [Goethe]644-goethe , [Richter]669-richter , [Schiller]667-schiller , [Mirabeau,—could]689-mirabeau,—could any of these have been spared ? These [we]4517-we wanted to hear about . [We]4517-we have not as commonly the cold and refined judgment of [the scholar]4518-the scholar and [critic]4221-critic merely , but something more human and affecting . These eulogies have the glow and warmth of friendship . There is sympathy , not with mere fames , and formless , incredible things , but with kindred men,—not transiently , but life long [he]4515-this soldier has walked with [them]4514-the heroes of history .

No doubt , some of [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s worthies , should [they]4514-the heroes of history ever return to [earth]2762-earth , would find [themselves]4514-the heroes of history unpleasantly put upon [their]4514-the heroes of history good behavior , to sustain [their]4514-the heroes of history characters ; but if [he]4515-this soldier can return [a man]1027-a man ’s life more perfect to [our]4517-we hands than it was left at [his]1027-a man death , following out the design of [its author]4522-its author , [we]4517-we shall have no great cause to complain . [We]4517-we do not want a daguerreotype likeness . All biography is the life of [Adam,—a]690-adam,—a much - experienced man,—and time withdraws something partial from the story of [every individual]4523-every individual , that [the historian]3880-the historian may supply something general . If these virtues were not in [this man]1573-this man , perhaps [they]4526-they are in [his]3880-the historian biographer,—no fatal mistake . Really , in any other sense , [we]4517-we never do , nor desire to , come at the historical man,—unless [we]4517-we rob [his]3880-the historian grave , that is the nearest approach . Why did [he]3880-the historian die , then ? _ [He]3880-the historian _ is with [his]3880-the historian bones , surely .

No doubt [Carlyle]401-carlyle has a propensity to _ exaggerate _ the heroic in history , that is , [he]3880-the historian creates [you]4527-you [an ideal hero]4528-an ideal hero rather than another thing : [he]3880-the historian has most of that material . This [we]4517-we allow in all its senses , and in one narrower sense it is not so convenient . Yet what were history if [he]3880-the historian did not exaggerate it ? How comes it that history never has to wait for facts , but for [a man]1027-a man to write it ? The ages may go on forgetting the facts never so long , [he]3880-the historian can remember two for [every one]794-every one forgotten . The musty records of history , like the catacombs , contain the perishable remains , but only in the breast of [genius]4531-genius are embalmed the souls of [heroes]2874-heroes . There is very little of what is called criticism here ; it is love and reverence , rather , which deal with qualities not relatively , but absolutely great ; for whatever is admirable in [a man]1027-a man is something infinite , to which [we]4517-we can not set bounds . These sentiments allow [the mortal]4534-the mortal to die , [the immortal]4535-the immortal and divine to survive . There is something antique , even , in [his]3880-the historian style of treating [his]3880-the historian subject , reminding [us]4517-we that [Heroes]691-heroes and [Demi]692-demi - gods , [Fates]693-fates and [Furies]694-furies , still exist ; [the common man]4536-the common man is nothing to [him]4536-the common man , but after death [the hero]4376-the hero is apotheosized and has a place in [heaven]4107-heaven , as in the religion of [the Greeks]695-the greeks .

Exaggeration ! was ever any virtue attributed to [a man]1027-a man without exaggeration ? was ever any vice , without infinite exaggeration ? Do [we]4517-we not exaggerate [ourselves]4517-we to [ourselves]4517-we , or do [we]4517-we recognize [ourselves]4517-we for [the actual men [we]4517-we are]4540-the actual men we are ? Are [we]4517-we not [all great men]4541-all great men ? Yet what are [we]4517-we actually to speak of ? [We]4517-we live by exaggeration . What else is it to anticipate more than [we]4517-we enjoy ? The lightning is an exaggeration of the light . Exaggerated history is poetry , and truth referred to a new standard . To [a small man]4542-a small man every greater is an exaggeration . [He]4542-a small man who can [not exaggerate is not qualified to utter truth]4543-not exaggerate is not qualified to utter truth . No truth , [we]4517-we think , was ever expressed but with this sort of emphasis , so that for the time there seemed to be no other . Moreover , [you]4544-you must speak loud to [those who are hard of hearing]4545-those who are hard of hearing , and so [you]4544-you acquire a habit of shouting to [those who are not]4546-those who are not . By an immense exaggeration [we]4517-we appreciate [our]4517-we Greek poetry and philosophy , and Egyptian ruins ; [our]4517-we Shakespeares and [Miltons]696-miltons , [our]4517-we Liberty and Christianity . [We]4517-we give importance to this hour over all other hours . [We]4517-we do not live by justice , but by grace . As the sort of justice which concerns [us]4517-we in [our]4517-we daily intercourse is not that administered by [the judge]2528-the judge , so the historical justice which [we]4517-we prize is not arrived at by nicely balancing the evidence . In order to appreciate any , even [the humblest man]4548-the humblest man , [you]4549-you must first , by some good fortune , have acquired a sentiment of admiration , even of reverence , for [him]4548-the humblest man , and there never were such exaggerators as these .

To try [him]4548-the humblest man by the German rule of referring [an author]4550-an author to [his]4550-an author own standard , [we]4517-we will quote the following from [Carlyle]401-carlyle ’s remarks on history , and leave [the reader]747-the reader to consider how far [his]4550-an author practice has been consistent with [his]4550-an author theory . “ Truly , if History is Philosophy teaching by Experience , [the writer]5635-the writer fitted to compose history is hitherto [an unknown man]5636-an unknown man . The Experience itself would require All - knowledge to record it , were the All - wisdom , needful for such Philosophy as would interpret it , to be had for asking . Better were it that [mere earthly Historians]5637-mere earthly historians should lower such pretensions , more suitable for Omniscience than for human science ; and aiming only at some picture of the things acted , which picture itself will at best be a poor approximation , leave the inscrutable purport of [them]5637-mere earthly historians an acknowledged secret ; or , at most , in reverent faith , far different from that teaching of Philosophy , pause over the mysterious vestiges of [Him]4550-an author whose path is in the great deep of Time , whom History indeed reveals , but only all History , and in Eternity , will clearly reveal . ”[401-carlyle]

* * * * *

[Carlyle]401-carlyle is [a critic who lives in [London]240-london]4552-a critic who lives in london to tell [this generation who have been [the great men of [our]4517-we race]4554-the great men of our race]4553-this generation who have been the great men of our race . [We]4517-we have read that on [some exposed place in [the city of Geneva]4556-the city of geneva]4555-some exposed place in the city of geneva , [they]4553-this generation who have been the great men of our race have fixed a brazen indicator for the use of [travellers]1353-travellers , with the names of the mountain summits in the horizon marked upon it , “ so that by taking sight across the index [you]5638-you can distinguish [them]5637-mere earthly historians at once . [You]5638-you will not mistake [Mont Blanc]515-mont - real , if [you]5638-you see [him]515-mont - real , but until [you]5638-you get accustomed to the panorama , [you]5638-you may easily mistake one of [[his]515-mont - real court]5639-his court for [the king]1459-the king . ”[4553-this generation who have been the great men of our race] It stands there a piece of mute brass , that seems nevertheless to know in what vicinity it is : and there perchance it will stand , when [the nation that placed it there has passed away , still in sympathy with [the mountains]1393-the mountains , forever discriminating in [the desert]4497-the desert]4558-the nation that placed it there has passed away , still in sympathy with the mountains , forever discriminating in the desert .

So , [we]4517-we may say , stands [this man]1573-this man , pointing as long as [he]1573-this man lives , in obedience to some spiritual magnetism , to the summits in the historical horizon , for the guidance of [[his]1573-this man fellows]4562-his fellows .

Truly , [our]4517-we greatest blessings are very cheap . To have [our]4517-we sunlight without paying for it , without any duty levied,—to have [[our]4517-we poet]4563-our poet there in [England]31-england , to furnish [us]4517-we entertainment , and , what is better , provocation , from year to year , all [our]4517-we lives long , to make [the world]741-the world seem richer for [us]4517-we , the age more respectable , and life better worth the living,—all without expense of acknowledgment even , but silently accepted out of [the east]3930-the east , like morning light as a matter of course .

------------------------------------------------------------------------

LIFE WITHOUT PRINCIPLE.[10 ]

Footnote 10 :

Atlantic Monthly , [Boston]8-boston , October , 1863 .

At a lyceum , not long since , [I]0-i felt that [the lecturer]4566-the lecturer had chosen a theme too foreign to [himself]4566-the lecturer , and so failed to interest [me]0-i as much as [he]4566-the lecturer might have done . [He]4566-the lecturer described things not in or near to [his]4566-the lecturer heart , but toward [his]4566-the lecturer extremities and superficies . There was , in this sense , no truly central or centralizing thought in the lecture . [I]0-i would have had [him]4566-the lecturer deal with [his]4566-the lecturer privatest experience , as [the poet]3879-the poet does . The greatest compliment that was ever paid [me]0-i was when [one]936-one asked [me]0-i what _ [I]0-i thought _ , and attended to [my]0-i answer . [I]0-i am surprised , as well as delighted , when this happens , it is such a rare use [he]4566-the lecturer would make of [me]0-i , as if [he]4566-the lecturer were acquainted with the tool . Commonly , if [men]1028-men want anything of [me]0-i , it is only to know how many acres [I]0-i make of [their]1028-men land,—since [I]0-i am [a surveyor,—or]4570-a surveyor,—or , at most , what trivial news [I]0-i have burdened [myself]0-i with . [They]1028-men never will go to law for [my]0-i meat ; [they]1028-men prefer the shell . [A man]1027-a man once came a considerable distance to ask [me]0-i to lecture on Slavery ; but on conversing with [him]1027-a man , [I]0-i found that [he]1027-a man and [his]1027-a man clique expected seven eighths of the lecture to be [theirs]4572-theirs , and only one eighth mine ; so [I]0-i declined . [I]0-i take it for granted , when [I]0-i am invited to lecture anywhere,—for [I]0-i have had a little experience in that business,—that there is a desire to hear what _ [I]0-i think _ on some subject , though [I]0-i may be the greatest fool in the country,—and not that [I]0-i should say pleasant things merely , or such as [the audience]4573-the audience will assent to ; and [I]0-i resolve , accordingly , that [I]0-i will give [them]4573-the audience a strong dose of [myself]0-i . [They]4573-the audience have sent for [me]0-i , and engaged to pay for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i am determined that [they]4573-the audience shall have [me]0-i , though [I]0-i bore [them]4573-the audience beyond all precedent .

So now [I]0-i would say something similar to [you]4574-you , [[my]0-i readers]4575-my readers . Since _ [you]4574-you _ are [[my]0-i readers]4575-my readers , and [I]0-i have not been much of [a traveller]1260-a traveller , [I]0-i will not talk about [people]3564-people a thousand miles off , but come as near [home]867-home as [I]0-i can . As the time is short , [I]0-i will leave out all the flattery , and retain all the criticism .

Let [us]4580-us consider the way in which [we]4580-us spend [our]4580-us lives .

[This world]3023-this world is a place of business . What an infinite bustle ! [I]0-i am awaked almost every night by the panting of [the locomotive]4582-the locomotive . It interrupts [my]0-i dreams . There is no sabbath . It would be glorious to see mankind at leisure for once . It is nothing but work , work , work . [I]0-i can not easily buy a blank - book to write thoughts in ; they are commonly ruled for dollars and cents . [An Irishman]4583-an irishman , seeing [me]0-i making a minute in [the fields]1304-the fields , took it for granted that [I]0-i was calculating [my]0-i wages . If [a man]1027-a man was tossed out of a window when [an infant]4586-an infant , and so made a cripple for life , or scared out of [his]1027-a man wits by [the Indians]5280-the indians , it is regretted chiefly because [he]1027-a man was thus incapacitated for — business ! [I]0-i think that there is nothing , not even crime , more opposed to poetry , to philosophy , ay , to life itself , than this incessant business .

There is a coarse and boisterous money - making fellow in [the outskirts of [[our]4589-our town]4590-our town , who is going to build a bank - wall under the hill along [the edge of [his]1027-a man meadow]4591-the edge of his meadow]4588-the outskirts of our town , who is going to build a bank - wall under the hill along the edge of his meadow . The powers have put this into [his]1027-a man head to keep [him]1027-a man out of mischief , and [he]1027-a man wishes [me]0-i to spend three weeks digging there with [him]1027-a man . The result will be that [he]1027-a man will perhaps get some more money to hoard , and leave for [[his]1027-a man heirs]4592-his heirs to spend foolishly . If [I]0-i do this , most will commend [me]0-i as [an industrious and hard - working man]4593-an industrious and hard - working man ; but if [I]0-i choose to devote [myself]0-i to certain labors which yield more real profit , though but little money , [they]4594-they may be inclined to look on [me]0-i as [an idler]4595-an idler . Nevertheless , as [I]0-i do not need [the police of meaningless labor]4596-the police of meaningless labor to regulate [me]0-i , and do not see anything absolutely praise - worthy in [this fellow]4597-this fellow ’s undertaking , any more than in many an enterprise of [[our]4598-our own or foreign governments]4599-our own or foreign governments , however amusing it may be to [him]4597-this fellow or [them]4599-our own or foreign governments , [I]0-i prefer to finish [my]0-i education at [a different school]4600-a different school .

If [a man]1027-a man walk in [the woods]1463-the woods for love of [them]4599-our own or foreign governments half of each day , [he]1027-a man is in danger of being regarded as [a loafer]4603-a loafer ; but if [he]1027-a man spends [his]1027-a man whole day as a speculator , shearing off [those woods]4604-those woods and making earth bald before [her]4605-her time , [he]1027-a man is esteemed [an industrious and enterprising citizen]4606-an industrious and enterprising citizen . As if [a town]783-a town had no interest in [[its]783-a town forests]4608-its forests but to cut [them]4608-its forests down !

[Most men]3282-most men would feel insulted , if it were proposed to employ [them]4608-its forests in throwing stones over a wall , and then in throwing [them]4608-its forests back , merely that [they]4608-its forests might earn [their]4608-its forests wages . But many are no more worthily employed now . For instance : just after sunrise , one summer morning , [I]0-i noticed one of [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors walking beside [[his]1027-a man team]4611-his team , which was slowly drawing a heavy hewn stone swung under the axle , surrounded by an atmosphere of industry,—his day ’s work begun,—his brow commenced to sweat,—a reproach to all sluggards and idlers,—pausing abreast the shoulders of [his]1027-a man oxen , and half turning round with a flourish of [his]1027-a man merciful whip , while [they]4608-its forests gained [their]4608-its forests length on [him]1027-a man . And [I]0-i thought , Such is the labor which [the American Congress]4612-the american congress exists to protect,—honest , manly toil,—honest as the day is long,—that makes [his]1027-a man bread taste sweet , and keeps society sweet,—which [all men]2889-all men respect and have consecrated : one of the sacred band , doing the needful but irksome drudgery . Indeed , [I]0-i felt a slight reproach , because [I]0-i observed this from a window , and was not abroad and stirring about a similar business . The day went by , and at evening [I]0-i passed [the yard of [another neighbor]4615-another neighbor , who keeps [many servants]4616-many servants]4614-the yard of another neighbor , who keeps many servants , and spends much money foolishly , while [he]1027-a man adds nothing to the common stock , and there [I]0-i saw the stone of the morning lying beside a whimsical structure intended to adorn [[this Lord Timothy Dexter]697-this lord timothy dexter ’s premises]4617-this lord timothy dexter ’s premises , and the dignity forthwith departed from [the teamster]4618-the teamster ’s labor , in [my]0-i eyes . In [my]0-i opinion , the sun was made to light worthier toil than this . [I]0-i may add , that [[his]697-this lord timothy dexter employer]4619-his employer has since run off , in debt to [a good part of [the town]762-the town]4620-a good part of the town , and , after passing through [Chancery]372-chancery , has settled somewhere else , there to become once more [a patron of the arts]4622-a patron of the arts .

The ways by which [you]4623-you may get money almost without exception lead downward . To have done anything by which [you]4623-you earned money _ merely _ is to have been truly idle or worse . If [the laborer]4624-the laborer gets no more than the wages which [[his]4624-the laborer employer]4619-his employer pays [him]4624-the laborer , [he]4624-the laborer is cheated , [he]4624-the laborer cheats [himself]4624-the laborer . If [you]4626-you would get money as [a writer]4627-a writer or [lecturer]4628-lecturer , [you]4626-you must be popular , which is to go down perpendicularly . Those services which [the community]4629-the community will most readily pay for , it is most disagreeable to render . [You]4626-you are paid for being something less than [a man]1027-a man . [The State]816-the state does not commonly reward [a genius]4632-a genius any more wisely . Even [the poet - laureate]4633-the poet - laureate would rather not have to celebrate the accidents of [royalty]4634-royalty . [He]4633-the poet - laureate must be bribed with a pipe of wine ; and perhaps [another poet]4635-another poet is called away from [his]4633-the poet - laureate muse to gauge that very pipe . As for [my]0-i own business , even that kind of surveying which [I]0-i could do with most satisfaction , [[my]0-i employers]4636-my employers do not want . [They]4636-my employers would prefer that [I]0-i should do [my]0-i work coarsely and not too well , ay , not well enough . When [I]0-i observe that there are different ways of surveying , [[my]0-i employer]4637-my employer commonly asks which will give [him]4637-my employer the most land , not which is most correct . [I]0-i once invented a rule for measuring cord - wood , and tried to introduce it in [Boston]8-boston ; but [the measurer]4638-the measurer there told [me]0-i that [the sellers]4639-the sellers did not wish to have [their]4639-the sellers wood measured correctly,—that [he]4633-the poet - laureate was already too accurate for [them]4639-the sellers , and therefore [they]4639-the sellers commonly got [their]4639-the sellers wood measured in [Charlestown]373-charlestown before crossing [the bridge]1652-the bridge .

The aim of [the laborer]4624-the laborer should be , not to get [his]4624-the laborer living , to get “ a good job , ”[4624-the laborer] but to perform well a certain work ; and , even in a pecuniary sense , it would be economy for [a town]783-a town to pay [[its]783-a town laborers]4643-its laborers so well that [they]4643-its laborers would not feel that [they]4643-its laborers were working for low ends , as for a livelihood merely , but for scientific , or even moral ends . Do not hire [a man who does [your]4645-your work for money]4644-a man who does your work for money , but [[him]4644-a man who does your work for money who does it for love of it]4646-him who does it for love of it .

It is remarkable that there are [few men so well employed]4647-few men so well employed , so much to [their]4647-few men so well employed minds , but that a little money or fame would commonly buy [them]4647-few men so well employed off from [their]4647-few men so well employed present pursuit . [I]0-i see advertisements for [_ active _ young men]4648-_ active _ young men , as if activity were the whole of [a young man]4649-a young man ’s capital . Yet [I]0-i have been surprised when [one]936-one has with confidence proposed to [me]0-i , [a grown man]4651-a grown man , to embark in some enterprise of [his]4651-a grown man , as if [I]0-i had absolutely nothing to do , [my]0-i life having been a complete failure hitherto . What a doubtful compliment this is to pay [me]0-i ! As if [he]4651-a grown man had met [me]0-i half - way across [the ocean]1556-the ocean beating up against the wind , but bound nowhere , and proposed to [me]0-i to go along with [him]4651-a grown man ! If [I]0-i did , what do [you]4653-you think [the underwriters]4654-the underwriters would say ? No , no ! [I]0-i am not without employment at this stage of the voyage . To tell the truth , [I]0-i saw an advertisement for [able - bodied seamen]4655-able - bodied seamen , when [I]0-i was [a boy]1511-a boy , sauntering in [[my]0-i native port]4657-my native port , and as soon as [I]0-i came of age [I]0-i embarked .

[The community]4629-the community has no bribe that will tempt [a wise man]2881-a wise man . [You]4660-you may raise money enough to tunnel [a mountain]1680-a mountain , but [you]4660-you can not raise money enough to hire [a man who is minding _ [his]4662-a man who is minding _ his own _ business own _ business]4662-a man who is minding _ his own _ business . [An efficient and valuable man]4663-an efficient and valuable man does what [he]4663-an efficient and valuable man can , whether [the community]4629-the community pay [him]4663-an efficient and valuable man for it or not . The inefficient offer [their]4629-the community inefficiency to the highest bidder , and are forever expecting to be put into [office]4665-office . [One]936-one would suppose that [they]4629-the community were rarely disappointed .

Perhaps [I]0-i am more than usually jealous with respect to [my]0-i freedom . [I]0-i feel that [my]0-i connection with and obligation to [society]4667-society are still very slight and transient . Those slight labors which afford [me]0-i a livelihood , and by which it is allowed that [I]0-i am to some extent serviceable to [[my]0-i contemporaries]4668-my contemporaries , are as yet commonly a pleasure to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i am not often reminded that [they]4668-my contemporaries are a necessity . So far [I]0-i am successful . But [I]0-i foresee , that , if [my]0-i wants should be much increased , the labor required to supply [them]4668-my contemporaries would become a drudgery . If [I]0-i should sell both [my]0-i forenoons and afternoons to society , as most appear to do , [I]0-i am sure , that for [me]0-i there would be nothing left worth living for . [I]0-i trust that [I]0-i shall never thus sell [my]0-i birthright for a mess of pottage . [I]0-i wish to suggest that [a man]1027-a man may be very industrious , and yet not spend [his]1027-a man time well . There is no more fatal blunderer than [he]1027-a man who consumes the greater part of [his]1027-a man life getting [his]1027-a man living . [All great enterprises]4670-all great enterprises are self - supporting . [The poet]3879-the poet , for instance , must sustain [his]3879-the poet body by [his]3879-the poet poetry , as a steam planing - mill feeds its boilers with the shavings it makes . [You]4672-you must get [your]4672-you living by loving . But as it is said of [the merchants]2635-the merchants that ninety - seven in a hundred fail , so the life of [men]1028-men generally , tried by this standard , is a failure , and bankruptcy may be surely prophesied .

Merely to come into [the world]741-the world [the heir of a fortune]4676-the heir of a fortune is not to be born , but to be still - born , rather . To be supported by the charity of [friends]3222-friends , or a government - pension,—provided [you]4678-you continue to breathe,—by whatever fine synonymes [you]4678-you describe these relations , is to go into [the almshouse]4083-the almshouse . On Sundays [the poor debtor]4680-the poor debtor goes to [church]962-church to take an account of stock , and finds , of course , that [his]4680-the poor debtor outgoes have been greater than [his]4680-the poor debtor income . In [the Catholic Church]1505-the catholic church , especially , [they]2635-the merchants go into [Chancery]372-chancery , make a clean confession , give up all , and think to start again . Thus [men]1028-men will lie on [their]1028-men backs , talking about the fall of [man]2119-man , and never make an effort to get up .

As for the comparative demand which [men]1028-men make on life , it is an important difference between two , that [the one]2519-the one is satisfied with a level success , that [his]2519-the one marks can all be hit by point - blank shots , but the other , however low and unsuccessful [his]2519-the one life may be , constantly elevates [his]2519-the one aim , though at a very slight angle to the horizon . [I]0-i should much rather be [the last man,—though]4687-the last man,—though , as [the Orientals]698-the orientals say , “ Greatness doth not approach [him]4687-the last man,—though who is forever looking down ; and [all those who are looking high are growing poor]5641-all those who are looking high are growing poor . ”[698-the orientals]

It is remarkable that there is little or nothing to be remembered written on the subject of getting a living : how to make getting a living not merely honest and honorable , but altogether inviting and glorious ; for if _ getting _ a living is not so , then living is not . [One]936-one would think , from looking at literature , that this question had never disturbed [a solitary individual]4689-a solitary individual ’s musings . Is it that [men]1028-men are too much disgusted with [their]1028-men experience to speak of it ? The lesson of value which money teaches , which [the Author of the Universe]4691-the author of the universe has taken so much pains to teach [us]4692-us , [we]4692-us are inclined to skip altogether . As for the means of living , it is wonderful how [indifferent men of all classes]4693-indifferent men of all classes are about it , even [reformers]2877-reformers , so called,—whether [they]4693-indifferent men of all classes inherit , or earn , or steal it . [I]0-i think that [Society]699-society has done nothing for [us]4692-us in this respect , or at least has undone what [she]699-society has done . Cold and hunger seem more friendly to [my]0-i nature than those methods which [men]1028-men have adopted and advise to ward [them]1028-men off .

The title _ wise _ is , for the most part , falsely applied . How can [one]936-one be [a wise man]2881-a wise man , if [he]936-one does not know any better how to live than other men?—if [he]936-one is only more cunning and intellectually subtle ? Does Wisdom work in [a tread - mill]4698-a tread - mill ? or does [she]936-one teach how to succeed _ by [her]936-one example _ ? Is there any such thing as wisdom not applied to life ? Is [she]936-one merely [the miller who grinds the finest logic]4699-the miller who grinds the finest logic ? It is pertinent to ask if [Plato]550-plato got [his]550-plato _ living _ in a better way or more successfully than [[his]550-plato contemporaries,—or]4700-his contemporaries,—or did [he]550-plato succumb to the difficulties of life like [other men]4485-other men ? Did [he]550-plato seem to prevail over some of [them]1028-men merely by indifference , or by assuming grand airs ? or find it easier to live , because [[his]550-plato aunt]4702-his aunt remembered [him]550-plato in [her]4702-his aunt will ? The ways in which [most men]3282-most men get [their]3282-most men living , that is , live , are mere make - shifts , and a shirking of the real business of life,—chiefly because [they]3282-most men do not know , but partly because [they]3282-most men do not mean , any better .

The rush to [California]205-california , for instance , and the attitude , not merely of [merchants]4704-merchants , but of [philosophers]4447-philosophers and [prophets]4706-prophets , so called , in relation to it , reflect the greatest disgrace on [mankind]4707-mankind . That so many are ready to live by luck , and so get the means of commanding the labor of [others]985-others less lucky , without contributing any value to society ! And that is called enterprise ! [I]0-i know of no more startling development of the immorality of trade , and all the common modes of getting a living . The philosophy and poetry and religion of [such a mankind]4709-such a mankind are not worth the dust of a puff - ball . The hog that gets [his]550-plato living by rooting , stirring up the soil so , would be ashamed of such company . If [I]0-i could command the wealth of [all the worlds]4710-all the worlds by lifting [my]0-i finger , [I]0-i would not pay _ such _ a price for it . Even [Mahomet]672-mahomet knew that [God]554-god did not make [this world]3023-this world in jest . It makes [God]554-god to be [a moneyed gentleman who scatters [a handful of pennies in order to see mankind]4713-a handful of pennies in order to see mankind scramble for [them]4713-a handful of pennies in order to see mankind]4712-a moneyed gentleman who scatters a handful of pennies in order to see mankind scramble for them . [The world]741-the world ’s raffle ! A subsistence in [the domains of Nature]4715-the domains of nature a thing to be raffled for ! What a comment , what a satire , on [our]4716-our institutions ! The conclusion will be , that [mankind]4707-mankind will hang itself upon a tree . And have all the precepts in all the Bibles taught [men]1028-men only this ? and is the last and most admirable invention of the human race only an improved muckrake ? Is this the ground on which [Orientals]698-the orientals and [Occidentals]700-occidentals meet ? Did [God]554-god direct [us]4716-our so to get [our]4716-our living , digging where [we]4716-our never planted,—and [He]554-god would , perchance , reward [us]4716-our with lumps of gold ?

[God]554-god gave [the righteous man]4718-the righteous man a certificate entitling [him]4718-the righteous man to food and raiment , but [the unrighteous man]4719-the unrighteous man found a _ fac - simile _ of the same in [God]554-god ’s coffers , and appropriated it , and obtained food and raiment like the former . It is one of the most extensive systems of counterfeiting that [the world]741-the world has seen . [I]0-i did not know that [mankind]2685-mankind were suffering for want of gold . [I]0-i have seen a little of it . [I]0-i know that it is very malleable , but not so malleable as wit . A grain of gold will gild a great surface , but not so much as a grain of wisdom .

The gold - digger in [the ravines of [the mountains]1393-the mountains]4722-the ravines of the mountains is as much a gambler as [[his]4719-the unrighteous man fellow in [the saloons of [San Francisco]374-san francisco]4725-the saloons of san francisco]4724-his fellow in the saloons of san francisco . What difference does it make , whether [you]4726-you shake dirt or shake dice ? If [you]4726-you win , [society]4667-society is [the loser]4728-the loser . [The gold - digger]4729-the gold - digger is [the enemy of [the honest laborer]4731-the honest laborer]4730-the enemy of the honest laborer , whatever checks and compensations there may be . It is not enough to tell [me]0-i that [you]4732-you worked hard to get [your]4732-you gold . So does [the Devil]2673-the devil work hard . The way of [transgressors]4734-transgressors may be hard in many respects . [The humblest observer who goes to [the mines]4372-the mines sees and says that gold - digging is of the character of a lottery]4735-the humblest observer who goes to the mines sees and says that gold - digging is of the character of a lottery ; the gold thus obtained is not the same thing with the wages of honest toil . But , practically , [he]4735-the humblest observer who goes to the mines sees and says that gold - digging is of the character of a lottery forgets what [he]4735-the humblest observer who goes to the mines sees and says that gold - digging is of the character of a lottery has seen , for [he]4735-the humblest observer who goes to the mines sees and says that gold - digging is of the character of a lottery has seen only the fact , not the principle , and goes into trade there , that is , buys a ticket in what commonly proves another lottery , where the fact is not so obvious .

After reading [Howitt]701-howitt ’s account of [the Australian gold - diggings]4737-the australian gold - diggings one evening , [I]0-i had in [my]0-i mind ’s eye , all night , the numerous valleys , with [[their]4737-the australian gold - diggings streams]4738-their streams , all cut up with foul pits , from ten to one hundred feet deep , and half a dozen feet across , as close as [they]4737-the australian gold - diggings can be dug , and partly filled with water,—the locality to which [men]1028-men furiously rush to probe for [their]1028-men fortunes,—uncertain where [they]1028-men shall break ground,—not knowing but the gold is under [their]1028-men camp itself,—sometimes digging one hundred and sixty feet before [they]1028-men strike the vein , or then missing it by a foot,—turned into demons , and regardless of each other ’s rights , in [their]1028-men thirst for [riches,—whole valleys]4740-riches,—whole valleys , for thirty miles , suddenly honeycombed by the pits of [the miners]4741-the miners , so that even hundreds are drowned in them,—standing in water , and covered with mud and clay , [they]4741-the miners work night and day , dying of exposure and disease . Having read this , and partly forgotten it , [I]0-i was thinking , accidentally , of [my]0-i own unsatisfactory life , doing as [others]985-others do ; and with that vision of the diggings still before [me]0-i , [I]0-i asked [myself]0-i , why _ [I]0-i _ might not be washing some gold daily , though it were only the finest particles,—why _ [I]0-i _ might not sink a shaft down to the gold within [me]0-i , and work that mine . _ There _ is a Ballarat , a Bendigo for you,—what though it were a sulky - gully ? At any rate , [I]0-i might pursue some path , however solitary and narrow and crooked , in which [I]0-i could walk with love and reverence . Wherever [a man]1027-a man separates from the multitude , and goes [his]1027-a man own way in this mood , there indeed is a fork in [the road]1438-the road , though [ordinary travellers]4745-ordinary travellers may see only a gap in the paling . [His]1027-a man solitary path across lots will turn out the _ higher way _ of the two .

[Men]1028-men rush to [California]205-california and [Australia]375-australia as if the true gold were to be found in that direction ; but that is to go to [the very opposite extreme to where it lies]4747-the very opposite extreme to where it lies . [They]1028-men go prospecting farther and farther away from the true lead , and are most unfortunate when [they]1028-men think [themselves]1028-men most successful . Is not [our]4748-our _ native _ soil auriferous ? Does not [a stream from [the golden mountains]4750-the golden mountains]4749-a stream from the golden mountains flow through [[our]4748-our native valley]4751-our native valley ? and has not this for more than geologic ages been bringing down the shining particles and forming the nuggets for [us]4748-our ? Yet , strange to tell , if [a digger]4752-a digger steal away , prospecting for this true gold , into the unexplored solitudes around [us]4748-our , there is no danger that any will dog [his]1027-a man steps , and endeavor to supplant [him]1027-a man . [He]1027-a man may claim and undermine [the whole valley]4753-the whole valley even , both [the cultivated]4754-the cultivated and the uncultivated portions , [his]1027-a man whole life long in peace , for [no one]4079-no one will ever dispute [his]1027-a man claim . [They]1028-men will not mind [his]1027-a man cradles or [his]1027-a man toms . [He]1027-a man is not confined to a claim twelve feet square , as at [Ballarat]376-ballarat , but may mine anywhere , and wash [the whole wide world]4756-the whole wide world in [his]1027-a man tom .

[Howitt]701-howitt says of [the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at [the [Bendigo]377-bendigo diggings in [Australia]375-australia]4758-the bendigo diggings in australia]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia : “ [He]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia soon began to drink ; got a horse , and rode all about , generally at full gallop , and , when [he]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia met [people]3564-people , called out to inquire if [they]3564-people knew who [he]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia was , and then kindly informed [them]3564-people that [he]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia was ‘ the bloody wretch that had found the nugget . ’ At last [he]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia rode full speed against a tree , and nearly knocked [his]4757-the man who found the great nugget which weighed twenty - eight pounds , at the bendigo diggings in australia brains out . ”[701-howitt] [I]0-i think , however , there was no danger of that , for [he]1027-a man had already knocked [his]1027-a man brains out against the nugget . [Howitt]701-howitt adds , “ [He]1027-a man is [a hopelessly ruined man]5643-a hopelessly ruined man . ”[1027-a man] But [he]1027-a man is [a type of [the class]4760-the class]4759-a type of the class . [They]4761-they are [all fast men]4762-all fast men . Hear some of the names of [the places where [they]4761-they dig]4763-the places where they dig : “ [Jackass Flat,”—“Sheep’s[4761-they] - Head Gully,”—“Murderer]702-jackass flat,”—“sheep’s - head gully,”—“murderer ’s Bar , ”[4761-they] etc . Is there no satire in these names ? Let [them]4761-they carry [their]4761-they ill - gotten wealth where [they]4761-they will , [I]0-i am thinking it will still be “ [Jackass Flat]703-jackass flat , ”[4761-they] if not “ [Murderer]704-murderer ’s Bar , ”[4761-they] where [they]4761-they live .

The last resource of [our]4764-our energy has been the robbing of graveyards on [the Isthmus of [Darien]705-darien]378-the isthmus of darien , an enterprise which appears to be but in its infancy ; for , according to late accounts , an act has passed its second reading in the legislature of [New Granada]379-new granada , regulating this kind of mining ; and [a correspondent of [the “ Tribune ”]5645-the “ tribune ”]5644-a correspondent of the “ tribune ”[5645-the “ tribune ”] writes : “ In the dry season , when the weather will permit of [the country]750-the country being properly prospected , no doubt other rich . _ guacas _ [ that is , graveyards ] will be found . ”[705-darien] To emigrants [he]705-darien says : “ Do not come before December ; take the Isthmus route in preference to the [Boca del Toro]380-boca del toro one ; bring no useless baggage , and do not cumber [yourself]5647-you with a tent ; but a good pair of blankets will be necessary ; a pick , shovel , and axe of good material will be almost all that is required ”[705-darien] : advice which might have been taken from the “ [Burker]706-burker ’s Guide . ”[705-darien] And [he]705-darien concludes with this line in Italics and small capitals : “ _ If [you]5647-you are doing well at [home]867-home _ , STAY THERE , ”[705-darien] which may fairly be interpreted to mean , “ If [you]5647-you are getting a good living by robbing graveyards at [home]867-home , stay there . ”[705-darien]

But why go to [California]205-california for a text ? [She]4765-she is [the child of [New England]20-new england]4766-the child of new england , bred at [[her]4765-she own school and [church]962-church]4767-her own school and church .

It is remarkable that among all [the preachers]4769-the preachers there are [so few moral teachers]4770-so few moral teachers . [The prophets]5632-the prophets are employed in excusing the ways of [men]1028-men . [Most reverend seniors]4773-most reverend seniors , the _ illuminati _ of the age , tell [me]0-i , with a gracious , reminiscent smile , betwixt an aspiration and a shudder , not to be too tender about these things,—to lump all that , that is , make a lump of gold of it . The highest advice [I]0-i have heard on these subjects was grovelling . The burden of it was,—It is not worth [your]4774-your while to undertake to reform [the world]741-the world in this particular . Do not ask how [your]4774-your bread is buttered ; it will make [you]4774-your sick , if [you]4774-your do,—and the like . [A man]1027-a man had better starve at once than lose [his]1027-a man innocence in the process of getting [his]1027-a man bread . As [we]4781-we grow old , [we]4781-we live more coarsely , [we]4781-we relax a little in [our]4781-we disciplines , and , to some extent , cease to obey [our]4781-we finest instincts . But [we]4781-we should be fastidious to the extreme of sanity , disregarding the gibes of [those who are more unfortunate than [ourselves]4781-we]4782-those who are more unfortunate than ourselves .

In [our]4781-we science and philosophy , even , there is commonly no true and absolute account of things . The spirit of [sect and bigotry]4783-sect and bigotry has planted its hoof amid the stars . [You]4784-you have only to discuss the problem , whether the stars are inhabited or not , in order to discover it . Why must [we]4781-we daub the heavens as well as [the earth]1074-the earth ? [You]4790-you come from attending the funeral of mankind to attend to a natural phenomenon . A little thought is sexton to [all the world]4791-all the world .

To speak impartially , [the best men that [I]0-i know]4802-the best men that i know are not serene , a world in [themselves]4802-the best men that i know . [We]4803-we select granite for the underpinning of [[our]4803-we houses]4015-our houses and [barns]4805-barns ; [we]4803-we build fences of stone ; but [we]4803-we do not [ourselves]4803-we rest on an underpinning of granitic truth , [the lowest primitive rock]4806-the lowest primitive rock . [I]0-i often accuse [[my]0-i finest acquaintances]4808-my finest acquaintances of an immense frivolity ; for , while there are manners and compliments [we]4803-we do not meet , [we]4803-we do not teach one another the lessons of honesty and sincerity that [the brutes]4809-the brutes do , or of steadiness and solidity that the rocks do . The fault is commonly mutual , however ; for [we]4803-we do not habitually demand any more of each other .

That excitement about [Kossuth]708-kossuth , consider how characteristic , but superficial , it was!—only another kind of politics or dancing . [Men]1028-men were making speeches to [him]708-kossuth all over [the country]750-the country , but [each]4812-each expressed only the thought , or the want of thought , of [the multitude]4813-the multitude . [No man]5310-no man stood on truth . [They]1028-men were merely banded together , as usual , [one leaning on another]4815-one leaning on another , and all together on nothing ; as [the Hindoos]709-the hindoos made [the world rest]4816-the world rest on an elephant , the elephant on a tortoise , and the tortoise on a serpent , and had nothing to put under the serpent . For all fruit of that stir [we]4803-we have the Kossuth hat .

Just so hollow and ineffectual , for the most part , is [our]4803-we ordinary conversation . Surface meets surface . When [our]4803-we life ceases to be inward and private , conversation degenerates into mere gossip . [We]4803-we rarely meet [a man who can tell [us]4803-we any news which [he]708-kossuth has not read in a newspaper , or been told by [[his]708-kossuth neighbor]3052-his neighbor]4817-a man who can tell us any news which he has not read in a newspaper , or been told by his neighbor ; and , for the most part , the only difference between [us]4803-we and [[our]4803-we fellow]4819-our fellow is , that [he]708-kossuth has seen the newspaper , or been out to tea , and [we]4803-we have not . In proportion as [our]4803-we inward life fails , [we]4803-we go more constantly and desperately to [the post - office]4820-the post - office . [I]0-i do not know but it is too much to read one newspaper a week . [I]0-i have tried it recently , and for so long it seems to [me]0-i that [I]0-i have not dwelt in [[my]0-i native region]4823-my native region . The sun , the clouds , the snow , the trees say not so much to [me]0-i . [You]4824-you can not serve [two masters]4825-two masters . It requires more than a day ’s devotion to know and to possess the wealth of a day .

[We]4803-we may well be ashamed to tell what things [we]4803-we have read or heard in [our]4803-we day . [I]0-i do not know why [my]0-i news should be so trivial,—considering what [one]936-one ’s dreams and expectations are , why the developments should be so paltry . The news [we]4803-we hear , for the most part , is not news to [our]4803-we genius . It is the stalest repetition . [You]4827-you are often tempted to ask , why such stress is laid on a particular experience which [you]4827-you have had,—that , after twenty - five years , [you]4827-you should meet [Hobbins]710-hobbins , [Registrar of Deeds]711-registrar of deeds , again on [the sidewalk]999-the sidewalk . Have [you]4827-you not budged an inch , then ? Such is the daily news . Its facts appear to float in the atmosphere , insignificant as the sporules of fungi , and impinge on some neglected _ thallus _ , or surface of [our]4803-we minds , which affords a basis for [them]4829-them , and hence a parasitic growth . [We]4803-we should wash [ourselves]4803-we clean of such news . Of what consequence , though [our]4803-we planet explode , if there is [no character involved in the explosion]4830-no character involved in the explosion ? In health [we]4803-we have not the least curiosity about such events . [We]4803-we do not live for idle amusement . [I]0-i would not run round a corner to see [the world]741-the world blow up .

All summer , and far into the autumn , perchance , [you]4827-you unconsciously went by the newspapers and the news , and now [you]4827-you find it was because the morning and the evening were full of news to [you]4827-you . [Your]4827-you walks were full of incidents . [You]4827-you attended , not to the affairs of [Europe]135-europe , but to [your]4827-you own affairs in [Massachusetts fields]12-massachusetts . If [you]4827-you chance to live and move and have [your]4827-you being in that thin stratum in which the events that make the news transpire,—thinner than the paper on which it is printed,—then these things will fill [the world]741-the world for [you]4827-you ; but if [you]4827-you soar above or dive below [that plane]4833-that plane , [you]4827-you can not remember nor be reminded of [them]4833-that plane . Really to see the sun rise or go down every day , so to relate [ourselves]4803-we to a universal fact , would preserve [us]4803-we sane forever . Nations ! What are nations ? [Tartars]712-tartars , and [Huns]713-huns , and [Chinamen]572-the chinamen ! Like insects , [they]712-tartars swarm . [The historian]3880-the historian strives in vain to make [them]712-tartars memorable . It is for want of a man that there are [so many men]4835-so many men . It is individuals that populate [the world]741-the world . [Any man]3266-any man thinking may say with [the Spirit of [Lodin]714-lodin]4838-the spirit of lodin , —

“ [I]3266-any man look down from [my]3266-any man height on nations , And [they]4839-hill and dale become ashes before [me]3266-any man ; — Calm is [my]3266-any man dwelling in the clouds ; Pleasant are the great fields of [my]3266-any man rest . ”[3266-any man]

Pray , let [us]4803-we live without being drawn by dogs , [Esquimaux]715-esquimaux - fashion , tearing over [hill and dale]4839-hill and dale , and biting each other ’s ears .

Not without a slight shudder at the danger , [I]0-i often perceive how near [I]0-i had come to admitting into [my]0-i mind the details of some trivial affair,—the news of [the street]5231-the street ; and [I]0-i am astonished to observe how [willing men]4841-willing men are to lumber [their]4841-willing men minds with such rubbish,—to permit idle rumors and incidents of the most insignificant kind to intrude on ground which should be sacred to thought . Shall the mind be [a public arena]4842-a public arena , where the affairs of [the street]5231-the street and the gossip of the tea - table chiefly are discussed ? Or shall it be a quarter of [heaven itself,—an hypæthral temple]4844-heaven itself,—an hypæthral temple , consecrated to the service of [the gods]2775-the gods ? [I]0-i find it so difficult to dispose of the few facts which to [me]0-i are significant that [I]0-i hesitate to burden [my]0-i attention with those which are insignificant , which only a divine mind could illustrate . Such is , for the most part , the news in newspapers and conversation . It is important to preserve the mind ’s chastity in this respect . Think of admitting the details of a single case of [the criminal court]4846-the criminal court into [our]4803-we thoughts , to stalk profanely through [their]4841-willing men very _ sanctum sanctorum _ for an hour , ay , for many hours ! to make [a very bar - room of [the mind ’s inmost apartment]4848-the mind ’s inmost apartment]4847-a very bar - room of the mind ’s inmost apartment , as if for so long the dust of [the street]5231-the street had occupied us,—the very street itself , with all its travel , [its]4847-a very bar - room of the mind ’s inmost apartment bustle , and filth , had passed through [our]4803-we thoughts ’ shrine ! Would it not be an intellectual and moral suicide ? When [I]0-i have been compelled to sit spectator and [auditor]4850-auditor in [a court - room]4851-a court - room for some hours , and have seen [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors , who were not compelled , stealing in from time to time , and tiptoeing about with washed hands and faces , it has appeared to [my]0-i mind ’s eye , that , when [they]2501-my neighbors took off [their]2501-my neighbors hats , [their]2501-my neighbors ears suddenly expanded into vast hoppers for sound , between which even [their]2501-my neighbors narrow heads were crowded . Like the vanes of windmills , [they]2501-my neighbors caught the broad , but shallow stream of sound , which , after a few titillating gyrations in [their]2501-my neighbors coggy brains , passed out the other side . [I]0-i wondered if , when [they]2501-my neighbors got [home]867-home , [they]2501-my neighbors were as careful to wash [their]2501-my neighbors ears as before [their]2501-my neighbors hands and faces . It has seemed to [me]0-i , at such a time , that [the auditors]4854-the auditors and [the witnesses]4855-the witnesses , [the jury]4856-the jury and [the counsel]4857-the counsel , [the judge]2528-the judge and the criminal at the bar,—if [I]0-i may presume [him]2528-the judge guilty before [he]2528-the judge is convicted,—were all equally criminal , and a thunderbolt might be expected to descend and consume [them]2501-my neighbors all together .

By all kinds of traps and signboards , threatening the extreme penalty of the divine law , exclude such trespassers from the only ground which can be sacred to [you]4859-you . It is so hard to forget what it is worse than useless to remember ! If [I]0-i am to be a thoroughfare , [I]0-i prefer that it be of [the mountain - brooks]4860-the mountain - brooks , [the Parnassian streams]4861-the parnassian streams , and not [the town - sewers]4862-the town - sewers . There is inspiration , that gossip which comes to the ear of the attentive mind from [the courts of [heaven]4107-heaven]4863-the courts of heaven . There is the profane and stale revelation of [the bar - room]4865-the bar - room and [the police court]4866-the police court . The same ear is fitted to receive both communications . Only the character of [the hearer]4867-the hearer determines to which it shall be open , and to which closed . [I]0-i believe that the mind can be permanently profaned by the habit of attending to trivial things , so that all [our]4868-we thoughts shall be tinged with triviality . [Our]4868-we very intellect shall be macadamized , as it were,—its foundation broken into fragments for the wheels of travel to roll over ; and if [you]4869-you would know what will make the most durable pavement , surpassing rolled stones , spruce blocks , and asphaltum , [you]4869-you have only to look into some of [our]4868-we minds which have been subjected to this treatment so long .

If [we]4868-we have thus desecrated ourselves,—as who has not?—the remedy will be by wariness and devotion to reconsecrate [ourselves]4868-we , and make once more a fane of the mind . [We]4868-we should treat [our]4868-we minds , that is , [ourselves]4868-we , as [innocent and ingenuous children , whose guardians [we]4868-we are]4870-innocent and ingenuous children , whose guardians we are , and be careful what objects and what subjects [we]4868-we thrust on [their]4870-innocent and ingenuous children , whose guardians we are attention . Read not the Times . Read the Eternities . Conventionalities are at length as bad as impurities . Even the facts of science may dust the mind by [their]4870-innocent and ingenuous children , whose guardians we are dryness , unless they are in a sense effaced each morning , or rather rendered fertile by the dews of fresh and living truth . Knowledge does not come to [us]4868-we by details , but in flashes of light from heaven . Yes , every thought that passes through the mind helps to wear and tear it , and to deepen the ruts , which , as in [the streets of [Pompeii]382-pompeii]4871-the streets of pompeii , evince how much it has been used . How many things there are concerning which [we]4868-we might well deliberate whether [we]4868-we had better know [them,—had]4872-them,—had better let [their]4872-them,—had peddling - carts be driven , even at the slowest trot or walk , over that bridge of glorious span by which [we]4868-we trust to pass at last from the farthest brink of time to [the nearest shore of eternity]4873-the nearest shore of eternity ! Have [we]4868-we no culture , no refinement,—but skill only to live coarsely and serve [the Devil?—to]716-the devil?—to acquire a little worldly wealth , or fame , or liberty , and make a false show with it , as if [we]4868-we were all husk and shell , with no tender and living kernel to [us]4868-we ? Shall [our]4868-we institutions be like those chestnut - burrs which contain abortive nuts , perfect only to prick the fingers ?

[America]23-america is said to be the arena on which the battle of freedom is to be fought ; but surely it can not be freedom in a merely political sense that is meant . Even if [we]4868-we grant that [the American]2962-the american has freed [himself]2962-the american from [a political tyrant]4875-a political tyrant , [he]2962-the american is still [the slave of [an economical and moral tyrant]4877-an economical and moral tyrant]4876-the slave of an economical and moral tyrant . Do [we]4868-we call this [the land of the free]4882-the land of the free ? What is it to be born free and not to live free ? What is the value of any political freedom , but as a means to moral freedom ? Is it a freedom to be [slaves]2543-slaves , or a freedom to be free , of which [we]4868-we boast ? [We]4868-we are [a nation of politicians]2591-a nation of politicians , concerned about the out - most defences only of freedom . It is taxation without representation . [[We]4868-we quarter troops]4887-we quarter troops , [we]4868-we quarter fools and cattle of all sorts upon [ourselves]4868-we . [We]4868-we quarter [our]4868-we gross bodies on [our]4868-we poor souls , till [the former]906-the former eat up all the latter ’s substance .

With respect to a true culture and [manhood]3600-manhood , [we]4868-we are essentially [provincial still , not metropolitan,—mere Jonathans]4890-provincial still , not metropolitan,—mere jonathans . [We]4868-we are provincial , because [we]4868-we do not find at [home]867-home [our]4868-we standards,—because [we]4868-we do not worship truth , but the reflection of truth,—because [we]4868-we are warped and narrowed by an exclusive devotion to trade and commerce and manufactures and agriculture and the like , which are but means , and not the end .

So is [the English Parliament provincial]4892-the english parliament provincial . [Their]4893-mere country - bumpkins “ good breeding ”[4893-mere country - bumpkins] respects only secondary objects . [They]4893-mere country - bumpkins appear but as the fashions of past days,—mere courtliness , knee - buckles and small - clothes , out of date . [You]4897-you are presented with the shells instead of the meat , and it is no excuse generally , that , in the case of some fishes , the shells are of more worth than the meat . [The man who thrusts [his]4898-the man who thrusts his manners upon me manners upon [me]0-i]4898-the man who thrusts his manners upon me does as if [he]4898-the man who thrusts his manners upon me were to insist on introducing [me]0-i to [[his]4898-the man who thrusts his manners upon me cabinet of curiosities]4899-his cabinet of curiosities , when [I]0-i wished to see [himself]4898-the man who thrusts his manners upon me . A commerce that whitens [every sea in quest of nuts and raisins]4919-every sea in quest of nuts and raisins , and makes slaves of [[its]4919-every sea in quest of nuts and raisins sailors]4920-its sailors for this purpose ! [I]0-i saw , the other day , [a vessel which had been wrecked , and many lives lost , and [her]4921-a vessel which had been wrecked , and many lives lost , and her cargo of rags , juniper - berries , and bitter almonds were strewn along the shore cargo of rags , juniper - berries , and bitter almonds were strewn along [the shore]846-the shore]4921-a vessel which had been wrecked , and many lives lost , and her cargo of rags , juniper - berries , and bitter almonds were strewn along the shore . It seemed hardly worth the while to tempt the dangers of [the sea]2243-the sea between Leghorn and [New York]45-new york for the sake of a cargo of juniper - berries and bitter almonds . [America]23-america sending to [the Old World]1671-the old world for [her]4921-a vessel which had been wrecked , and many lives lost , and her cargo of rags , juniper - berries , and bitter almonds were strewn along the shore bitters ! Is not [the sea - brine]4925-the sea - brine , is not shipwreck , bitter enough to make the cup of life go down here ? Yet such , to a great extent , is [our]4926-our boasted commerce ; and there are [those who style [themselves]4927-those who style themselves statesmen statesmen]4927-those who style themselves statesmen and [philosophers who are so blind as to think that progress and civilization]4928-philosophers who are so blind as to think that progress and civilization depend on precisely this kind of interchange and activity,—the activity of flies about a molasses - hogshead . Very well , observes one , if [men]1028-men were oysters . And very well , answer [I]0-i , if [men]1028-men were mosquitoes .

[Lieutenant Herndon , whom [[our]4926-our Government sent to explore [the Amazon]267-the amazon]4932-our government sent to explore the amazon]4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon , and , it is said , to extend the area of slavery , observed that there was wanting there “ [an industrious and active population]5651-an industrious and active population , who know what the comforts of life are , and who have artificial wants to draw out the great resources of [the country]750-the country . ”[4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon] But what are the “ artificial wants ”[4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon] to be encouraged ? Not the love of luxuries , like the tobacco and slaves of , [I]0-i believe , [[his]4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon native [Virginia]195-virginia]4933-his native virginia , nor the ice and granite and other material wealth of [[our]4926-our native [New England]20-new england]4934-our native new england ; nor are “ the great resources of [a country ”[4935-the chief] that fertility or barrenness of soil]5653-a country ” that fertility or barrenness of soil which produces these . [The chief]4935-the chief want , in [every State that [I]0-i have been into]4936-every state that i have been into , was a high and earnest purpose in [[its]4936-every state that i have been into inhabitants]2039-its inhabitants . This alone draws out “ the great resources ”[4935-the chief] of Nature , and at last taxes [her]4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon beyond [her]4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon resources ; for [man]2119-man naturally dies out of [her]4931-lieutenant herndon , whom our government sent to explore the amazon . When [we]4926-our want culture more than potatoes , and illumination more than sugar - plums , then the great resources of [a world]4939-a world are taxed and drawn out , and the result , or staple production , is , not [slaves]2543-slaves , nor [operatives]4941-operatives , but men,—those rare fruits called [heroes]2874-heroes , [saints]4943-saints , [poets]4367-poets , [philosophers]4447-philosophers , and redeemers .

In short , as a snow - drift is formed where there is a lull in the wind , so , one would say , where there is a lull of truth , an institution springs up . But the truth blows right on over it , nevertheless , and at length blows it down .

What is called politics is comparatively something so superficial and inhuman , that , practically , [I]0-i have never fairly recognized that it concerns [me]0-i at all . The newspapers , [I]0-i perceive , devote some of [their]4946-their columns specially to politics or government without charge ; and this , [one]936-one would say , is all that saves it ; but , as [I]0-i love literature , and , to some extent , the truth also , [I]0-i never read those columns at any rate . [I]0-i do not wish to blunt [my]0-i sense of right so much . [I]0-i have not got to answer for having read [a single President]4948-a single president ’s Message . A strange age of [the world]741-the world this , when [empires]4950-empires , kingdoms , and republics come a - begging to [a private man]2101-a private man ’s door , and utter [their]4952-their complaints at [his]2101-a private man elbow ! [I]0-i can not take up a newspaper but [I]0-i find that [some wretched government]4953-some wretched government or other , hard pushed , and on its last legs , is interceding with [me]0-i , [the reader]747-the reader , to vote for it,—more importunate than [an Italian beggar]4955-an italian beggar ; and if [I]0-i have a mind to look at its certificate , made , perchance , by [[some benevolent merchant]4956-some benevolent merchant ’s clerk]4957-some benevolent merchant ’s clerk , or [the skipper that brought it over]4958-the skipper that brought it over , for it can not speak a word of English itself , [I]0-i shall probably read of the eruption of some [Vesuvius]723-vesuvius , or the overflowing of some Po , true or forged , which brought it into this condition . [I]0-i do not hesitate , in such a case , to suggest work , or [the almshouse]4083-the almshouse ; or why not keep [its castle]4960-its castle in silence , as [I]0-i do commonly ? [The poor President]4961-the poor president , what with preserving [his]4961-the poor president popularity and doing [his]4961-the poor president duty , is completely bewildered . The newspapers are the ruling power . [Any other government]4962-any other government is reduced to [a few marines at [Fort Independence]384-fort independence]4963-a few marines at fort independence . If [a man]1027-a man neglects to read the Daily Times , [government]2794-government will go down on [its]2794-government knees to [him]1027-a man , for this is the only treason in these days .

Those things which now most engage the attention of [men]1028-men , as politics and the daily routine , are , it is true , vital functions of [human society]4967-human society , but should be unconsciously performed , like the corresponding functions of [the physical body]4968-the physical body . [They]4969-they are _ infra_-human , a kind of vegetation . [I]0-i sometimes awake to a half - consciousness of [them]4969-they going on about [me]0-i , as [a man]1027-a man may become conscious of some of the processes of digestion in a morbid state , and so have the dyspepsia , as it is called . It is as if [a thinker]4971-a thinker submitted [himself]1027-a man to be rasped by the great gizzard of creation . Politics is , as it were , the gizzard of society , full of grit and gravel , and [the two political parties]4972-the two political parties are [its]4972-the two political parties two opposite halves,—sometimes split into quarters , it may be , which grind on each other . Not only [individuals]5540-individuals , but states , have thus a confirmed dyspepsia , which expresses itself , [you]4974-you can imagine by what sort of eloquence . Thus [our]4975-our life is not altogether a forgetting , but also , alas ! to a great extent , a remembering , of that which [we]4975-our should never have been conscious of , certainly not in [our]4975-our waking hours . Why should [we]4975-our not meet , not always as dyspeptics , to tell [our]4975-our bad dreams , but sometimes as _ eu_peptics , to congratulate each other on the ever - glorious morning ? [I]0-i do not make an exorbitant demand , surely .
