[WENDELL PHILLIPS]402-wendell phillips BEFORE THE CONCORD LYCEUM.[11 ]

Footnote 11 :

From “ [The Liberator]5654-the liberator , ”[724-mr . editor] March 28 , 1845 .

CONCORD , MASS . , March 12 , 1845 .

[MR . EDITOR]724-mr . editor : —

[We]4976-we have now , for the third winter , had [our]4976-we spirits refreshed , and [our]4976-we faith in the destiny of [the Commonwealth]2616-the commonwealth strengthened , by the presence and the eloquence of [Wendell Phillips]402-wendell phillips ; and [we]4976-we wish to tender to [him]402-wendell phillips [our]4976-we thanks and [our]4976-we sympathy . The admission of [this gentleman]1361-this gentleman into [the Lyceum]4979-the lyceum has been strenuously opposed by [a respectable portion of [[our]4976-we fellow - citizens , who [themselves]4981-our fellow - citizens , who themselves , we trust,—whose descendants , [we]4976-we trust,—whose descendants]4981-our fellow - citizens , who themselves , we trust,—whose descendants]4980-a respectable portion of our fellow - citizens , who themselves , we trust,—whose descendants , at least , [we]4976-we know,—will be as [faithful conservers of the true order , whenever that shall be the order of the day,—and]4982-faithful conservers of the true order , whenever that shall be the order of the day,—and in each instance [the people]1562-the people have voted that [they]1562-the people _ would hear [him]402-wendell phillips _ , by coming [themselves]1562-the people and bringing [[their]1562-the people friends]4984-their friends to [the lecture - room]4985-the lecture - room , and being very silent that [they]1562-the people _ might _ hear . [We]4976-we saw [some men]4264-some men and [women]1302-women , who had long ago _ come out _ , _ going in _ once more through the free and hospitable portals of [the Lyceum]4979-the lyceum ; and many of [[our]4976-we neighbors]4989-our neighbors confessed , that [they]4989-our neighbors had had a “ sound season ”[4989-our neighbors] this once .

It was [the speaker]3317-the speaker ’s aim to show what [the State]816-the state , and above all [the Church]980-the church , had to do , and now , alas ! have done , with [Texas]385-texas and slavery , and how much , on the other hand , [the individual]3327-the individual should have to do with Church and State . These were fair themes , and not mistimed ; and [his]3327-the individual words were addressed to “ fit , [audience]5655-audience , _ and not _ few . ”[3327-the individual]

[We]4976-we must give [Mr. Phillips]725-mr. phillips the credit of being a clean , erect , and what was once called [a consistent man]4994-a consistent man . [He]4994-a consistent man at least is not responsible for slavery , nor for American Independence ; for the hypocrisy and superstition of [the Church]980-the church , nor the timidity and selfishness of [the State]816-the state ; nor for the indifference and willing ignorance of any . [He]4994-a consistent man stands so distinctly , so firmly , and so effectively alone , and [one honest man]4997-one honest man is so much more than [a host]4998-a host , that [we]4999-we can not but feel that [he]4997-one honest man does [himself]4997-one honest man injustice when [he]4997-one honest man reminds [us]4999-we of “ [the American Society]5656-the american society , which [he]4997-one honest man represents . ”[4997-one honest man] It is rare that [we]4999-we have the pleasure of listening to so clear and orthodox [a speaker]5000-a speaker , who obviously has so few cracks or flaws in [his]4994-a consistent man moral nature,—who , having words at [his]4994-a consistent man command in a remarkable degree , has much more than words , if these should fail , in [his]4994-a consistent man unquestionable earnestness and integrity,—and , aside from [their]5001-their admiration at [his]4994-a consistent man rhetoric , secures the genuine respect of [[his]4994-a consistent man audience]4256-his audience . [He]4994-a consistent man unconsciously tells [his]4994-a consistent man biography as [he]4994-a consistent man proceeds , and [we]4999-we see [him]4994-a consistent man early and earnestly deliberating on these subjects , and wisely and bravely , without counsel or consent of any , occupying a ground at first from which the varying tides of public opinion can not drive [him]4994-a consistent man .

[No one]4079-no one could mistake the genuine modesty and truth with which [he]4994-a consistent man affirmed , when speaking of the framers of the Constitution , “ [I]4994-a consistent man am wiser than [they]5657-they , ”[4994-a consistent man] who with [him]4994-a consistent man has improved these sixty years ’ experience of its working ; or the uncompromising consistency and frankness of the prayer which concluded , not like the Thanksgiving proclamations , with—“God save [the Commonwealth of [Massachusetts]12-massachusetts]386-the commonwealth of massachusetts , ”[554-god] but — [God]554-god dash it into a thousand pieces , till there shall not remain a fragment on which [a man]1027-a man can stand , and dare not tell [his]1027-a man name,—referring to the case of [Frederick]726-frederick — — ; to [our]4999-we disgrace [we]4999-we know not what to call [him]726-frederick , unless [Scotland]358-scotland will lend [us]4999-we the spoils of one of [her]358-scotland Douglasses , out of history or fiction , for a season , till [we]4999-we be hospitable and brave enough to hear [[his]726-frederick proper name,—a fugitive slave]5005-his proper name,—a fugitive slave in one more sense than [we]4999-we ; who has proved [himself]726-frederick the possessor of a _ fair _ intellect , and has won a colorless reputation in these parts ; and who , [we]4999-we trust , will be as superior to degradation from the sympathies of Freedom , as from the antipathies of Slavery . When , said [Mr. Phillips]725-mr. phillips , [he]725-mr. phillips communicated to [a New Bedford audience]5006-a new bedford audience , the other day , [his]725-mr. phillips purpose of writing [his]725-mr. phillips life , and telling [his]725-mr. phillips name , and the name of [[his]725-mr. phillips master]5007-his master , and the place [he]725-mr. phillips ran from , the murmur ran round [the room]1352-the room , and was anxiously whispered by [the sons of [the Pilgrims]1818-the pilgrims]5009-the sons of the pilgrims , “ [He]725-mr. phillips had better not ! ”[1818-the pilgrims] and it was echoed under the shadow of Concord monument , “ [He]725-mr. phillips had better not ! ”[1818-the pilgrims]

[We]5009-the sons of the pilgrims would fain express [our]5009-the sons of the pilgrims appreciation of the freedom and steady wisdom , so rare in the reformer , with which [he]725-mr. phillips declared that [he]725-mr. phillips was not born to abolish slavery , but to do right . [We]4999-we have heard a few , a very few , [good political speakers]5011-good political speakers , who afforded [us]4999-we the pleasure of great intellectual power and acuteness , of soldier - like steadiness , and of a graceful and natural oratory ; but in [this man the audience]5012-this man the audience might detect a sort of moral principle and integrity , which was more stable than [their]5012-this man the audience firmness , more discriminating than [his]5012-this man the audience own intellect , and more graceful than [his]5012-this man the audience rhetoric , which was not working for temporary or trivial ends . It is so rare and encouraging to listen to [an orator who is content with another alliance than with [the popular party]5014-the popular party , or even with the sympathizing school of [the martyrs]5015-the martyrs , who can afford sometimes to be [[his]5012-this man the audience own auditor]5016-his own auditor if [the mob]5017-the mob stay away]5013-an orator who is content with another alliance than with the popular party , or even with the sympathizing school of the martyrs , who can afford sometimes to be his own auditor if the mob stay away , and hears [himself]5012-this man the audience without reproof , that [we]4999-we feel [ourselves]4999-we in danger of slandering all mankind by affirming , that here is one , who is at the same time [an eloquent speaker]5018-an eloquent speaker and [a righteous man]5019-a righteous man .

Perhaps , on the whole , the most interesting fact elicited by these addresses , is the readiness of the people at large , of whatever sect or party , to entertain , with good will and hospitality , the most revolutionary and heretical opinions , when frankly and adequately , and in some sort cheerfully , expressed . Such clear and candid declaration of opinion served like [an electuary]5020-an electuary to whet and clarify the intellect of [all parties]5021-all parties , and furnished each one with an additional argument for that right [he]5019-a righteous man asserted .

[We]4999-we consider [Mr. Phillips]725-mr. phillips one of [the most conspicuous and efficient champions of [a true Church and State]5023-a true church and state now in [the field]881-the field]5022-the most conspicuous and efficient champions of a true church and state now in the field , and would say to [him]725-mr. phillips , and such as are like [him]725-mr. phillips , “ [God]554-god speed [you]5025-you . ”[725-mr. phillips] If [you]5025-you know of [any champion in the ranks of [[his]725-mr. phillips opponents , who has the valor and courtesy even of [Paynim chivalry]727-paynim chivalry , if not the Christian graces and refinement of [this knight]5028-this knight]5027-his opponents , who has the valor and courtesy even of paynim chivalry , if not the christian graces and refinement of this knight]5026-any champion in the ranks of his opponents , who has the valor and courtesy even of paynim chivalry , if not the christian graces and refinement of this knight , [you]5029-you will do [us]4999-we a service by directing [him]5028-this knight to [these fields]5030-these fields forthwith , where the lists are now open , and [he]5028-this knight shall be hospitably entertained . For as yet [the Red - cross knight]5031-the red - cross knight has shown [us]4999-we only the gallant device upon [his]5031-the red - cross knight shield , and [his]5031-the red - cross knight admirable command of [his]5031-the red - cross knight steed , prancing and curvetting in the empty lists ; but [we]4999-we wait to see who , in the actual breaking of lances , will come tumbling upon [the plain]4091-the plain .

THE LAST DAYS OF [JOHN BROWN.[12]728-john brown.[12 ]

Footnote 12 :

Read at [North Elba]387-north elba , July 4 , 1860 .

[John Brown]400-brown ’s career for the last six weeks of [his]400-brown life was meteor - like , flashing through the darkness in which [we]4999-we live . [I]0-i know of nothing so miraculous in [our]4999-we history .

If [any person]5357-any person , in a lecture or conversation at that time , cited any ancient example of heroism , such as [Cato]729-cato or Tell or [Winkelried]730-winkelried , passing over the recent deeds and words of [Brown]400-brown , it was felt by [any intelligent audience of Northern men]5034-any intelligent audience of northern men to be tame and inexcusably far - fetched .

For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i commonly attend more to nature than to [man]2119-man , but any affecting human event may blind [our]4999-we eyes to natural objects . [I]0-i was so absorbed in [him]2119-man as to be surprised whenever [I]0-i detected the routine of [the natural world]5036-the natural world surviving still , or met [persons]5520-persons going about [their]5520-persons affairs indifferent . It appeared strange to [me]0-i that the “ little dipper ”[2119-man] should be still diving quietly in [the river]905-the river , as of yore ; and it suggested that this bird might continue to dive here when [Concord]24-concord should be no more .

[I]0-i felt that [he]2119-man , [a prisoner in the midst of [[his]2119-man enemies]5040-his enemies]5039-a prisoner in the midst of his enemies , and under sentence of death , if consulted as to [his]2119-man next step or resource , could answer more wisely than all [[his]2119-man countrymen]5041-his countrymen beside . [He]2119-man best understood [his]2119-man position ; [he]2119-man contemplated it most calmly . Comparatively , [all other men]5042-all other men , [North]312-the north and [South]389-south , were beside [themselves]5042-all other men . [Our]5043-our thoughts could not revert to [any greater or wiser or better man with whom to contrast [him]2119-man , for [he]2119-man , then and there , was above [them]5042-all other men all]5044-any greater or wiser or better man with whom to contrast him , for he , then and there , was above them all . [The man [this country]5239-this country]5045-the man this country was about to hang appeared the greatest and best in it .

Years were not required for a revolution of public opinion ; days , nay hours , produced marked changes in this case . [Fifty who were ready to say on going into [our]5043-our meeting in honor of [him]5045-the man this country in [Concord]24-concord]5047-fifty who were ready to say on going into our meeting in honor of him in concord , that [he]5045-the man this country ought to be hung , would not say it when [they]5047-fifty who were ready to say on going into our meeting in honor of him in concord came out . [They]5047-fifty who were ready to say on going into our meeting in honor of him in concord heard [his]5045-the man this country words read ; [they]5047-fifty who were ready to say on going into our meeting in honor of him in concord saw the earnest faces of [the congregation]5048-the congregation ; and perhaps [they]5047-fifty who were ready to say on going into our meeting in honor of him in concord joined at last in singing the hymn in [his]5045-the man this country praise .

The order of [instructors]5049-instructors was reversed . [I]0-i heard that [one preacher]5050-one preacher , who at first was shocked and stood aloof , felt obliged at last , after [he]5045-the man this country was hung , to make [him]5045-the man this country the subject of a sermon , in which , to some extent , [he]5045-the man this country eulogized [the man]1697-the man , but said that [his]5045-the man this country act was a failure . [An influential class - teacher]5052-an influential class - teacher thought it necessary , after the services , to tell [[his]5045-the man this country grown - up pupils]5053-his grown - up pupils , that at first [he]5045-the man this country thought as [the preacher]5054-the preacher did then , but now [he]5045-the man this country thought that [John Brown]400-brown was right . But it was understood that [[his]400-brown pupils]4172-his pupils were as much ahead of [the teacher]5056-the teacher as [he]400-brown was ahead of [the priest]959-the priest ; and [I]0-i know for a certainty , that [very little boys at [home]867-home]5058-very little boys at home had already asked [[their]5058-very little boys at home parents]5060-their parents , in a tone of surprise , why [God]554-god did not interfere to save [him]554-god . In each case , [the constituted teachers]5061-the constituted teachers were only half conscious that [they]5061-the constituted teachers were not _ leading _ , but being _ dragged _ , with some loss of time and power .

[The more conscientious preachers]5062-the more conscientious preachers , [the Bible men]5063-the bible men , [they]5063-the bible men who talk about principle , and doing to [others]985-others as [you]5065-you would that [they]985-others should do unto you,—how could [they]985-others fail to recognize [him]554-god , by far [the greatest preacher of [them]985-others]5066-the greatest preacher of them all , with the Bible in [his]554-god life and in [his]554-god acts , the embodiment of principle , who actually carried out the golden rule ? [All whose moral sense had been aroused , who had a calling from on high to preach]5067-all whose moral sense had been aroused , who had a calling from on high to preach , sided with [him]554-god . What confessions [he]554-god extracted from the cold and conservative ! It is remarkable , but on the whole it is well , that it did not prove the occasion for a new sect of _ Brownites _ being formed in [our]5068-our midst .

[They]5063-the bible men , whether within [the Church]980-the church or out of it , who adhere to the spirit and let go the letter , and are accordingly called infidel , were as usual foremost to recognize [him]554-god . [Men]1028-men have been hung in [the South]1040-the south before for attempting to rescue [slaves]2543-slaves , and [the North]2638-the north was not much stirred by it . Whence , then , this wonderful difference ? [We]5068-our were not so sure of _ [their]5068-our _ devotion to principle . [We]5068-our made a subtle distinction , forgot human laws , and did homage to an idea . [The North]2638-the north , [I]0-i mean the _ living _ North , was suddenly all transcendental . It went behind the human law , it went behind the apparent failure , and recognized eternal justice and glory . Commonly , [men]1028-men live according to a formula , and are satisfied if the order of law is observed , but in this instance [they]5063-the bible men , to some extent , returned to original perceptions , and there was a slight revival of old religion . [They]5063-the bible men saw that what was called order was confusion , what was called justice , injustice , and that the best was deemed the worst . This attitude suggested a more intelligent and generous spirit than that which actuated [our]5068-our forefathers , and the possibility , in the course of ages , of a revolution in behalf of [another]5076-another and [an oppressed people]5077-an oppressed people .

[Most Northern men]5078-most northern men , and a few Southern ones , were wonderfully stirred by [Brown]400-brown ’s behavior and words . [They]5063-the bible men saw and felt that [they]5063-the bible men were heroic and noble , and that there had been nothing quite equal to [them]5063-the bible men in [their]5063-the bible men kind in [this country]5239-this country , or in the recent history of [the world]741-the world . But [the minority]2675-the minority were unmoved by [them]2675-the minority . [They]2675-the minority were only surprised and provoked by the attitude of [[their]2675-the minority neighbors]5082-their neighbors . [They]2675-the minority saw that [Brown]400-brown was brave , and that [he]400-brown believed that [he]400-brown had done right , but [they]2675-the minority did not detect any further peculiarity in [him]400-brown . Not being accustomed to make fine distinctions , or to appreciate magnanimity , [they]2675-the minority read [his]400-brown letters and speeches as if [they]2675-the minority read [them]2675-the minority not . [They]2675-the minority were not aware when [they]2675-the minority approached a heroic statement,—they did not know when [they]2675-the minority _ burned _ . [They]2675-the minority did not feel that [he]400-brown spoke with authority , and hence [they]2675-the minority only remembered that the _ law _ must be executed . [They]2675-the minority remembered the old formula , but did not hear the new revelation . [The man who does not recognize in [Brown]400-brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to [our]5084-our laws]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws , is [a modern Democrat]5085-a modern democrat . This is the test by which to discover [him]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws . [He]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws is not wilfully but constitutionally blind on this side , and [he]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws is consistent with [himself]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws . Such has been [his]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws past life ; no doubt of it . In like manner [he]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws has read history and [his]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws Bible , and [he]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws accepts , or seems to accept , the last only as an established formula , and not because [he]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws has been convicted by it . [You]5086-you will not find kindred sentiments in [his]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws common - place book , if [he]5083-the man who does not recognize in brown ’s words a wisdom and nobleness , and therefore an authority , superior to our laws has one .

When a noble deed is done , who is likely to appreciate it ? [[They]2675-the minority who are noble [themselves]2675-the minority]5087-they who are noble themselves . [I]0-i was not surprised that certain of [[my]0-i neighbors]2501-my neighbors spoke of [John Brown]400-brown as [an ordinary felon]5089-an ordinary felon , for who are [they]2501-my neighbors ? [They]2501-my neighbors have either much flesh , or much office , or much coarseness of some kind . [They]2501-my neighbors are not ethereal natures in any sense . The dark qualities predominate in [them]2501-my neighbors . [Several of [them]2501-my neighbors]3407-several of them are decidedly pachydermatous . [I]0-i say it in sorrow , not in anger . How can [a man behold the light , who has no answering inward light]5091-a man behold the light , who has no answering inward light ? [They]2501-my neighbors are true to [their]2501-my neighbors _ right _ , but when [they]2501-my neighbors look this way [they]2501-my neighbors _ see _ nothing , [they]2501-my neighbors are blind . For [the children of the light to contend with [them]2501-my neighbors]5092-the children of the light to contend with them is as if there should be a contest between [eagles and owls]5093-eagles and owls . Show [me]0-i [a man who feels bitterly toward [John Brown]400-brown]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown , and let [me]0-i hear what noble verse [he]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown can repeat . [He]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown ’ll be as dumb as if [his]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown lips were stone .

It is not [every man who can be [a Christian]5096-a christian , even in a very moderate sense , whatever education [you]5097-you give [him]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown]5095-every man who can be a christian , even in a very moderate sense , whatever education you give him . It is a matter of constitution and temperament , after all . [He]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown may have to be born again many times . [I]0-i have known [many a man who pretended to be [a Christian]5096-a christian , in whom it was ridiculous , for [he]5094-a man who feels bitterly toward john brown had no genius for it]5098-many a man who pretended to be a christian , in whom it was ridiculous , for he had no genius for it . It is not [every man who can be [a freeman]5101-a freeman]5100-every man who can be a freeman , even .

[Editors]731-editors persevered for a good while in saying that [Brown]400-brown was crazy ; but at last [they]5102-they said only that it was “ a crazy scheme , ”[400-brown] and the only evidence brought to prove it was that it cost [him]400-brown [his]400-brown life . [I]0-i have no doubt that if [he]400-brown had gone with [five thousand men]5103-five thousand men , liberated [a thousand slaves]5104-a thousand slaves , killed [a hundred or two slaveholders]5105-a hundred or two slaveholders , and had as many more killed on [his]400-brown own side , but not lost [his]400-brown own life , [these same editors]5106-these same editors would have called it by a more respectable name . Yet [he]400-brown has been far more successful than that . [He]400-brown has liberated [many thousands of [slaves]2543-slaves]5107-many thousands of slaves , [both North and South]5109-both north and south . [They]5109-both north and south seem to have known nothing about living or dying for a principle . [They]5109-both north and south all called [him]400-brown crazy then ; who calls [him]400-brown crazy now ?

All through the excitement occasioned by [his]400-brown remarkable attempt and subsequent behavior , [the Massachusetts Legislature]5110-the massachusetts legislature , not taking any steps for the defence of [[her]5111-her citizens who were likely to be carried to [Virginia]195-virginia as [witnesses]5113-witnesses and exposed to the violence of [a slaveholding mob]5114-a slaveholding mob]5112-her citizens who were likely to be carried to virginia as witnesses and exposed to the violence of a slaveholding mob , was wholly absorbed in a liquor - agency question , and indulging in poor jokes on the word “ extension . ”[5115-bad spirits] [Bad spirits]5115-bad spirits occupied [their]5115-bad spirits thoughts . [I]0-i am sure that [no statesman]5116-no statesman up to the occasion could have attended to that question at all at that time,—a very vulgar question to attend to at any time !

When [I]0-i looked into a liturgy of [the Church of [England]31-england]390-the church of england , printed near the end of the last century , in order to find a service applicable to the case of [Brown]400-brown , [I]0-i found that [the only martyr]5117-the only martyr recognized and provided for by it was [King Charles the First]732-king charles the first , an eminent scamp . Of [all the inhabitants of [England]31-england]5118-all the inhabitants of england and of [the world]741-the world , [he]732-king charles the first was the only one , according to this authority , whom [that church]3144-that church had made a martyr and saint of ; and for more than a century it had celebrated [his]732-king charles the first martyrdom , so called , by an annual service . What a satire on [the Church]980-the church is that !

Look not to legislatures and churches for [your]5122-your guidance , nor to [any soulless _ incorporated _ bodies]5123-any soulless _ incorporated _ bodies , but to _ in - spirited _ or inspired ones .

What avail all [your]5122-your scholarly accomplishments and learning , compared with wisdom and manhood ? To omit [his]732-king charles the first other behavior , see what a work [this comparatively unread and unlettered man]5124-this comparatively unread and unlettered man wrote within six weeks . Where is [[our]5125-our professor of _ belles]5126-our professor of _ belles - lettres _ or of logic and rhetoric , who can write so well ? [He]5126-our professor of _ belles wrote in [prison]2399-prison , not a History of [the World]741-the world , like [Raleigh]625-raleigh , but an American book which [I]0-i think will live longer than that . [I]0-i do not know of such words , uttered under such circumstances , and so copiously withal , in Roman or English or any history . What a variety of themes [he]5126-our professor of _ belles touched on in that short space ! There are words in that letter to [[his]5126-our professor of _ belles wife]1341-his wife , respecting the education of [[his]5126-our professor of _ belles daughters]5130-his daughters , which deserve to be framed and hung over every mantel - piece in [the land]834-the land . Compare this earnest wisdom with that of [Poor Richard]726-frederick .

The death of [Irving]639-edward irving , which at any other time would have attracted universal attention , having occurred while these things were transpiring , went almost unobserved . [I]0-i shall have to read of it in the biography of [authors]5132-authors .

[Literary gentlemen]5133-literary gentlemen , [editors]2942-editors , and [critics]5135-critics , think that [they]5133-literary gentlemen know how to write , because [they]5133-literary gentlemen have studied grammar and rhetoric ; but [they]5133-literary gentlemen are egregiously mistaken . The _ art _ of composition is as simple as the discharge of a bullet from a rifle , and its masterpieces imply an infinitely greater force behind [them]5133-literary gentlemen . [This unlettered man]5136-this unlettered man ’s speaking and writing are standard English . Some words and phrases deemed vulgarisms and Americanisms before , [he]5136-this unlettered man has made standard American ; such as “ _ It will pay _ . ”[5136-this unlettered man] It suggests that the one great rule of composition,—and if [I]0-i were a professor of rhetoric [I]0-i should insist on this,—is , to _ speak the truth _ . This first , this second , this third ; pebbles in [your]5137-your mouth or not . This demands earnestness and manhood chiefly .

[We]5138-we seem to have forgotten that the expression , a _ liberal _ education , originally meant among [the Romans one worthy of _ free _ men]5139-the romans one worthy of _ free _ men ; while the learning of trades and professions by which to get [your]5137-your livelihood merely was considered worthy of _ slaves _ only . But taking a hint from the word , [I]0-i would go a step further , and say , that it is not [the man of wealth and leisure]5140-the man of wealth and leisure simply , though devoted to art , or science , or literature , who , in a true sense , is _ liberally _ educated , but only [the earnest and free man]5141-the earnest and free man . In [a slaveholding country]5142-a slaveholding country like this , there can be no such thing as a _ liberal _ education tolerated by [the State]816-the state ; and [those scholars of [Austria]319-austria and [France]116-france who , however learned [they]5144-those scholars of austria and france who , however learned they may be , are contented under their tyrannies may be , are contented under [their]5144-those scholars of austria and france who , however learned they may be , are contented under their tyrannies tyrannies]5144-those scholars of austria and france who , however learned they may be , are contented under their tyrannies , have received only a _ servile _ education .

Nothing could [[his]5136-this unlettered man enemies]5040-his enemies do , but it redounded to [his]5136-this unlettered man infinite advantage,—that is , to the advantage of [his]5136-this unlettered man cause . [They]5040-his enemies did not hang [him]5136-this unlettered man at once , but reserved [him]5136-this unlettered man to preach to [them]5040-his enemies . And then there was another great blunder . [They]5040-his enemies did not hang [[his]5136-this unlettered man four followers]5146-his four followers with [him]5136-this unlettered man ; that scene was still postponed ; and so [his]5136-this unlettered man victory was prolonged and completed . [No theatrical manager]5147-no theatrical manager could have arranged things so wisely to give effect to [his]5136-this unlettered man behavior and words . And who , think [you]5148-you , _ was _ [the manager]5149-the manager ? _ Who _ placed [the slave - woman]5150-the slave - woman and [[her]5150-the slave - woman child]5151-her child , whom [he]5136-this unlettered man stooped to kiss for a symbol , between [[his]5136-this unlettered man prison]5152-his prison and [the gallows]5153-the gallows ?

[We]5154-we soon saw , as [he]5136-this unlettered man saw , that [he]5136-this unlettered man was not to be pardoned or rescued by [men]1028-men . That would have been to disarm [him]5136-this unlettered man , to restore to [him]5136-this unlettered man a material weapon , a Sharpe ’s rifle , when [he]5136-this unlettered man had taken up the sword of the spirit,—the sword with which [he]5136-this unlettered man has really won [his]5136-this unlettered man greatest and most memorable victories . Now [he]5136-this unlettered man has not laid aside the sword of the spirit , for [he]5136-this unlettered man is pure spirit [himself]5136-this unlettered man , and [his]5136-this unlettered man sword is pure spirit also .

“ [He]5136-this unlettered man nothing common did or mean Upon that memorable scene , [Nor]629-moses norris called [the gods]2775-the gods with vulgar spite , To vindicate [his]5136-this unlettered man helpless right ; But bowed [his]5136-this unlettered man comely head Down as upon a bed . ”[5154-we]

What a transit was that of [his]5136-this unlettered man horizontal body alone , but just cut down from the gallows - tree ! [We]5154-we read , that at such a time it passed through [Philadelphia]346-philadelphia , and by Saturday night had reached [New York]45-new york . Thus , like a meteor it shot through the Union from [the Southern regions]5156-the southern regions toward [the North]312-the north ! [No such freight]5157-no such freight had [the cars]789-the cars borne since [they]789-the cars carried [him]5136-this unlettered man Southward alive .

On the day of [his]5136-this unlettered man translation , [I]0-i heard , to be sure , that [he]5136-this unlettered man was _ hung _ , but [I]0-i did not know what that meant ; [I]0-i felt no sorrow on that account ; but not for a day or two did [I]0-i even _ hear _ that [he]5136-this unlettered man was _ dead _ , and not after any number of days shall [I]0-i believe it . Of [all the men who were said to be [[my]0-i contemporaries]4668-my contemporaries]5159-all the men who were said to be my contemporaries , it seemed to [me]0-i that [John Brown]400-brown was the only one who _ had not died _ . [I]0-i never hear of [a man named [Brown]400-brown]5161-a man named brown now,—and [I]0-i hear of [them]5159-all the men who were said to be my contemporaries pretty often,—I never hear of [any particularly brave and earnest man]5162-any particularly brave and earnest man , but [my]0-i first thought is of [John Brown]400-brown , and what relation [he]400-brown may be to [him]400-brown . [I]0-i meet [him]400-brown at every turn . [He]400-brown is more alive than ever [he]400-brown was . [He]400-brown has earned immortality . [He]400-brown is not confined to [North Elba]387-north elba nor to [Kansas]307-kansas . [He]400-brown is no longer working in secret . [He]400-brown works in public , and in the clearest light that shines on [this land]5163-this land .

THE END .

1.F.3 . LIMITED RIGHT OF REPLACEMENT OR REFUND - If [you]5166-you discover a defect in this electronic work within 90 days of receiving it , [you]5166-you can receive a refund of the money ( if any ) [you]5166-you paid for it by sending a written explanation to the person [you]5166-you received the work from . If [you]5166-you received the work on a physical medium , [you]5166-you must return the medium with [your]5166-you written explanation . [The person]5192-the person or entity that provided [you]5166-you with the defective work may elect to provide a replacement copy in lieu of a refund . If [you]5166-you received the work electronically , [the person]5192-the person or entity providing it to [you]5166-you may choose to give [you]5166-you a second opportunity to receive the work electronically in lieu of a refund . If the second copy is also defective , [you]5166-you may demand a refund in writing without further opportunities to fix the problem .

1.F.4 . Except for the limited right of replacement or refund set forth in paragraph 1.F.3 , this work is provided to [you]5166-you “ AS - IS ”[None-None] , WITH NO OTHER WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND , EXPRESS OR IMPLIED , INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR ANY PURPOSE .

The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision of this agreement shall not void the remaining provisions .

1.F.6 . Section 2 . Information about the Mission of Project Gutenberg ™

Project Gutenberg ™ is synonymous with the free distribution of electronic works in formats readable by the widest variety of computers including obsolete , old , middle - aged and new computers . It exists because of the efforts of hundreds of [volunteers]5201-volunteers and donations from [people]3564-people in all walks of life .

[Volunteers]5201-volunteers and financial support to provide [volunteers]5201-volunteers with the assistance [they]5201-volunteers need are critical to reaching [Project Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ 's goals and ensuring that the Project Gutenberg ™ collection will remain freely available for generations to come . In 2001 , [the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation]5181-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation was created to provide a secure and permanent future for [Project Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ and [future generations]5206-future generations . To learn more about [the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation]5181-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation and how [your]5166-you efforts and donations can help , see Sections 3 and 4 and the Foundation information page at www.gutenberg.org

Section 4 . Information about Donations to [the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation

Project Gutenberg]5214-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation project gutenberg ™ depends upon and can not survive without widespread public support and donations to carry out its mission of increasing the number of public domain and licensed works that can be freely distributed in machine - readable form accessible by the widest array of equipment including outdated equipment . Many small donations ( $ 1 to $ 5,000 ) are particularly important to maintaining tax exempt status with [the IRS]5215-the irs .

[The Foundation]5171-the foundation is committed to complying with the laws regulating charities and charitable donations in [all 50 states of [the United States]2-the united states]5217-all 50 states of the united states . Compliance requirements are not uniform and it takes a considerable effort , much paperwork and many fees to meet and keep up with these requirements . [We]5218-we do not solicit donations in locations where [we]5218-we have not received written confirmation of compliance . To SEND DONATIONS or determine the status of compliance for any particular state visit www.gutenberg.org/donate

While [we]5218-we can not and do not solicit contributions from states where [we]5218-we have not met the solicitation requirements , [we]5218-we know of no prohibition against accepting unsolicited donations from donors in [such states who approach [us]5218-we with offers to donate]5219-such states who approach us with offers to donate .

International donations are gratefully accepted , but [we]5218-we can not make any statements concerning tax treatment of donations received from outside [the United States]2-the united states . U.S. laws alone swamp [[our]5218-we small staff]5220-our small staff .

Please check the Project Gutenberg web pages for current donation methods and addresses . Donations are accepted in a number of other ways including checks , online payments and credit card donations . To donate , please visit : www.gutenberg.org/donate

Section 5 . General Information About Project [Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ electronic works

[Professor Michael S. Hart]738-professor michael s. hart was the originator of the Project [Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ concept of a library of electronic works that could be freely shared with [anyone]5221-anyone . For forty years , [he]738-professor michael s. hart produced and distributed [Project Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ eBooks with only a loose network of volunteer support .

Project Gutenberg ™ eBooks are often created from several printed editions , all of which are confirmed as not protected by copyright in the U.S. unless a copyright notice is included . Thus , [we]5218-we do not necessarily keep eBooks in compliance with any particular paper edition .

[Most people]5222-most people start at [our]5218-we website which has [the main PG search facility]5223-the main pg search facility : www.gutenberg.org

This website includes information about [Project Gutenberg]735-project gutenberg ™ , including how to make donations to [the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation]5181-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation , how to help produce [our]5218-we new eBooks , and how to subscribe to [our]5218-we email newsletter to hear about new eBooks .
